loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Juana V. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La mujeres de este grupo se organizaron y realizaron varias actividades para consolidar el grupo, y actualmente todas cuentan con su negocio o actividad que le genere ingreso.

La sra. Gasparina R. Mirandas es artesana en sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cintas, cuero, etc), logrando de ese modo ofrecer una buena variedad de sombreros a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria Gloria V. se dedica a la artesanía de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cintas, pegamentos, etc), logrando de ese modo obtener mayor variedad de trabajos en karanday  para a ofrecer a su clientela.

La sra. Liz Nathalia V. se dedica a la venta de Joyas de plata, invirtió el dinero en la compra de joyas de plata en general, obteniendo así mayor variedad de Joyas de plata que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Juana V. se dedica al trabajo en artesanía de karanday invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( hilo, cueros, karanday, ect), logrando de ese  modo ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías a su clientela.

La sra. Fidelina Ortiz se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante                , invirtió el dinero en la compra de los remedios refrescantes y  elementos para su trabajo, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad de remedio refrescante que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Angela B. se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de remedios refrescantes a sus clientes. 

La sra. Norma Estela P. se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( tela , hilos, goma), ofreciendo así un buenas prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Simeona B. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad de minutas a su clientela.

La sra. Clara Manuela M. se dedica a la artesnía en karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( karanday, cueros, pegamentos, etc), logrando ofrecer buenos trabajos para sus clientes.

La sra. Pelagia Bogadoposee una despensa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general (embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, panificados), logrando así  ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías  a sus clientes.

La sra. Catalina J. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando de eso modo ofrecer variadas minutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Nicolaza Elizabeth O. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de minutas a su clientela.

La sra. Limpia Carolina V. se dedica a la artesanía en karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cueros),logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad de trabajos en karanday a sus clientes.

La sra. Jorgelina R. se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de prendas de vestir en general, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Ana Maria C. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad de minutas a sus clientes. 

La sra. Evarista I.  Riveros se dedica a la artesanía en karanday , invirtió el dinero compra de materiales para su trabajo ( karanday, hilo, cuero) logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de trabajo en karanday a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The point person who started this committee was señora Juana V., who invited and organized her friends to start the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women). The women of this group organized and carried out various activities to consolidate the group, and currently all of them have businesses or activities that generate income. Sra. Gasparina R. Mirandas is an artisan who makes karanday (a plant native to Paraguay) hats. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, belts, leather etc.), thus being able to offer a considerable variety of hats to her customers. Sra. Maria Gloria V. makes her living in the artisasnship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, belts, adhesives etc.) thus being able to obtain a greater variety of works in karanday to offer to her customers. Sra. Liz Nathalia V. makes her living selling silver jewelery. She invested the money in the general purchase of silver jewelery, thus obtaining a greater variety of silver jewelery to offer to her customers. Sra. Juana V. makes her living working in the artisanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguary). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (thread, leather, karanday etc.) thus being able to offer a considerable variety of merchandise to her customers. Sra. Fidelina Ortiz makes her living selling herbal remedies. She invested the money in the purchase of herbal remedies and supplies for her business, thus being able to offer a variety of quality herbal remedies to her customers. Sra. Angela B. makes her living selling herbal remedies. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her business, thus being able to offer a considerable variety of herbal remedies to her customers. Sra. Norma Estela P. makes her living as a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her business (fabric, thread, adhesives) thus being able to offer quality garments to her customers. Sra. Simeona B. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients for making her dishes, allowing her to offer a variety of quality snacks to her customers. Sra. Clara Manuela M. makes her living in the artisanship of karanday (a native plant of Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her craft (karanday, leather, adhesives etc.) allowing her to offer quality works to her customers. Sra. Pelagia B. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (cold measts, dairy products, beverages, bakery products) thus allowing her to offer a considerable vareity of merchandise to her customers. Sra. Catalina J. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, thus allowing her to offer a variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Nicolaza Elizabeth O. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, allowing her to offer a variety of quality snacks to her customers. Sra. Limpia Carolina V. makes her living in the artinsanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, leather), allowing her to offer a considerable variety of karanday works to her customers. Sra. Jorgelina R. makes her living selling clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of general garments, thus being able to offer a considerable variety of clothing to her customers. Sra. Ana Maria C. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in teh purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, thus allowing her to offer a considerable variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Evarista I. Riveros makes in living in the artisanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, thread, leather) thus being able to offer a considerable variety of works in karanday to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for work, belts, leather.

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr: Saly S. est âgée de 59 ans, elle veuve et vit avec ses 6 enfants en charge. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO et a été 8 fois été bénéficiaire de prêts. Son crédit lui permettra de développer un petit commerce de friperie. Une activité qui lui produit des bénéficies lui offrant la possibilité de subvenir à ses besoins et de prendre en charge sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Saly S. is a 59-year old widow. She lives with her six dependent children. She has been member of the Village Bank of MBORO for four years and has obtained loans eight times. Her loan will allow her to launch a small business in secondhand clothing. This will allow her to obtain the income necessary to support herself and her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing a second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
la señora Maria Petrona F. tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Ubence Reina quien se dedica a la albañileria, a esta edad ningun hijos depende de ellos.
 
la señora F. se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad,  sus ventas son todos los dias de la semana.
 
Maria esta solicitando el credito para compra de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y camarones.
en estas fechas que se aproxima semana santa el pescado es muy vendido y quiere estar bien preperada para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
Maria es una persona muy responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married to Ubence, who works as a mason. At their ages they have no dependent children. Maria has been selling fish and shrimp, seven days a week, for four years. Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy white fish, red fish, and shrimp. Fish sells very well during the approaching holy week and she would like to be well prepared to meet her customers’ needs. Maria is a very responsible, honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Secundina is the coordinator of her group, MuJ. Con Esperanza (Women with Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Secundina’s group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their child.

Secundina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business repairing and building furniture by purchasing materials for building cabinets, bed bases and dressers.

Secundina will use the profits to further invest in her business by purchasing her own location for her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy materials to build cabinets, bed bases and dressers

loans.name: Lucia Guillermina

texts.es:
la señora Lucia Guillermina E. M. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Manuel Aguilar, quien labora en su casa atendiendo un molino para moler maiz y Lucia se dedica
a la  elaboarcion y venta de tortillas.
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y le ha ido muy bien.
han logrado hacer su casa de bloque, antes su casa era de vajareque. 
tiene muchos deseos de suparacion y de seguir luchando en la vida por su familia.
Lucia esta solicitando el credito para la compra de maiz, cal y leña
 
su deseo es graduar a su hija de sus estudios, misma que le ayuda con la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 48 years old and lives with Manuel, who works milling corn from their home. Lucia makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this for the past five years and has been doing so well that they have been able to build a cinderblock home. She has a great desire to for her family to succeed in life. Lucia is requesting this loan to invest in dried corn, salt and firewood. She wants her daughter, who also helps her with tortilla making, to graduate from school.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dried corn, salt, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 8 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO et a 8 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle développe une activité agricole en produisant des pépinières de légumes tels que des plans de tomates d'oignons de choux pommés etc... C'est une activité qu'elle maîtrise pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 55-year old woman and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of MBORO for eight years and has obtained loans eight times in the past. She is engaged in agricultural activity, keeping a vegetable garden where she grows tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, and so on. She knows this work well as she has been doing it for a number of years. Her goal is to help her husband meet the family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agricultural business

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Divino Niño Jesús del barrio San Juan de la ciudad de Luque, se formo gracias a que una de las integrantes se entero del programa del comité por una amiga suya y se acerco a la Fundación  informarse mejor para poder iniciar un nuevo comité en su barrio, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el sexto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.
Las actividades que ellas realizan se detallan a continuación.

La señora Deborath A. se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de sus venta.

La señora Noelia G. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Myrian R. es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración y venta de sus prendas.

María Elena V. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Julia R. J. tiene un kiosko en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comestible y en golosinas y bebidas varias.

María Juana F. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Limpia G. tiene un kiosko en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comestible y en golosinas y bebidas varias.

La señora Carmen M. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Gloria P. se dedica productos de limpieza e invirtió el dinero en la compra de químicos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos.

La señora Ildefonsa Díaz es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración y venta de sus prendas.

La señora Tania A. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió el dinero en la compra de helados de varios gustos para el incremento de su negocio.

María Ross Mary O. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

María Rocio Díaz N. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Margarita G. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Lorena S. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Salvadora S. Díaz se dedica a la venta de comestible y bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The committee, Women Divine Baby Jesus of the neighborhood San Juan of the city of Luque was formed thanks to one of the members who found out about the committee program by a friend of hers who went to the foundation (Kiva’s field partner) to be better informed and to form a new committee in her neighborhood. At present, the committee is in its sixth loan, the Committee of Enterprising Women of the Foundation of Paraguay is comprised of 16 members that invest in different activities.

The activities that they do are detailed in the below.

Mrs. Deborath A. sells haberdashery and invested the money to buy various merchandize to increase her sales.

Mrs. Noelia G. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Myrian R. is a dressmaker and invested the money to buy products such as fabric and thread to make and sell her clothing.

María Elena V. sells foodstuff and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Julia R. J. has a kiosk in her home and invested the money to buy raw materials to prepare food and to buy candy and various drinks.

María Juana F. invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Limpia G. has a kiosk in her home and invested the money to buy raw materials to prepare food and to buy candy and various drinks.

Mrs. Carmen M. has a small store and invested the money to buy merchandize wholesale to increase her business.

Mrs. Gloria P. sells cleaning products and invested the money to buy chemicals to make and sell her products.

Mrs. Ildefonsa Díaz is a dressmaker and invested the money to buy products such as fabric and thread to make and sell her clothing.

Mrs. Tania A. sells ice-cream and invested the money to buy ice-cream in various flavors to increase her business.

Mrs. Ross Mary O. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. María Rocio Díaz N. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Margarita G. has a small store and invested the money to buy the merchandize wholesale to increase her business earnings.

Mrs. Lorena S. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Salvadora S. Díaz sells foodstuffs and beverages and invested the money to buy raw materials to make and sell the food.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize such as: disks for empanadas, meats, condiments,  baked goods, vegetables, napkins, cloth and thread, sodas, beers, charcoal, rice, sugar, flour, herbal medicines, milk, chemicals to make cleaning product, ice-cream among other items.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 51 años edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que obtiene por medio de Fundación León 2000, ya que es por medio de los financiamientos que su negocio ha mejorado notablemente. Ella posee una amplia variedad de  clientes que le solicitan sus diferentes productos como son calzados, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y perfumes a pesar de su edad sabe muy bien hablar con sus clientes y ellos siempre le piden consejos por su edad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and she sells general merchandise; because of her business, this is not the first loan that she requests from Fundación León 200; through these loans, her business has improved considerably. She has a wide variety of customers that request her different products such as shoes, dresses, pants, shirts, and perfumes; in spite of her age, she can communicate really well with her customers, and they always seek her advice because of her age. The loan will be invested to buy raw materials. Her wish is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working  capital

loans.name: Blanca Rosibel

texts.es:
la señora Blanca C. L. tiene 25 años de edad,  es soltera y estudia en la universidad.
blanca se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. en estos momentos esta solicitando el credito para comprar calzado escolar y ropa para la epoca de verano.
la ciudad de san lorenzo es bien caliente y muchas personas se visten de calsonetas y camisetas por el calor, mas que se aproxima la semana santa se pone mas caliente el ambiente.
Blanca no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres. con  las ganancias que obtenga le serviran para ayudar en la casa de sus padres economicamente y para sus estudios.
su mayor deseo es graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca C. L. is 25 years old, single and goes to college. Blanca sells shoes and clothes. She is currently requesting a loan to buy school shoes and clothes for the summer season. The city of San Lorenzo is very hot and many people wear shorts and t-shirts because of the heat; additionally, Easter week is around the corner and the weather gets even hotter. Blanca does not have any children and lives with her parents. The profits will help her to contribute financially to her parents’ household and with her schooling. Her biggest wish is to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school shoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Sr. German tiene 31 años esta casado con la Sra. Carolina Candia  de 31 años que  es docente, poseen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
El señor anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de diarios, su hermano que es mecánico profesional lo llevo a trabajar con el enseñándole  la profesión, actualmente posee un taller mecánico con su  local propio con clientela formada. Para el futuro desea ampliar su taller comprando mas herramientas ya que cuenta con muchos clientes.
El préstamo que solicito fue invertido en la compra  de lubricantes, aceites para camiones etc.
texts.en:
Mr. German is 31 years old and is married to Mrs. Carolina Candia who is 31 years old and is a teacher; they have two daughters that go to school. German used to sell newspapers; his brother, who is a professional mechanic, took him to his work and taught him the trade. German now has a repair shop in his own establishment with many customers. In the future, he wants to expand his shop by buying more tools since he has many customers. The loan he is requesting will be invested in buying lubricants, oil for trucks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lubricants, oil for trucks, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Francisco A. I. tiene 59 años de edad, es casado. Francisco se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 14 años. su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio morazan de la ciudad de Nacaome.
según algunas fuentes don francisco siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de pan con la diferencia que ahora el tiene su propio carro y traslada su producto para vender por las diferentes aldeas, caserios, barrios y colonias de esta ciudad.
ahora tiene una mayor demanda en la venta de su pan.
su mayor sueño es tener su propia fabrica de pan para poder emplear a muchas personas y asi obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. I. is 59 years old and is married. Francisco has been selling bread for 14 years. His business is located in the neighborhood of Morazán, in the city of Nacaome. According to some sources, Mr. Francisco has always been selling bread with the difference that now he has his own car, and he can transport his product to sell in the various villages, hamlets, and neighborhoods of this city. He now has a higher demand for his bread. His biggest dream is to have his own bakery to employ many people and earn better profits from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clementina I. V.D. P. tiene 60 años y quedo viuda hace diez años, cuenta con tres hijos mayores Rossana Docente, Marlene Abogada y Jimmy cursando actualmente el 3º año D. la carrera D. Derecho.
Anteriormente poseían una despensa en su domicilio que no pudo mas mantener cuando quedo viuda, con los años y con los prestamos D. la fundación se dedico a la venta D. joyas y también trabaja en Centro Nacional del Quemado en al ciudad D. Aregua en el área D.  cocina. 
Posee varios clientes en dicho local lo cual hace que todavía se dedique a la venta D. joyas.
Le gustaría para mas adelante abrir una mercería en su domicilio ya que dentro D. poco se jubilara del centro en donD. trabaja.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clementina I. Vda. (widow) D. P. is 60 years old and became a widow 10 years ago; she has three adult children: Rossana (teacher), Marlene (lawyer) and Jimmy (3rd year in law school). She used to have a store at her house but could not keep up with it when she became a widow; after a few years and with the loans from the foundation, she started selling jewelry; she also works in the kitchen of the Centro Nacional del Quemado (national burn center). She has several customers at the burn center that help her to continue selling jewelry. Looking ahead, she would like to open a notions store at her house since she will be retiring very soon from the center where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Abilio Esteban

texts.es: Abilio tiene 67 años, este gran empresario tiene la actividad económica de venta de tortillas y leña. El tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su jornada empieza a las 5 de la mañana, porque todos sus vecinos en su comarca lo conocen por la buena calidad de tortillas que ofrece ya que cuando inicio fue hace 20 años, el es un buen administrador pues ha demostrado que con lo poco que obtiene de ganancia lo invierte nuevamente en su actividad y con el paso del tiempo se fue dando cuenta que los financiamientos han sido de gran importancia para sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueña con algún día mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Albilio is 67-years-old. This businessman sells tortillas and firewood. He has six children, all of whom work independently. His day begins at five in the morning because all his neighbors in his region know him for his high-quality tortillas that he sells because he has been in business for 20 years. He is a good manager and has demonstrated that he can use the little that he earns to invest back into his business. Over time he has realized that financing has been very important to keeping his business going. He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials. He dreams of one day being able to improve the conditions of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raw materials for tortillas and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 6 ans et a eu 12 expériences avec le Crédit. Elle développe une activité d'embouche porcine et ovine. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes dépenses de la famille et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mboro for the last six years and had obtained 12 loans in the past. Her business is raising pigs and sheep. Her goal is to contribute to the family budget, helping her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building her animal-raising business

loans.name: Maria Daniela

texts.es: La señora Maria Daniela O. es separada, vive en casa propia tiene 3 hijas. La misma cuenta con un puesto de comidas en el mercado de san Lorenzo en el patio municipal, se dedica a dicho rubro hace mas de 10 años, cuenta con 2 puestos en donde posee una buena clientela formada a la fecha, teniendo un promedio de ventas de más de 50 platos diarios , además vende desayunos y medias mañanas para dichos clientes. A la fecha la titular ha retirado un préstamo para la compra de un nuevo local pero en esta ocasión para ventas de ropas ya que la misma le estaría dando un mejor ingreso mensual para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Daniela O. is separated; she lives in her own home and has 3 daughters. She has a food stall in the San Lorenzo market in the municipal park. She has done this work for over 10 years, she has 2 places and she has a good customer base to this day. Mrs. O. has daily average sales of more than 50 plates, as she sells breakfast and mid-morning food for her customers. To this day she has a loan to buy a new stall, as she wishes to sell clothing and it would allow greater monthly income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new stall to sell clothing.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
la señora Maria de la Cruz R. tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda con 5 hijos, tres varones y dos mujeres Maria tiene un año de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. todos los dias abre muy temprano y cierra como a las 9 de la noche.
para surtir su negocio viaja a comprar la mercaderia ya que es mas barato en la ciudad de Choluteca luego la transporta hacia su casa de habitacion. el credito lo esta solicitando para comprar varios productos al por mayor y asi tener que viajar menos, ya que esto le genera gastos..
tambien desea comprar utiles escolares como lapices, cuadernos, borradores, marcadores etc ya que su negocio se encuentra frente al colegio.
las ventas suben bastante durante la epoca escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de la Cruz R. is 48 years old; she is a widow with 5 children, 3 males and 2 women. Maria has had her business for about a year, which is located in a room in her home. Everyday she opens very early and closes about 9 p.m.

To stock her business, Maria, travels to buy the merchandize since it is cheaper in the city of Choluteca and later she transports it to her home. The loan will be used to buy various products wholesale, and that way she will have to travel less, since that incurs some expenses.

She also wishes to buy school supplies like pencils, notebooks, erasers, markers, etc. since her business is in front of a school.

Sales increase a lot during school season.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fat, spaghetti, spices, churros, refreshments, oil, beans, tortillas, bread, cookies, juices, sugar, rice, cereal, soups, tablets, soaps, and toilet paper.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar A. C. , tiene 45 años , es soltero, pero tiene (1) un  hijo, mayor de edad el cual vive con la madre.
El mismo posee 2 automovil “taxi” uno el mismo lo conduce y el otro lo alquila con los mismo presta servicio lo cual le ayuda a generar mayor  ingresos.
El sr. Cesar A. C. desea invertir el préstamo, el la reparación de unos de los automóviles.
Agradece a la Fundación por gracias a ella pudo adquirir unos de los vehículos.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar A. C. is 45 years old, he is single but has one son, who is grown up and lives with his mother.

Mr. C. has two automobile taxis, one he drives himself and the other is rented out which helps him have greater earnings.

Mr. Cesar A. C. wants to use the loan to repair one of the cars. He is grateful to the Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) since thanks to them he was able to acquire one of the cars.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair automobile taxis.

loans.name: G.s El Arca De Noe Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Arca De Noé II está conformado por Petrona y Maria Gerarda. Ambas se dedican a la venta de granos básicos. Petrona tiene 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, y lo realiza en su vivienda, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo es por eso que no quiere dejar de trabajar pues tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Y su amiga Gerarda se dedica a lo mismo la venta de granos básicos, ya que con la ayuda de ella hizo posible, por salir adelante con su hijo porque su esta actividad  le proporciono lo necesario. Por lo que el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que servirá para la compra de cada uno de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Cooperative Group Noah’s Arc II, is comprised of Petrona and Maria Gerarda. Both sell basic grains. Petrona has worked in this business for some 12 years and she does it in her home, she has 2 children who she takes care of and it’s because of them that she does not want to stop working since she has to give her children a good start in life. Her friend, Gerarda sells the same things, basic grains, and with her friend’s help she has her own business, she does her best to give her son the opportunity to get ahead in life because this activity allows her to do so. The loan will be used as work capital to buy each of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Emigdio Simon

texts.es:
El  sr. Emigdio C. tiene 50 años y esta casado con la sra. Victorina Mendoza. De 46 años, tienen 6 hijos, 4 varones  de  24 , 20 , 18 y 14 años y dos hijas de 22 y 16 años, los tres hijos mayores trabajan actualmente y aportan a la canasta familiar y los  menores están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
El sr. Emigdio se dedica desde hace 26 años al fraccionamiento y venta de carbón vegetal. Dichos productos compra de diferentes ciudades del interior del país  y los vende fraccionado en bolsas de papel  de 2 kg y en bolsas de hule de 1 kg.
Dichos productos vende a comercios de la zona  de Villa Elisa  y  Ñemby .
El préstamo. Solicitado desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de carbón para obtener de esa  manera  menor precio de costo por su producto y mayor ganancia por la venta de sus mercaderías
texts.en:
Mr. Emigdio C. is 50 years old and is married to Mrs. Victorina Mendoza who is 46 years old; they have 6 children, 4 boys of 24, 20, 18 and 14 years old and two daughters who are 22 and 16 years old. The three eldest boys work and contribute to the household account and the youngest are in secondary school.

Mr. Emigdio for 26 years has worked cutting and selling charcoal. He buys the products in different cities in the interior of the country and sells them by distributing them in paper bags of 2 kg and in rubber bags of 1 kg.

The products mentioned are sold in businesses in the area of Villa Elisa y Ñemby.

The loan requested will be used to buy greater quantities of charcoal so that this way he can buy it at a cheaper price and earn greater profits for his merchandize.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal in large quantities to cut and sell it.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Don Tomas de 52 años de edad habita en la Comarca Kurinwasito jurisdiccion de El Ayote, es casado con la Sra. Flora Guerrero con quien tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 16 años, otro de 12 y el menor de 10 años estudiando la primaria; Tomas es pequeño productor desde hace mas de 20 años, se dedica al cuido de ganado y de su finca con el apoyo de su familia, esta solicitando su 1er credito para retener 7 terneros con el objetivo de engordarlos y desarrollarlos para venderlos a un mejor precio, y asi obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de la familia.  El mayor sueño de don Tomas es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
Don. Tomas is 52 years old and lives in the region of Kurinwasito district of El Ayote. He is married to Mrs. Flora Guerrero with whom he has 3 children, the oldest is 16 years old followed by a 12 year old and the youngest is 10, and in primary school. Tomas is a small producer and for more than 20 years he has taken care of cattle in his ranch with the help of his family. He needs his first loan to retain 7 calves and plans to fatten them up and nurture them to sell them at a better price and that way have greater earnings that will allow him to improve his family’s way of life. Tomas’ biggest wish is that his children go to school and become decent useful people.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retain calves.

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer Group

texts.en:
Marisol is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Para Vencer (United to Succeed), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Marisol’s group is located in Santiago, an area famous for its tobacco and beef production where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Marisol is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling clothes, underwear and shoes by purchasing merchandise in the main market in Santiago and then selling it at a profit in her community.

Marisol will use the profits to save for the day when she is ready to start a family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
el señor Florentino O. tiene 35 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Reina Molina, su esposa le ayuda en el hogar con sus hijos.
Florentino es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pescado y a veces hace el trabajo de albañil.
tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Florentino esta solicitando el credito para la compra de pescado seco ya que se aproxima la epoca de semana santa en donde se vende bastante este producto para la fabricacion de la sopa de torta de pescado. esta es una sopa muy sabrosa y tipica de Honduras.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino O. is 35 years old, and is married to Mrs. Reina Molina, his wife who helps him in the home with their children.

Florentino is a very humble and hardworking person; he sells fish and sometimes works as a mason. He has 3 years of experience in this activity.

Florentino needs the loan to buy dried fish since holy week is nearing and he sells a lot of this product to prepare a traditional fish cake soup. This soup is very delicious and characteristic of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  4 femmes du groupe Djekafo  sont toutes 4 mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Guegnéka de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes  font  majoritairement l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires et des articles en plastiques (seaux, bols, bassines etc.)
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  trois prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des colis de plusieurs variétés de condiments alimentaires telles les poivres, les ails, les oignons, les cubes maggies, les concentrées de tomates, les sels de cuisine, le beurre de karité, les sounbala  etc.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui servira  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la familles et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Djekafo are all married.  They average 32 years of age and four children each and live in traditional extended families in the Guegnéka district of the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioila (2nd administrative region of the republic).  These women mainly buy and sell condiments and plastic ware (buckets, bowls, tubs, etc.)  After having properly repaid the three preceding loans, the group members are now on their fourth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy packages of several types of condiments, such as black pepper, garlic, onions, Maggi bouillon cubes, sounbala (pounded and fermented seeds used in cooking), shea butter, etc. The supplies are gotten essentially from local wholesaler merchants. The sales are made at the market.  Cash or credit is accepted from customers composted of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet the needs of the families. The rest will be invested into the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Sonia Maritza

texts.es:
la señora Sonia Maritza M. B. tiene 47 años de edad, es casada. tiene la ayuda de su esposo en su negocio. sus hijos ya estan casados y dos de ellos viven en los estado unidos, a veces le ayudan enviandole dinero.
Sonia se dedica al comercio en la venta de ropa, calzado, adornos, ventiladores, etc.  esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio. desea comprar bastante ropa de verano ya que se aproxima la semana santa y en esta epoca se venden mucho los accesorios y ropa para playa.
cerca de San Lorenzo se encuentra la playa de Cedeño la cual es muy visitada por mucha gente de esta zona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia Maritza M. B. is 47 years old and is married. She has the help of her husband in her business. Her children are married and two of them live in the United States and sometimes they help her by sending her money.

Sonia sells clothing, shoes, decorations, fans, etc. She needs the loan to buy merchandize and in this way stock her business. She wishes to buy a lot of summer clothing since holy week is approaching and in this season she sells a lot of accessories and clothing for the beach.

Near San Lorenzo is the Cedeño beach which is visited by a lot of people in this area.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer clothing, fans, decorations and shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Djiguitougou ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles  traditionnelles au quartier Guegnéka de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de fruits et légumes, de céréales, du savon, des tubercules, des chaussures, des habits  et la fabrication de l’encens.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur  cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, quelques chargements de charrettes en patates douces, oranges et tomates, des colis d’habits pour enfants et pagnes wax, des cartons de savons, des ingrédients pour l’encens et quelques paires de chaussures pour femmes.
Elles s’approvisionnent  sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui servira à essentiellement étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djiguitougou average 32 years of age and four children each living in traditional families in the Guegnéka district of the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioila (2nd administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another by community ties, and they do commerce in a variety of items, such as fruit and vegetables, grains, soap, tubers, footwear, and clothing. And they make incense. After having properly repaid the four preceding loans, the group members are now on their fifth solidarity loans that will be used to buy a few cart-loads of sweet potatoes, oranges, and tomatoes; packages of children's clothing; pagnes (colorful West African cloth); boxes of soap;  ingredients for incenses; and a few pairs of women's shoes.  Supplies are gotten locally from producers and wholesalers, and sales are made at the market.  Cash or credit is accepted from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for building up their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: Audelia Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Audelia Patricia F. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Barrio los Fuertes en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Audelia se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, tiene un local y tambien sale a vender a diferentes comunidades cercanas a la ciudad de Choluteca.
todos los dias se tiene que levantar temprano para atender a su familia para luego empezar a vender su ropa.
ahora ya tiene un local en el cual tiene su ropa bien ordenada y tambien tiene espacio para poder almacenar la ropa que compra y que no se vende.
dice sentirse muy contenta ya que todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Audelia Patricia F. is 41 years old and lives in the los Fuertes neighborhood in the city of Choluteca. Audelia sells second hand clothing and has a stall; she also goes out to sell to different neighborhoods close to the city of Choluteca.

Everyday she has to wake up early to take care of her family and then goes out to sell her clothing.

Now, Audelia has a small store, where she has her clothing organized and has space to store the clothing that she buys and has not sold.

She says that she is very happy since everything is going very well.

Mrs. F. needs a loan to buy more bags of clothing so that she will be able to have more earnings which she needs to give her family a better quality of life since this is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 femmes du groupe  Benkadi, toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent  toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de l’habillement,  des tubercules et du poisson fumé et séché.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur 5 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  des paniers de poissons fumés et séchés  et des  paquets de condiments alimentaires  tels les tomates fraîches,  les oignons et les sels de cuisine, les feuilles vertes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  à Mopti (la cinquième région administrative du Mali) en poissons et  sur place auprès des producteurs en condiments. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, au marché et dans les foires environnantes de Konobougou, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven woman of the group Benkadi, all married, average 38 years of age and five children each.  And they all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of community and kinship. They do commerce in a variety of items, such as condiments, clothing, tubers, and smoked and dried fish. After having properly repaid the four preceding loans, the group members are now on their fifth solidarity loans that will be used to buy some baskets of smoked and dried fish, as well as packages of condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, onions, salt, and greens.  Supplies of fish are gotten in Mopti (5th administrative region of Mali), and those of condiments are gotten from local producers.  Sales are made out of the home, at the market, and at the fairs surrounding Konobougou.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses concerning healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Konotièyelen Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Konotièyelen, 5 mariées et deux veuves,  ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de l’habillement,  des ustensiles de cuisines en plastique et des calebasses.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  7 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Konotièyelen sont à leur 8 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des  paquets de condiments alimentaires  tels les tomates fraîches,  les oignons et les sels de cuisine, les feuilles vertes, les calebasses et les ustensiles de cuisine en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  en gros en condiments alimentaires et en ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  sur place auprès des paysans en calebasses. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Konotièyelen (five married and two widowed) average 40 years of age and four children each.  They all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they do commerce in a variety of goods, such as condiments, clothing, plastic kitchen utensils, and calabash bowls. After having properly repaid the seven preceding loans, the group members are now on their eighth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy packs of condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, onions, salt, green leaves, calabashes, and plastic kitchen ware.   Supplies of condiments and the plastic ware are gotten in bulk in Bamako (capital of Mali). As for the calabashes, these are gotten locally from farmers.  Sales are made at the Konobougou City market and at the surrounding fairs.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
La señora Asunción  Graciela  R. Ramírez es casada  tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia de San Miguel Xico, esto en Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, en  el estado de México; tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos están en edad escolar, Su esposo es albañil y para obtener otros ingresos, ella inicia trabajando con una señora vendiendo  antojitos mexicanos en ese momento le ayudo porque con lo que ganaba le ayudaba a su esposo para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y al parecer todo estaba bien, hasta que con el tiempo comenzó a sentirse mal y acude al medico en donde le dicen que tiene una infección severa y se  estaban afectando los riñones  y era necesario estar en tratamiento al no contar con ningún seguro médico los costos se elevaban, realmente no contaba con recursos económicos, por lo que busco otras alternativas medicas, fue esta actividad la que le ayudo en su recuperación tanto en su salud como económicamente, un familiar le presto un poco de dinero que le sirviera como primer inversión, de ahí se ha hecho de clientes, su necesidad en este momento es de capital y poder incrementar su inversión, teniendo mayores ganancias que le ayudara en remodelar un espacio en su casa y le sirva como local en donde guarde y venda sus productos; de las ganancias que obtendrá es para pagar los estudios de sus 2 hijos.
Ella al igual que otros compañeros se unen formando un grupo para solicitar un crédito a través de  Fundación Realidad e invertir en las diferentes actividades que tienen como son: 
Ángela D. O. venta de chiles y semillas.
Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez venta de productos nutricionales.
Ernestina Ramírez Méndez  venta de ropa.
Jessica Vázquez Hernández venta de ropa.
María Antonia R. Ramírez venta de antojitos.
Iris Violeta O. S.  taller de costura.
Julia Martínez Hernández  venta de  fruta y legumbres.
Francisca Hernández T. Estética.
María Del Carmen González M. venta por catalogo.
María Antonieta Martínez M. venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez is 41 years old and married. She lives in the San Miguel Xico settlement, which is in the Chalco Solidaridad Valley in the state of México. She has four children; two of them are school age. Her husband is a bricklayer. To get other income she started working with another woman selling snacks. At that time this really helped because her earnings helped her husband with the school expenses for her children. It seemed that all was well. In time she started to feel bad, and she went to the doctor. They told her that she has a severe infection that is affecting her kidneys, and she needed to be in treatment. Not having medical insurance, the costs elevated. She did not have economic resources, so she looked for medical alternatives. It was this activity that helped in the recovery of her health as much as economically. A relative lent her a little money, which served as her first investment. Then she got customers. Now she needs money to be able to increase her investment. She has greater earnings, which will help her to remodel a space in her house. This will serve as the place where she keeps and sells her products. Her earnings will pay for the education of her two children. She is like the other colleagues who come together in a group to request a loan from the Fundación Realidad. They will use the loan to invest in their different businesses. They are: Ángela D. O.: Sells chiles and seeds Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez: Sells nutricional products Ernestina Ramírez Méndez: Sells clothes Jessica Vázquez Hernández: Sells clothes María Antonia R. Ramírez: Sells snacks. Iris Violeta O. S.: Seamstress shop Julia Martínez Hernández: Sells fruit and vegetable Francisca Hernández T.: Beauty salon María Del Carmen González M.: Catalog sales. María Antonieta Martínez M.: Sells clothes

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food, clothes, snack, and other things

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June has successfully combined her passions for movement and child development with June Bug’s Gym, a place where she strives to help children build self-confidence and find joy in being fit. Combining twenty years of work with preschool children and with a background in competitive gymnastics, ballet, modern dance, theater and horse-vaulting at an international level, it is not surprising that June has seen her business triple since it started in November of 2008.

To accommodate her growing client base, June needed to expand her gym into a larger space. A friend from Wells Fargo, who was frustrated that she was unable to help due to the tighter loan qualifying criteria set by banks, referred June to Opportunity Fund.

With this loan June will be able to create a safety wall, install netting around the trampoline area, and buy new gym equipment to ensure the gym continues to be a fun, educational, and safe environment. In addition, June will be able to purchase a computer to accommodate new gym software to help grow the business, and contract a bookkeeper to help establish a better budgeting and record-keeping system.

With the expansion of her gym and just one semester left to earn her degree in Early Childhood Education, June is close to fulfilling a lifelong dream of owning a preschool-gym business. “My family especially thinks that this has changed me a lot. I have so much freedom working for my own business compared to when I used to work for somebody else. I am very happy now. Everyone in the family is saying that I am finally doing what I want to do.”

loans.use: To buy new gym equipment, a computer and record-keeping software

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Siguidolo, 4 toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne  30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  de la restauration et le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de poissons fumé et séché, de fruits et légumes et des condiments alimentaires.
Ces femmes du groupe Siguidolo  sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des  paquets de condiments alimentaires, des paniers de fruits et légumes et des ingrédients pour la restauration.
Elles s’approvisionnent  généralement à Bamako (capitale du Mali), Mopti et sur place à Konobougou. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Siguidolo (all four are married) average 30 years of age and two children each.  They all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of kinship. They work in food service and do commerce in a variety of goods, such as smoked and dried fish, fruit and vegetables, and condiments. The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy packs of condiments, baskets of fruit and vegetables, and some ingredients for food catering.  Supplies are generally procured in Bamako (capital of Mali), in Mopti, and locally in Konobougou.  Sales are made at the Konobougou City market and at the surrounding fairs.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
Este señor cuenta con 52 años de edad, es obrero y trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa, es soltero, pero si está acompañado, a su cargo tiene 6 personas incluyendo, la compañera de él.

Con nuestra institución trabaja desde el año  2007, se le han otorgado cuatro créditos y todos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, la cual hoy en día tiene mayor presentación y por ende le ha dado mayor valor a su propiedad.
texts.en:
The gentleman is 52 years old and is employed as a laborer by Chichigalpa's mayor's office. He is unmarried but has a life partner and supports 6 people, including her. He has been collaborating with our institution since 2007 and has had 4 loans granted, all for home improvements. As a result, his home now has a better appearance and thus higher value

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Benkadi de l’association Kelenya ont en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Guegnéka de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente des habillements des draps de lit et des couvres lits.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des colis de plusieurs variétés d’habillements, pour adultes des deux sexes, pour enfants et des couvres lits.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement  à partir du Burkina Faso et Bamako auprès des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes, à domicile, au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui servira  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la familles et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group of the Kelenya association are, on average, 30 years old and have three children. They live mostly in traditional extended families in the Guegnéka district of Fana, in the Dioila prefecture, in the second administrative region of the republic. These women mainly buy and sell clothing, bed linens and bed spreads. After having properly repaid the four preceding loans, the women of the Benkadi group are on their fifth joint loan which will be used to buy packages of different types of clothing for men, women and children. They mostly get their supplies from wholesalers in Burkina Faso and Bamako, making their sales door to door and at market, with cash and credit, to a clientele of men and women. They each expect to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of their families, and to invest the rest in their business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
doña Maria del Rosario F. es una mujer emprendedora y bien dedicada a su trabajo. es madre de 2 hijos.
todos los dias se lavanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a su clientela. 
tiene bastantes clientes porque donde esta ubicado su negocio transita mucha gente a diario.
esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio y hacerlo crecer mas.
se siente muy feliz ya que cuando comenzo tenia poco inventario y ahora es una pulperia bien surtida. su meta es hacerlo crecer mas y mas cada dia que pasa.
las ganancias las ocupa para mantener su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario F. is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work. She has two children. She gets up at five in the morning everyday to take care of her customers. She has plenty of customers because lots of people pass by her business location everyday . She is asking for a loan to better stock her business and make it grow more. She is happy because when she started she had little inventory, and now her mini-market is well stocked. Her goal is to make it grow more and more with every passing day. Her earnings are to support her household and to give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, shortening, oil, tortillas, churros, corn and wheat flour, coffee, locks, matches, vegetables, soft drinks, and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes  mariées. Elles  ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires au quartier Fana coura de la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, d’activités professionnelles  et font essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires et d’habillements.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les dix prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des variétés de condiments alimentaires et des complets d’habits de tous genres et tous âges.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes d’une façon ambulante et au marché, généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses de frais scolaires, de nourriture, de santé et  le reste servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women, who are members of Danaya Group, are all married. On average, they are 34 years old and have five children. They live mostly in nuclear families in the neighborhood of Fana Coura in the sub-prefecture of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The group members are neighbors, family members or members of the same business association. They make a living by buying and selling various articles, mostly food condiments and clothes. After having repaid their previous ten loans on schedule, the women of Danaya Group are now applying for their eleventh group loan, which they will use to buy various food condiments and suits of all kinds and for all age groups. They get most of their supplies from local producers and wholesalers. They sell their products cash, either hawking or at the market, to a clientele made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which they will partly spend on school fees, food and healthcare, and partly reinvest into their businesses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Verania Del Carmen

texts.es: Verania tiene la edad de 29 años. Tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería a pesar de ser tan joven tiene una amplia experiencia en su negocio. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que ella no tenía ningún medio de ingreso ya sus padres al no poseer suficientes recurso, le enseñaron a trabajar a temprana edad, así es que ella incursiona en este negocio. Es una persona sencilla y respetuosa que día a día se preocupa por mejorar sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, jabón, granos básicos, pan, leche entre otros productos.. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Verania is 29 years old. She has a mini-market. In spite of being so young, she has a lot of experience in her business. She has been doing this for over eight years. She did not have a source of income because her parents did not have sufficient resources. They taught her to work at an early age. That is how she got into this business. She is a down to earth and respectful person who is concerned about improving her earnings everyday. The money she is asking for is to buy sweets, detergents, soap, basic grains, bread, and milk, among other products. One of her wishes to keep this business running because it is her only means of earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer muy dedicada  a su familia, tiene 44 años, está casada con Sergio de 51 años. Tienen 2 hijos, el mayor se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima en busca de una mejor oportunidad académica, mientras que Yerson de 18, vive con ellos.

La vida de Isabel cambio radicalmente hace 18 años cuando tuvo complicaciones para concebir al menor de sus hijos, quien nació con retardo mental. Está situación antes de amedrentarla la convirtió en una mujer fuerte y luchadora, que desde hace 20 años ayuda a su esposo en la atención de su farmacia. 
Pero como deseaba generar sus propios ingresos, en el mes de noviembre último alquiló un local en una zona céntrica para instalar un centro de llamadas telefónicas, y aprovechó en vender algunas golosinas y bebidas. Todo iba bien hasta que a mediados de enero tuvo que cerrar su negocio porque Yerson enfermó, desde entonces volvió a la farmacia a continuar apoyando a su esposo.
Ahora, con la experiencia ganada, planea reabrir su negocio para que pueda ahorrar lo suficiente y trasladarse a la ciudad de Lima para que su hijo reciba una educación acorde a su situación. A su vez, ella instalaría una bodega para solventar sus gastos de estadía en esa ciudad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, el que está integrado por personas comprensivas y emprendedoras, “estoy muy agradecida con el grupo porque me acogieron con los brazos abiertos y me hacen sentir en confianza”, menciona. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa comprar mercadería (refrescos, bebidas gasificadas y dulces) para vender en su nueva tienda.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman who is very devoted to her family. She is 44 years old, and she is married to Sergio, age 51. They have two children. The oldest is in the city of Lima looking for a better academic opportunity. Yerson, 18, lives with them. Isabel’s live radically changed 18 years ago when she had trouble conceiving their youngest child. He was born mentally challenged. Instead of having this situation frighten her, it changed her into a strong and tenacious woman. For 20 years she has helped her husband take care of his pharmacy. As she wanted to generate her own income, last November she rented a place in a central area to set up a calling center. She took advantage of the center to sell sweets and drinks. Everything went well until the middle of January when she had to close the business because Yerson got sick. From then on she returned to the pharmacy to keep helping her husband. Now, with the experience she has gained, she plans to reopen her business. She wants to do this in order to save enough to travel to the city of Lima so that her son can receive an appropriate education for his situation. She will also set up a convenience store to pay for the educational expenses in the city. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows how her communal bank works, and it is comprised of understanding and enterprising people. “I am very grateful to the group because they welcomed me with open arms and make me feel confident,” she says. She will use the money she is requesting to buy merchandise (refreshments, carbonated drinks, and sweets) to sell in her new store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO
El Alcancía Comunal SAGITARIO, inicia su segundo ciclo con 10 socias que realizan diferentes tipos de negocios. 

Como Presidenta tenemos a la señora Teresa, que al igual que algunas socias se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, ella invierte tiempo y dinero en su negocio pero sabe que no es en vano, ya recibirá algunas ganancias que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Saturnina es casada hace 15 años y tiene 4 hijos de las cuales 2 son menores de edad y por los que tiene que trabajar.
Al igual que se esposo, se levanta temprano para poder alimentar a los cerdos que los tienen en jaulas alejados de su casa.
Para ella ha sido beneficioso este tipo de trabajo ya que solo le ocupa algunas horas y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a sus hijos, porque lo más importante para ella es brindarle mejores oportunidades a su familia

Además de criar cerdos la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa toda la semana, con esos ingresos extras desea abrir un pequeño restaurant que le permita mejorar la infraestructura de su casa,  además invertir en la educación de sus hijos. Su familia está muy orgullosa de ella ya que es una persona trabajadora.

Los deseos de las socias son tener una casa propia, ampliar sus negocios y ver realizados a sus hijos profesionalmente.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO (SAGETARIUS COMMUNAL OUTREACH) The “Alcancia Comunal SAGITARIO” is in its second cycle with ten members who run different types of business. Teresa is the group’s President who, like some of the other members, raises hogs. She invests time and money into her business, but she knows that it is not in vain. She will soon receive an income that will help provide her with a better quality of life. Saturnina has been married for 15 years and has four children, two of whom are minors and for whom she must work. Her husband rises early in the morning to feed the hogs, which they keep in pens some distance from their home. For her, this type have work has been beneficial, since it only consumes a few hours a day, and she can spend the rest of the day with her children. The thing she considers most important is to be able to offer better opportunities to her family. In addition to raising hogs, Maria also sells prepared food from her home every day. She would like to use this extra income to open a small restaurant and use the subsequent income to make some improvements to her home and further invest in her children’s education. Her family is very proud of her, as she is a hard working woman. The members’ goals are to have their own homes, expand their businesses, and see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina es una mujer D. 52 años, se divorció D. su pareja con quien tuvo 4 hijos, D. los cuales sólo vive con José D. 25 años en su casa propia ubicado en la selva central del Perú.
DesD. hace 17 años se dedica al cultivo D. frutas cítricas, plátanos y papaya, a las que proporciona el cuidado necesario para una buena producción. Por eso comenta que le gusta mucho caminar a lo largo D. sus tierras, porque toda la actividad agrícola la hace sentir viva. 
“Sin mis cosechas no hubiera podido tener nada, D. qué hubiera comido, educado a mis hijos, juntando dinero y hasta me compré mi casita”, menciona.
Sus ingresos son seguros cada 15 días, ya que cosecha plátanos con los que cubre los gastos básicos D. su casa, mientras que con las naranjas, mandarinas y papaya ahorrar y le sirve para solventar alguna eventualidad. Adicionalmente, cría cuyes para vender y para su consumo personal, tal como se le ve en la foto.
El sueño D. Segundina es tener su propio dinero (capital) para plantar nuevos frutos en las chacras que tiene, por eso que está satisfecha D. contar con el apoyo D. su banco comunal.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está convencida D. cumplir con los pagos del crédito, pues ya conoce la metodología D. trabajo y le agrada asistir a las reuniones D. su grupo porque sus compañeros son muy divertidos y unidos.  El dinero que ahora solicita lo destinará para el pago D. los operarios que limpiarán sus terrenos D. plátanos, también comprará dos sacos D. abono orgánico, fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas que esparcirá sobre sus plantaciones para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Segundina is a 52 year old woman. She divorced her husband with whom she had 4 children. She only lives with one of them, Jose, 25, in her own home located in the central jungle of Peru. For 17 years she has been growing citrus fruit, papayas and plantains. She gives them the care they need for a good harvest. This is why, she tells us, she likes to walk over her land, because all of the farming activity makes her feel alive. “Without my harvests I wouldn't have been able to have anything. What would I have eaten, how would I have educated my children, getting together enough money until I bought my little house?" she states. Her income is assured every two weeks, since she harvests plantains and thus covers the basic household expenses. The oranges, tangerines and papayas are for savings and to pay for any contingency. She also raises guinea pigs to sell and for personal consumption, as can be seen in the photo. Segundina's dream is to have her own money (capital) to plant new things in her fields. This is why she is happy to have the support of her communal bank. This is the third loan that she has with MFP and she is convinced she can make the loan payments. She already knows the work methodology and she likes attending the group meetings because the other members are very fun and united. The money she is asking for now is for the operators who will clear the plantain fields. She will also buy two sacks of organic fertilizer, fertilizer, insecticides and fungicides that she will spread over her plantings to assure their production.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her operators and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Selvira

texts.es:
Selvira tiene 42 años, está casada con Sebastián (62); tienen 3 hijos, pero viven sólo con dos: Franck de 20 y José de 19 años.
Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado modelo de su ciudad, donde desde tempranas horas de la mañana vende carne de pollo, y tres veces a la semana comercializa patos y gallinas.
A ella le gusta atender a sus clientes brindándoles un trato familiar, por lo que siempre regresan a comprarle; por otro lado lo que no le gusta es limpiar constantemente la sangre que se acumula en su puesto.
Está actividad la desarrolla desde hace 15 años y estas ganancias le han permitido construir su casa propia, cubrir la educación, alimentación y vestimenta de sus hijos, pues asegura que su economía es estable.
