Para el futuro, anhela ampliar su puesto de venta aprovechando que tiene clientes fieles que a diario compran en menor y mayor cantidad.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy feliz de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque han demostrado ser organizados, responsables, y sobre todo puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita desea pagar la congeladora que adquirió a crédito, también comprará más mercadería porque sus ventas se incrementan a diario.
texts.en:
Selvira is 42 years old, and married to Sebastián. They have 3 children and live with 2, Franck who is 20 and José 10. Her business is located in the Modelo Market in her city, where from the early hours of the morning, she sells chicken plus 3 times a week ducks and hens. She likes to attend to her customers, offering them personal treatment. For that reason, they always return to buy from her. On the other hand, what she doesn't like is having to constantly clean up the blood that accumulates at her stand. Selvira has done this for some 15 years and the earnings have permitted her to construct her own house, cover the costs of education, food, and clothing for the children, and assured that her economic condition remains stable. For the future, she hopes to expand her sales post, taking advantage of the fact that she has loyal clients who make daily purchases in small or large quantities. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is very happy to work with the members of her communal bank. She has demonstrated herself to be organized, responsible and above all, punctual in her payments. With this loan she wants to pay off the freezer that she bought on credit, and also to buy more merchandise, so her sales can increase daily.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING OFF HER FREEZER AND INCREASING HER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre de 26 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su hermana menor, Leyla de 22, y su sobrino de 4 años.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado modelo de su ciudad, contando con la ayuda de su padre quien le enseñó este oficio. Asimismo, tres veces a la semana vende carne de res y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es filetear la carne para parrilladas, pero por otro lado, lo que le desagrada estar en contacto permanente con el agua, pues le provoca dolores en los huesos.
Para el futuro, Zaida ambiciona instalar una carnicería, es por eso que con las ganancias de sus ventas compró una máquina cortadora, moledora; además adquirió un motocarro que alquila diario a 20 soles para obtener ganancias extras.

Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, del cual ella es una de las fundadoras y quien les enseñó a laborar con esmero y puntualidad en sus pagos. Con los tres mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita desea viajar a la ciudad de Lima para comprar 200 cerdos, los que traerá a su ciudad para vender su carne a los comerciantes del mercado.
texts.en:
Zaida is an enterprising and happy woman of 26 years of age. She is single and lives in her own home with her younger sister Leyla, 22 years old, and her 4 years old nephew. For the last ten years she has been selling fish at a stand in a market in her city. She has been able to count on the help of her father, who taught her this trade. Additionally, she sells beef three times a week. She really enjoys cutting the meat for grilling, but she dislikes being in constant contact with water, which brings on pain in her bones. In the future, Zaida plans to open a butcher shop. Because of this goal, she bought a cutting and grinding machine with her profits and also acquired a car which she rents out at 20 soles per day to obtain additional income. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is very happy to be working with the members of her community bank, of which she is one of the founders. She has taught her fellow members to carefully work and be punctual with their payments. With the 3,300 new soles that she is requesting she wishes to travel to Lima to purchase 200 pigs, which she will bring to her city to sell their meat to the customers of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs to sell their meat.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta señora es trabajadora desde hace cinco años de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa, se desempeña como conserje en el palacio de la cultura, es madre soltera con 5 hijos bajo su cargo y en edad escolar.
La señora trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2006, se le han financiado para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último es para gastos personales (medicina).
texts.en:
She has worked for the past 5 years for Chichigalpa's mayor's office as a caretaker at the Palace of Culture; she is a single mother of 5 school-age children, whom she supports. She has collaborated with Ceprodel since 2006 and has had loans for home improvements. This most current loan is for personal expenses (medicine).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses: medical and others.

loans.name: Julián Heriberto

texts.es: Julián Heriberto H. Q. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Candelaria ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad. Julián posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, el cual esta ubicado sobre la carretera principal, la cual dirige al departamento de Cuscatlán. Desde hace 17 años que él realiza este tipo de trabajo, obteniendo mucha experiencia en el oficio, lo cual le da la ventaja de elaborar un excelente trabajo con sus clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por parte de Julián. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales para su taller tales como lijas, pinturas, herramientas y otros insumos más. Todo esto lo hace con el inmenso deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que su familia cuenta, es por ello que Julián se esfuerza mucho por realizar un excelente trabajo, y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a su hijo y su esposa.
texts.en:
Julián Heriberto H. Q. is 31 years old. He lives in the municipality of Caldelaria which is located in the department of Cuscatlan. He lives with his wife who takes care of the house and their small two-year old daughter. Julián has a paint and body shop located on the main highway to Cuscatlan. He has had this business for 17 years and has gained a lot of experience in this area. Because of his expertise, he produces excellent work for his customers and his customers are very happy with his work. He’s asking for a loan he can buy materials for his workshop with like: sandpaper, paints, tools, and other supplies. He is doing all of this to be able earn more money since this is the only source of income his family has. This is why Julian makes a great effort to do excellent work, so he can provide all the necessities for his child and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint, sandpaper, and tools to maintain cars.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Sherlyn Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sherlyn y tiene este nombre porque la hija de la presidenta que tiene un mes de nacida se llama así.  Está ubicado en la comunidad de El Refugio en el estado de Hidalgo de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que realiza un crédito con CrediComún. 

Mercedes M. A. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta el 6to año, es de clase media-baja y tiene en total 2 hijos (mujeres).  Ella se dedica a la venta de recaudería y abarrotes que inició hace 1 año. Se solicita el préstamo para invertir un poco más en abarrotes. Sus clientes piensan que vende la fruta y verdura más fresca de la localidad.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con el gran compromiso para con la empresa de no fallar en sus pagos.   Quiere este crédito para acrecentar su negocio hasta convertirse en una tienda grande.
texts.en:
This group is called SHERLYN, and is named after the president's one-month-old daughter. The group is located in the community of El Refugio (The Refuge) in the state of Hidalgo, Mexico. It is composed of 11 members and this is the 1st time they have requested a loan through CrediComún. Mercedes Martínez A. is the group's president. She is 25 years old, attended school through the 6th grade, is from the lower middle class, and has 2 daughters. For the last year, her store has collected district taxes as well as selling groceries. She requests the loan to invest in some more groceries. Her customers think she sells the freshest fruit and vegetables in the locality. Upon requesting the loan she expressed an obligation to her business not to fail in her payments. She needs the loan to expand her business, which she hopes to make larger.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRUITS, VEGETABLES, AND GROCERIES TO SELL

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 36 años, vive junto a Nolberto de 35, su esposo, con quien tuvo 3 hijos: Miriam de 12, Arnold de 7 y Hans de 2 añitos. Ellos viven juntos en su casa propia.
Con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo implementar una bodega en su propio domicilio, actividad que realiza con gran alegría desde hace 11 años. En un principio se le hizo complicado el trabajo, ya que tenía que permanecer durante casi todo el día en su tienda, pero ahora no lo ve así, pues gracias a su forma de ser se ha hecho de muy buenos amigos y siempre que alguien compra en su bodega se siente muy bien atendido.
Para el futuro quiere surtir su tienda con productos comestibles más variados, además de empezar a vender otros artículos como adornos, perfumes, etc. 

Este es cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas y otros productos, ya que es tiempo de verano y su tienda es muy concurrida.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old. She lives with her husband, Nolberto, age 35, with whom she has 3 children: Miriam, age 12, Arnold, age 7 and Hans, age 2. They live together in their own house. With a lot of effort and thanks to the support of her family, she started a convenience store in her own residence. She has run the store very happily for 11 years. At first the work was difficult, since she had to remain there in her store during almost the entire day, but now it does not seem so difficult, because, thanks to her manner, she has made some very good friends and always makes someone who buys in her store feel very well served. For the future she wants to supply her store with more variety of edible products, besides beginning to sell other articles such as decorations, perfumes, etc. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual in the payment of her quotas. With the money that she now requests she will buy a greater quantity of beverages and other products, since it is summer time and her store very is busy.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more varied merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL UNIDOS PARA EL ÉXITO
La Alcancía Comunal “Unidos para el éxito” está representado por la señora Vilma y conformado por 10 miembros los cuales son muy emprendedores y trabajadores. Todos cuentan con negocios propios, algunos en sus domicilios y otros en el mercado.

Como es el caso D. la Sra. Carmen, ella se dedica a la venta D. menú hace 3 años, pero eso no es suficiente para ella así que por las noches venD. salchipapas y pollo broaster en la puerta D. su casa. Con la ganancia pueD. aportar con los gastos familiares, ya que está separada D. su esposo, y tiene 2 hijos que mantener.

La presidenta Sra. Vilma se esfuerza por mantener su bodega D. abarrotes y salir adelante, es una persona muy responsable y comprometida con el grupo. Ella tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 está bajo su cuidado. Con el préstamo obtenido podrá comprar algunos productos que  necesite para atender a sus clientes.

Hilda se dedica a la venta D. gaseosas y dulces en su casa, además para obtener ganancias extras aprendió manualidades y venD. tejidos a crochet como son carteras zapatos y otros productos a elección del cliente.

Este grupo es muy unido y solidario ya que son personas muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante; es por eso que los préstamos recibido lo invertirán en la compra D. productos e insumos que les permitan brindar una buena atención a sus clientes.
Todos los integrantes están agradecidos a EDAPROSPO Y KIVA por la confianza brindada al otorgarles créditos.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMMUNAL UNITED FOR SUCCESS The Communal bank "United for the success" is represented by the lady Vilma and consists of 10 members which are very enterprising and industrious. They all have their own businesses, some in their residences and others in the market. In the case of Señora Carmen, she has been dedicated to the sale of foods for 3 years, but that is not sufficient for her so at nights she sells salchipapas (a native dish with sausage and fried potatoes) and roast chicken in the door of her house. With the profits she can contribute to the family expenses, since she is separated from her husband and has 2 children to maintain. The president, Señora Vilma endeavors to maintain her convenience store and do well. She is a very responsible person and works well with the group. She has 5 children of which only 1 is under her care. With the loan she obtains, she will be able to buy some products that she needs to serve her clients. Hilda is dedicated to the sale of carbonated drinks and candies in her house. In addition, to obtain extra profits she learned handicrafts and sells crocheted items such as handbags, shoes and other products at the choice of the client. This group very is united and supportive since they are very hard-working people with many desires to do well. That is why the loans they receive will be invested in the purchase of products and supplies that permit them to offer good service to their clients. All the members are thankful to EDAPROSPO AND KIVA for the confidence shown them in giving them loans.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for resale, such as foods and supplies for making handicrafts

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela V. T., de 46 años de edad, vive en municipio de Paraiso de Osorio, departamento de La Paz, en vivienda propia y acompañada de su esposo, el señor Juan Panameño,  y 4 hijos: Ever, Juan, Noemi y Jairo de 26, 19, 17 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Juan se encuentra pensionado, recibiendo una cantidad de dinero que no logró sustentar las necesidades de esta familia, fue así como Adela hace 9 años decidió emprender su propio negocio. Hablando con algunos profesores del Centro Educativo Nacional de dicho municipio en que vive le permitieron instalarse con un chalet en el que inicio distribuyendo a sus clientes, boquitas como nachos ó chips, pupusas por la mañana, refrescos naturales y una buena oferta de golosinas para niños y jóvenes del centro educativo. Maria Adela ha batallado mucho por hacer que su negocio prospere y gracias a su dinámica esto ha sido posible. Ahora ella ha echado a andar una última idea, la de ofrecer almuerzos tanto a los profesores y estudiantes del Centro Escolar, le ha ido muy bien, su clientela está creciendo, dado que reconocen que su toque culinario es exquisito así como la amabilidad de Adela, esposo e hijos e higiene del lugar. Para satisfacer la demanda de nuevos platillos de sus clientes y poner a su disposición mayor variedad de productos es que se encuentra solicitando este nuevo crédito.-
texts.en:
María Adela V. T., age 46, lives in the municipality of Paraiso of Osorio, department of La Paz, in her own dwelling and accompanied by her husband, Señor Juan Panamanian, and their 4 children: Ever, Juan, Noemi and Jairo ages 26, 19, 17 and 15 years respectively. Juan is retired and receives a pension that fails to support the needs of the family. For this reason Adela decided 9 years ago to start her own business. Speaking with some professors of the National Educational Center of the municipality in which she lives, she was permitted to open a cafe there in which she began distributing to her clients foods like nachos and chips, pupusas (a biscuit-like flat bread made from maize) in the morning, natural refreshments and a good variety of delicacies for children and youths of the educational center. Maria Adela has worked hard to make her business prosper and thanks to her effort this has been possible. Now she has decided to pursue a new idea, that of offering lunches both to the professors and students of the school. This has gone over very well. Her clientele is growing, given that they recognize that her culinary tastes are exquisite as well as appreciating the amiability of Adela, her husband and her children and the cleanliness of the place. To satisfy the demand of her clients for new dishes and to offer a greater variety of products, she is requesting this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foods for the preparation of new dishes and to offer a greater variety of products in her food service.

location.town: Municipio de Paraiso de Osorio en el departamento

loans.name: Flor De Cachi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Flor de cachi, porque a las señoras les gustan las flores de todo tipo y como es raro que tengan muchas ya que en ese lugar no se dan las flores y si quieren unas las tienen que comprar, la terminación cachi por mencionar a su comunidad ya que se llama Guadalupe cachi. Está ubicado en Ixtlahuca de Rayón en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la 5ta vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Mariana Álvarez Nicolás  es integrante (a) del grupo. Tiene 42 (años), estudió hasta el 3o año de secundaria, es Ama de casa  y tiene en total 3 hijos (1 hijo, y 2 hijas).  Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como: borregos, becerros que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para  la compra de animales. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta por que ve una oportunidad de seguir creciendo con su negocio y así obtener solvencia económica que le permita ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios ya que ella no tuvo la posibilidad de seguir estudiando por que sus padres no tenían la posibilidad de brindarle esa ayuda.  Quiere este crédito para comprar alimento para la crianza de sus animales, parte del dinero es destinado también para el cultivo de sus tierras y así tener maíz y sácate con que darles de comer a sus propios animales; ella desea vender sus animales a un mejor precio y con la ayuda de los próximos créditos contar con mas cabezas de ganados hasta llegar a una cantidad considerable que le permita tener otro negocio como la venta de pieles y también espera que con los ingresos que llegue a tener pueda construir una casa mas cómoda para su familia y que si es posible que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos profesionistas.
texts.en:
This group is called Flor de Cachi because the women who compose it like all kinds of flowers and, since this area does not produce flowers, it would be a rare occurrence that they have any; they would have to buy them. The second part is to mention the name of the community: Guadalupe Cachi. It is located in Ixtlahuca de Rayón, Estado de México. It is made up of 12 members and this is their 5th loan request from CrediComún. Mariana Álvarez Nicolás , 42, is one of the group members. She completed 8th grade, is a housewife and has three children (one boy and 2 girls). She has raised small farm animals like, lambs and calves, for five years. She is asking for funding to buy animals. At the moment of asking for the loan she is happy because she sees an opportunity to continue growing with her business and becoming financially solvent. She hopes to be able to help her children become educated, since she did not have the opportunity to continue with her schooling due to her parent’s inability to provide her with that help. She wants the funds to buy feed for her animals. Part of the money will be used to farm her lands in order to have corn and grass to feed her animals. She hopes to sell them at a good price and, with help from future loans, buy more heads of cattle until having a considerable amount that will permit her to have an additional business consisting of animal pelt sales. She also hopes that she will make enough income to build a more comfortable house for her family and, if possible, see to her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Liliana Vanesa

texts.es: Liliana Vanesa G. de 22 años de edad, reside en San Cristóbal ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal del lugar y junto a su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Liliana posee una pequeña tienda, ubicada en el Parque Central de San Cristóbal, en la cual comercializa pupusas, papas fritas, golosinas y bebidas. Este negocio lo posee desde hace un año, y nació con la esperanza de poder brindarles una fuente de ingresos extra, la cual le permitiera gozar de una mejor estabilidad económica, es por esta razón que es de mucha importancia para Liliana seguir adelante con su venta. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con productos como galletas, sodas, chicles, dulces, agua embotellada, y todo tipo de productos los cuales se venden más. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lilian Vanesa G. is 22 years old. She lives in San Cristóbal, in the Department of Cuscatlán, with her husband and one-year old son. Her husband is an employee of the Municipality. Liliana owns a small store at the main square in San Cristóbal where she sells “pupusas”, potato chips, sweets and drinks. She started the business a year ago with the idea of providing an additional source of income and greater financial stability for her family, therefore Liliana feels that it is very important that she succeed. She has asked for a loan to buy crackers, sodas, gum, candy, bottled water and other products that sell better. Her goal is to improve her earnings and thereby be able to help her husband cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crackers, sodas and bottle water.

loans.name: Arcangel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”, ellos están ubicados en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a socios que se dedican a la docencia, en su mayoría son profesoras de nivel inicial y primaria; otro pequeño grupo lo conforman 4 abogados, otros socios tiene sus tiendas abarrotes, otra es trabajadora de una panadería, otro socio tiene su tienda de calzados ortopédicos, la última socia es enfermera de un hospital. Nuestro socio Juan Opisbo Meléndez tiene 8 meses en Arariwa y pertenece al banco comunal Arcángel Gabriel y su negocio tiene 2 años, para el socio fue un apoyo este préstamo que realizó ya que aumento mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes esto le permitió comprar a sus  proveedores al contado. Él socio nos cuenta que pudo comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite  entre otros, tiene mucha perspectiva sobre su negocio y le gusta que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan en su bodega, también está pensando comprar más productos y venderlos al por mayor.  

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “ARCANGEL GABRIEL” Community Bank in Cusco and are engaged in retail businesses. Some of them are teachers, mostly at the preschool and elementary level. There is also a small group of lawyers as well as grocery store owners and a bakery owner; one member owns a shoe store specializing in orthopedic shoes, and one member is a hospital nurse. Juan Obispo Meléndez has been in Arariwa for 8 months; he belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. He has been in business for 2 years. The loan was of great help to him, as he was able to increase the merchandise he offers at his grocery store by paying his suppliers in cash. He tells us that he has been able to buy staples, such as rice, sugar, milk and oil, among others. He understands his business well and likes to be able to provide his clients with what they need. He is also hoping to buy additional products to sell in bulk. Our members are grateful for the opportunity and promise to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member has asked for the loan to buy merchandise and improve sales.

loans.name: Orbelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Orbelina del Carmen V. D. M., cuenta con 45 años D. edad, residente en la populosas ciudad D. Soyapango a escasos minutos D. la capital D. El Salvador, junto a ella viven su esposo Manuel quien es comerciante, una hermana que trabaja en una industria del municipio y su hijo Juan José D. 19 años D. edad, quien ayuda también con un poco a sufragar los gastos D. ésta luchadora familia al trabajar en una troqueladora (dedicados al cuero y cartones). Orbelina del Carmen es una mujer que desD. muy pequeña le gusto ganarse la vida, a base D. mucho esfuerzo y honestidad. Valores que la han distinguido entre sus vecinos y quienes lo comentan sin discusión alguna. Hace muchos años y con su hijo D. muy corta edad decidió emprender un negocio en el que aprovechara su experiencia en elaboración D. ricos tamales típicos D. gallina, para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar. Ella hace venta para 6 días en la semana y por lo cual debe esforzarse muchísimo ya que casí todos los días debe ir a comprar a tempranas horas al mercado D. la localidad los productos que tienen que ser frescos y así obtener el sabroso sabor en los tamales elaborados por Orbelina. Ahora ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar maíz al por mayor y tener para lo que resta del año la principal materia prima D. los tamales.-
texts.en:
Orbelina del Carmen V. D. Martínez is 45 years old. She lives just a few minutes away from the capital, El Salvador, in the city of Soyapango, which has a large population. She lives with Manuel, her husband, who is a businessman, with a sister who works in an industry owned by the municipality and her 19 year-old son, Juan José, who works in a troqueladora (factory for leather and cardboard products) and also helps with this hard-working family's expenses. Orbelina del Carmen has been earning her living since a very young age. She is a hard worker and very honest, something that has maD. her stand out in her community and that none of her neighbors would dispute. Many years ago, when her son was very young, she decided to start a business in which she would apply her experience at making delicious traditional chicken tamales. Her goal was to help her husband cover the household expenses. She sells her tamales 6 days a week, which entails a lot of hard work, since most days she has to go to the local market very early in the morning to buy the fresh ingredients which are the basis of their excellent reputation. She has asked for a loan to buy enough corn at wholesale prices to last her the rest of the year. Corn is the main ingredient for making tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn wholesale in order to be able to sell tamales the rest of the year. Corn is the main ingredient for making tamales.

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es: Elsy Elizabeth C. D. C., originaria D. municipio de San Salvador y quien a sus 47 años reside en municipio y ciudad de Soyapango colindante a capital de El Salvador. Junto a ella viven su esposo y dos hijos Antonio y Jorge quienes gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres ya trabajan y cooperan al bienestar económico de esta familia.  Elsy decidió hace varios años junto al apoyo incondicional de su esposo, iniciar en su misma casa de residencia una panadería en la que se hiciera pan dulce y francés, las ventas en sus inicios eran raquíticas, contando con algunas tres rutas de clientes y alguno que otro clientes que se acercaba a comprar, pero a medida se fueron dando a conocer a través de rutas que fueron organizando en zonas aledañas la aceptación ha sido muy buena, dado que un cliente los recomendó con otro y así sucesivamente, a la fecha su producción ha incrementado significativamente. Ahora Elsy se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual mejore la infraestructura D. lugar donde desarrolla su actividad productiva, a fin de garantizar la distinguida calidad de sus productos y ofrecer comodidad a clientes que llegan a comprar el pan salido D. horno, además de comprar mayor cantidad de sacos de harina y así lograr obtener una producción mayor de pan francés que demanda sus clientes para los desayunos y cenas.-
texts.en:
Elsy Elizabeth C. D. C., 47, is originally from San Salvador. She lives in Soyapango, which borders on the capital of El Salvador. Her husband and two sons, Jorge and Antonio, live with her. Both Jorge and Antonio, thanks to their parents’ efforts, work and contribute to the family’s wellbeing. Elsy decided several years ago to unconditionally help her husband so she set up a bakery in her home where she makes French and sweet bread. At the beginning, her sales were dismal; she had only three customer routes and one or two walk-in customers. Gradually, however, she became better known along routes they organized in neighboring areas. Acceptance has been very good thanks to word of mouth recommendations. As a result, production has increased significantly. Now Elsy is asking for funding to improve the infrastructure of the locale in which she does her work so that she can guarantee the distinguished quality of her products and offer greater comfort to her customers that come to buy fresh-out-of-the-oven bread as well as to buy a greater quantity of sacks of flour so that production of French bread, which is in high demand by her customers for breakfast and dinner, will be larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and to make improvements to the bakery.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel Calzoncito es casado con la señora María del Refugio Guerrero, el labora para una empresa en el área de producción, su cónyuge también labora para una fabrica pero en el área de coordinación desde hace 16 años de antigüedad, ellos están tramitando un crédito para terminar la construcción de una barda lateral de su vivienda, esto para una mayor protección familiar.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel Calzoncito is married to María del Refugio Guerrero. He works for a business in the area of production. His wife also works for a factory, but in the area of coordination. She has worked there for 16 years. They are asking for a loan to finish construction on a side wall of their house. This is to give the family better protection.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es: Silvia Isabel M. D. A., originaria y residente en la ciudad D. Usulutan, al oriente D. la capital D. El Salvador, lugar cálido y en donD. sus habitantes ejercen mucho el comercio. Ahí vive Silvia en casa propia dentro D. una colonia cercana al mercado regional, con su pequeño hijo Kevin D. un año D. edad junto a una tia que le cuida al pequeño durante el día, ya que ella debe salir a trabajar. Por las mañanas muy temprano se dirige Silvia hacia el puesto que adentro del mercado tiene, llegando dispuesta a atender a clientes, damas y caballeros, que la visitan y requieren D. sus servicios como cosmetóloga ó adquirir algún producto D. belleza. Silvia ahora  solicita un nuevo crédito con el que pueda adquirir nuevos productos para el tratamiento D. cabellos y rostro, que están solicitando sus clientes y ella actualmente no pueD. suplir dicha necesidad. Para Silvia es muy importante esto ya que su negocio es la única fuente D. ingreso con la que cuenta para la educación futura D. su hijo y los gastos ordinarios D. su hogar.-
texts.en:
Silvia Isabel M. D. A. is from the city of Usulutan, and she lives there. It is to the east of the capital of El Salvador. It is a warm place where the inhabitants engage in a lot of commerce. Silvia lives there in her own house in a neighborhood that is close to the regional market. She lives with her small, one year old son, Kevin, and an aunt who takes care of the little one during the day because Silvia has to leave to work. Silvia heads towards her stand in the market very early in the morning. She arrives ready to wait on her customers, women and men who visit her in need of her cosmetology services or to get a beauty product. Silvia is now requesting a new loan to get new products for hair and facial treatments. Her customers are requesting these products, and she currently cannot meet the need. This is very important to Silvia because her business is the only source of income she has to educate her child in the future and to pay the usual household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new products for hair and facial treatments

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos F. es casado con la señora Francisca Guerra y son una familia muy joven y unida, ellos son padres de familia de 2 pequeñitos. El labora para una empresa reconocida en nuestra ciudad, desde hace 6 años en el área de producción, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, tienen en construcción un cuarto para la ampliación de su hogar y así obtener mayor comodidad; por tal motivo están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción del proyecto antes mencionado.  
(EL SOLICITANTE NO SE ENCONTRABA YA QUE ANDABA LABORANDO Y POR TAL MOTIVO SE LE TOMO LA FOTOGRAFIA A SU ESPOSA.)
texts.en:
Señor Carlos F. is married to Señora Francisca Guerra. They are a very young and close family. They are the parents of two small children. Carlos works for a well known business in our city. For 6 years he has been involved in production. His wife takes care of the house and their children. They are in the process of constructing a room in order to enlarge their home and, thus, live in greater comfort. They are seeking this loan in order to complete the construction project described above.

(THE APPLICANT WAS NOT AT HOME SINCE HE WAS WORKING. FOR THIS REASON WE TOOK A PHOTOGRAPH OF HIS WIFE)

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlargement of a house.

loans.name: Teresa Maribel

texts.es: Teresa Maribel A. D. G., D. 43 años D. edad, junto a ella viven su esposo, el señor Victor Manuel y sus dos hijos Joel y Noé D. 23 y 22 años D. edad respectivamente y quienes trabajan como albañiles construyendo viviendas nuevas o realizando algunas mejoras o modificaciones a otras usadas, mientras su padre es comerciante. Residen en una colonia Semi Urbana del municipio D. Ereguayquin, departamento D. Usulutan. Ya cuentan varios años desD. que Teresa al ver que las ganancias resultado D. los negocios D. su esposo no eran suficientes para sufragar los gastos D. su hogar decidió apoyarlo instalando un molino D. nixtamal en su misma casa D. residencia, en el muele maíz, frijoles, chicharrones, yuca, harinas, entre otras cosas. Hace algunos meses Teresa al ver que la frecuencia D. sus clientes ha disminuido producto D. competencias del mismo tipo D. negocio en el lugar, decidió establecer horarios en los que ha distribuido la atención del molino con su esposo y cuando ella no se encuentra en el, anda vendiendo ropa D. forma ambulante, por las colonias aledañas o el mercado regional del municipio. Teresa ha encontrado otra fuente D. ingreso para su familia en la venta D. estas prendas D. vestir y por ello ahora desea comprar mayor variedad D. ropa y así poder vender más cantidad y obtener mejores ganancias.-
texts.en:
Teresa Maribel A. D. G., 43 years old, lives together with her husband, Victor Manuel, and her two children, Joel and Noé, 23 and 22 years old respectively, who work as builders building new homes or doing improvements or modifications of existing houses. Their father is a shopkeeper. They live in a semi urban area of the Ereguayquin municipality, in the Usulutan department. Several years ago, Teresa, realizing that the income from her husband's business was not enough to cover the costs of her home, decided to help him and installed a grain grinder in her home. She uses it to grind corn, beans, cracklings, yucca, flour among other things. Several months ago, seeing that the frequency of her customers has diminished due to competition, Teresa decided to set times where she and her husband are at the grinder and otherwise she goes to sell clothing door to door in the adjoining communities or at the regional market of the municipality. Teresa has found another good source of income for her family in the sale of this clothing and is now wanting to purchase a bigger variety of products thus increasing her sales and her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of women's and men's clothing.

location.town: Municipio de Ereguayquin, departamento de Usulutan

loans.name: Jesus Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jesús Jaime M. es casado con la señora Sonia Guadalupe Montalvo, padres de familia de 2 pequeñitos, ellos hace 5 años emprendieron por si solos un negocio de venta de barbacoa todos los fines de semana, ya que a dicho negocio se dedica toda la familia, por tal motivo tienen la experiencia de la elaboración y sus clientes los prefieren, en este momento están tramitando un crédito para la compra de  ollas, materia prima,para la elaboracion y venta de su barbacoa. Para la inversión a su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús Jaime M. is married to Sonia Guadalupe Montalvo and they are the parents of two little children. Five years ago they started a week-end barbecue business on their own since the entire family is in the barbecue business. Therefore, they have experience in making it and their customer prefer them. They are negotiating funding to buy pots and ingredients for barbecue to invest in their business and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor francisco Javier R. es casado con la señora Laura Patricia y padre de 1 niño, el labora para una empresa en el área de producción desde hace 2 años, pero además cuentan  con el apoyo del padre de su esposa quien vive con ellos y aporta para los gastos del hogar, ellos como una familia muy unida y trabajadora están tramitando este crédito para empezar la construcción de un cuarto en el frente de su hogar, el cual ayudara a tener mayor comodidad para la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier R. is married to Mrs. Laura Patricia and father of one son. For the last two years he has been working for a company in the area of production. They also depend on the the support from his wife's father who lives with them and contributes in covering the expenses of the home. They, as a close and hard working family, are requesting this loan to start constructing a room at the front of their house. This will help the family to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of a room at the front of their house.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El señor Luis Enrique Jiménez es casado con la señora Norma y son una familia muy estable pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, el tiene un negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes y Carnicería Jiménez” establecido desde hace 6 años.Son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución, ya que anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para la ampliación del local de su negocio, proyecto realizado con éxito y nuevamente están tramitando para colocar la losa de concreto del techo de un cuarto en construccion nuevo proyecto que están terminando.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique Jiménez is married to Norma; they are a stable and very hard-working family. He has had his own grocery store, called “Abarrotes y Carnicería Jiménez,” for 6 years. They are distinguished clients of our institution in that they were granted a previous loan to enlarge their place of business; the project was successful. Now, they are requesting additional funding to install concrete roof tiles on a room that is under construction; a new project they are about to complete.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install concrete roof tiles.

loans.name: Claudia Isela

texts.es: Claudia Isela R. M. de 30 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a ambos padres y un pequeño hijo de un año de edad, el cual es su mayor incentivo para seguir adelante. Claudia posee una venta de frutas, la cual esta ubicada frente al punto de buses de la ruta 113, lugar muy concurrido, en el que a toda hora del día transitan muchas personas. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, la cual inicia su trabajo desde las 6 de mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, una larga jornada gracias a la cual puede brindarle techo, alimento y todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo, el cual depende únicamente de ella, ya que Claudia es madre soltera, quien debe esforzarse el doble por seguir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, de manera que tenga más cantidad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
. Claudia Isela R. M., 30, lives in Cojutepeque, Cuscatlán department. She lives with both her parents and her one-year-old son, who is her greatest incentive to succeed in life. Claudia is a fruit vendor; she has a stand in front of the route 113 bus stop; a very busy site that has much foot traffic all day. She is a cheerful and enterprising woman that starts her work day at 6am and goes until 5pm, a long work day that provides a roof over her head, food and everything her young son needs. He depends completely on her because Claudia is a single mother that must work twice as hard to get ahead. She is asking for funding to buy fruits and vegetables so that she will have a greater amount of product to offer her customers thus increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal LOS EMPRENDEDORES está formado por 9 socios, inician su primer ciclo y son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad Urubamba se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de verduras, comestibles y comida, otros socios brindan servicios como llamadas a celulares móviles, transporte urbano, zapatería, construcción de casas y limpieza de oficinas. Los socios que tienen negocios están preocupados porque las ventas han disminuido. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones de viaja a la ciudad del Cusco. El turismo ha decaído considerablemente.  
     
Rosa es socia del banco comunal los Emprendedores, tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija llamada Yudith que tiene 10 meses de nacida. Rosa se dedica a la venta jugos a base de quinua de manera ambulatoria, la socia nos cuenta que solo el miércoles óseo una vez al mes sale a vender y los demás días se dedica a las actividades del hogar, ella sale a vender desde muy temprano exactamente a las 6 a.m. y se queda hasta las 9 a.m. Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar una carretilla donde pueda llevar sus jugos de quinua. Su esposo David es mototaxi y así de esa manera ayuda a el ingreso familiar.  
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The LOS EMPRENDEDORES communal bank is made up of 9 members who are starting their first loan cycle; they are workers who constantly seek ways to succeed and to give their children a better future with their daily effort. The members reside in the city of Urubamba, Cusco department; a city that is noted for its beautiful scenery, its agriculture and its cattle raising. The members are engaged in various commercial activities such as: vegetable sales, food and prepared meals sales. Some members sell cell phone cards, some provide urban transportation services, shoe store, home construction, office cleaning services. The members who have businesses are worried because sales have dropped. The heavy rains that fell on Cusco for three days caused many tourists to cancel their travel plans to Cusco. Tourism has declined considerably. Rosa is a member of the Los Emprendedores communal bank. She is 19 years old, lives with her life partner and has a daughter, Yudith, who is 10 months old. Rosa sells quinoa-based fruit juices. She tells us that she only goes out to sell on Wednesdays. The rest of the days she is a housewife. She goes out to sell from 6am and stays out until 9am. Rosa needs funding to buy a pushcart to carry her quinoa juices. Her husband, David, is a mototaxi driver and he contributes to household expenses that way. The members, in general, are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and pledge to repay their various payments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pushcart.

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Pet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Mach P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members who are all located in Veay Chhneah village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Mr. Trey Mork, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice to support their family. However hard this family tries to work, they earn less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Mach P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise.

Mrs. Mach P. is the mother of three children, two of whom are waiters in a restaurant, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Nget M. is the group leader who has been selected by the members who all reside in Prey Robang village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Nget M. is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Roeurng S., is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land on which he grows crops to support his family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nget M. decided to request a loan to buy silk for weaving.

Mrs. Nget M. is the mother of five children, two of whom are weavers while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Nueva Luz De Pachaquillay Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal NUEVA LUZ DE PACHAQUILLAY está formado por 9 socios, inician su tercer ciclo y son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la comunidad de Pachaquillay de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad Anta se encuentra ubicado a una media hora de la Ciudad del Cusco. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comida, venta de artesanía, venta de granos y venta de ganado, otros socios brindan servicios como construcción de casas. Los socios que tienen negocios están preocupados porque las ventas han disminuido debido a las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco pues hicieron que clientes cancelaron sus viajes a la ciudad de Pachaquillay y ahora los socios están tratando de recuperar las ventas perdidas.    
     
Edgar es socio del banco comunal “Nueva luz de Pachaquillay”, tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y su esposa se llama Yovana, ellos se dedican a la compra y venta de árboles de eucalipto. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más árboles de Eucaliptos. 
   
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The NUEVA LUZ DE PACHAQUILLAY communal bank is made up of 9 members who are starting their 3rd loan cycle. They are workers who always seek opportunities to succeed and to provide a better future for their children through their hard work. The members reside in Pachaquillay, Anta province, Cusco department; a city that is noted for its beautiful scenery, its agriculture and its cattle raising. The city of Anta is half an hour away from the city of Cusco. The members are involved in various commercial activities, such as: food sales, crafts sales, grain and cattle sales. Others provide services like home construction. The members who have businesses are worried because sales have declined due to the heavy rains that fell on Cusco for three days. This caused many travelers to cancel their trips to Pachaquillay and now the members are trying to recuperate their losses. Edgar is a member of the “Nueva Luz de Pachaquillay” communal bank. He is 31 years old, lives with his life partner, Yovana. They are eucalyptus tree merchants. He needs funding to buy more eucalyptus trees. The members, in general, are grateful for the opportunity provided and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more eucalyptus trees.

loans.name: Mrs. Kea Doeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Kea D. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked

Mrs. Kea D. and her husband, Mr. Chork Doul, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. In the rice field, they have a problem because it has infertile soil but they do not have enough money to support it.

Thus, in order to improve their family living conditions, Mrs. Kea D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support their field to increase their rice yield this current year.

Mrs. Kea D. is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: María Tomasa

texts.es: María Tomasa
texts.en: María Tomasa

loans.use: Buy sugar cane candy and banana, potato and yucca chips

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria del Carmen V. C. de 35 años de edad, reside en Goteras ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo, y seis hijos menores de edad, su compañero de vida trabaja en una panadería junto a su hijo mayor de 17 años de edad, los cinco hijos menores se dedican a estudiar. Gloria se dedica a la venta de pan, el cual comercializa a las afueras de una escuela, este es un lugar muy estratégico para ella, debido a que muchas personas transitan por este sitio, así mismo cuenta con varios clientes quienes al recoger a sus niños en la escuela aprovechan para comprar pan. Gloria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pan, ya que en muchas ocasiones no puede vender más porque su producto se agota, es por ello que cuenta con la ilusión de poder aumentar sus ingresos comprando más pan. Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposos con los gastos del hogar, así mismo contar con la capacidad para brindarle estudios a sus cinco hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen V. C. is 35 years old and a resident of Goteras, located in the Department of Morazán. She lives with her husband and six dependent children. Her husband works at a bakery with their oldest son, who is 17 years old. The five younger children are still in school.

Gloria sells bread outside of a school, which is a strategic location since many people pass through that area. She has several customers who buy bread while they are picking up their children. Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of bread because there have been several occasions in which she has run out of product. She also hopes that buying more bread will translate into an increase in her sales.

Gloria is an extremely hardworking woman who strives daily to help her husband with the household expenses. In addition, she hopes to be capable of providing an education for her five younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rubenia

texts.es: Blanca Rubenia H. D. N. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 8 años D. edad y el menor D. 9 meses D. vida. Blanca se dedica a la venta D. pollos, gallinas indias y pavos, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Municipal D. Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual tiene 5 años D. tener este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy conocida por ser muy amable y responsable, quien cuenta con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos. Blanca solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más gallinas indias, ya que estas se venden a mayores precios ya que no se encuentran muy fácilmente. Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que desD. hace mucho tiempo atrás le ha permitido contar con todo lo básico para contar con una vida estable, es por ello que desea poder mejorarlo y obtener mayores ganancias y brindarle una mayor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Rubenia H. D. N. is 30 years old and a resident of the Department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 9 months. Blanca sells chickens, Caribbean hens, and turkeys at the municipal market of Ahuachapán. She has been in business for five years and is well-known for being a caring and responsible woman. Blanca is eager to move forward and proviD. everything necessary for her two children.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more Caribbean hens, since they sell at higher prices because they are not easily found. Her business has proven to be very profitable and has enabled her to proviD. all of the basics needed to have a stable life. Blanca wants to improve her business and earn more income so that she proviD. even greater financial stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hens

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa A. D. H. D. 50 años D. edad,resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como profesor D. educación física. DesD. hace 10 años que María posee una comercial, en el cual venD. productos para el hogar como muebles, electrodomésticos y otro productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor variedad D. productos, ya que cuenta con muy buenas ventas y con mucho clientes lo cuales por sus precios bajos, prefieren esta comercial. Para María es muy importante poder crecer más como comerciante, ya que ha sido gracias a este, como ha podido seguir adelante durante mucho tiempo, razón por la que espera poder incrementar su inventario y así mejorar sus ventas, las cuales le permitan mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Teresa A. D. H. is 50 years old and a resident of the Department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband who works as a physical education teacher. For the past ten years, María has managed a business in which she sells products for the home such as furniture, appliances, and other items.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a wider variety of products. María already generates good sales and has many customers who prefer to shop at her store because of the low prices. For María, it is important to grow as a businesswoman because she expects to continue working for a long time. She hopes to increase her inventory and grow her sales so that she can improve the financial stability of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture & appliances

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto L. de 37 años de edad, reside en departamento de San miguel, lugar en cual vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad. Juan Alberto se dedica a la venta de especias, las cuales se utilizan para dar sabor a los alimentos, así mismo vende medicina natural. Su negocio esta ubicado frente al Mercado Municipal de Santa Rosa, situado en el departamento de San Miguel. Debido a la falta de empleos fijos, Juan Alberto decidió emprender su propio negocio, en el cual trabaja desde hace cuatro años, ha pesar de muchos obstáculo, Juan ha trabaja muy duro por poder seguir con su negocio, incrementando nuevos productos, los cuales las personas le solicitan, esto lo ha ido haciendo poco a poco, ya que los gastos del hogar son grandes y es poco el dinero que le queda para invertir en su negocio. Es por esto que Juan solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de especias y medinas, de manera que cada vez que un cliente
texts.en:
Juan Alberto L. is 37 years old and a resident of the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife, who handles the household chores and looks after their two children, ages 7 and 3.

Juan Alberto sells spices used for flavoring food and also natural medicines. His business is located in front of the Santa Rosa Municipal Market in the Department of San Miguel. Due to a shortage of permanent jobs, Juan Alberto decided to start his own business and has been in operation for the past four years. Despite facing many obstacles, he has worked very hard to maintain his business by adding new products that his customers request. Even though his business has been growing gradually, his household expenses are numerous and there is little money left over to reinvest back into the business. For this reason, Juan Alberto is requesting a loan to buy spices and natural medicines in large quantities so that he can satisfy each customer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural medicines & spices

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly A. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling used clothes and by sugarcane farming. Nelly’s husband, Cesar, is 52 years old and helps in running the used-clothes business. They have four children who are between 18 and 29 years old. Some of their children are already gainfully employed and only one still goes to school. Nelly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by selling used clothing and by sugarcane farming. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 40,000 from her business activities. Nelly is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 49,000 was used to fund operations of her used-clothing business and sugarcane farming activities and it had a positive impact on both the businesses and on the family’s living conditions. Now, Nelly is borrowing Php 49,000 for her 15th loan which she intends to use to buy more stock of used-clothing and to fund operation of her sugarcane farming activities. Nelly is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more used-clothing and to fund her sugarcane farming

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., age 22, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has no children.

L. is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning approximately $7 in revenue per day. Her husband helps her in the business and is able to earn the same amount of income as his wife. They have been with the business since 1999.

Their standard of living has improved since they have this business, so they want to have a loan to expand their business. L. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Manis Kasih Cooperative (Group B)

texts.en: Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative (Sweet Love) is a village banking organization located in Manistutu village near the town of Melaya in northwest Bali. Manis Kasih was originally formed out of the initiative of mothers who, at the time, found it very difficult to obtain loans to develop their businesses. Local banks had numerous requirements that were quite burdensome to the women and thus made it difficult to secure loans. This group was formed to make loans more accessible to the women in the region and, with its continued growth, became a legal entity in Bali in 2007. At this time, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative has 126 members, all of whom are mothers of children of various ages. The group is located in a rural region of Bali, thus the majority of the women utilizing these loans work in agriculture as farmers, breeders or traders. Other women own small shops that sell daily goods such as rice, soap, etc. In this group there are also a few tailors and chocolate traders who will receive loans. To meet the needs of its members and allow them to expand their businesses, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative is working with Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) and Kiva to receive a loan fund that will be managed by the group leadership in accordance with the rules the members have established. The leadership team pictured here will receive this loan and will distribute it to a group of approximately forty women who are all members of Manis Kasih. The loan money will allow the women to expand their respective businesses by buying new livestock, food or supplies for their animals, or by buying items to sell in their stores. This subset of the Manis Kasih is headed by Ni Putu B. and they have requested a loan in the amount of 25,000,000 IDR. Ni Putu B. is a chocolate merchant. As the wife of a farmer, she chooses to not stay at home quietly, simply relying on her husband’s income. Instead, she searches for additional family income by riding on her motorcycle around the village each day to buy local crops such as coconuts, bananas and chocolate that she can sell in markets in neighboring regions. With her profits from this venture she supplements her husband’s income primarily to pay the school fees of her two young children. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To buy more local crops such as coconuts, bananas and chocolate

loans.name: Manis Kasih Women’S Cooperative (Group A)

texts.en: Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative (Sweet Love) is a village banking organization located in Manistutu village near the town of Melaya in northwest Bali. Manis Kasih was originally formed out of the initiative of mothers who, at the time, found it very difficult to obtain loans to develop their businesses. Local banks had numerous requirements that were quit burdensome to the women and thus made it difficult to secure loans. This group was formed to make loans more accessible to the women in the region and, with its continued growth, became a legal entity in Bali in 2007. At this time, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative has 126 members, all of whom are mothers of children of various ages. The group is located in a rural region of Bali, thus the majority of the women utilizing these loans work in agriculture as farmers, breeders or traders. Other women own small shops that sell daily goods such as rice, soap, etc. To meet the needs of its members and allow them to expand their businesses, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative is working with Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) and Kiva to receive a loan fund that will be managed by the group leadership in accordance with the rules the members have established. The leadership team pictured here will receive this loan and will distribute it to a group of approximately forty women who are all members of Manis Kasih. The loan money will allow the women to expand their respective businesses by buying new livestock, food or supplies for their animals, or by buying items to sell in their stores. This subset of the group is headed by Ni Wayan W. and they have requested a loan of 25,000,000 IDR. Ni Wayan W. will be using her portion of the loan for her cattle business. She cares for cattle that belong to others and is then paid a yearly salary above her expenses. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Pit

texts.en: Pit D., aged 26, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children, one of whom studies at the local primary school. Since 2007, D. has had a business sewing traditional clothes, and earns approximately $2 USD in revenue per day. Her husband is a farmer. He plants various kinds of vegetables to sell to new and existing customers at the market, and earns an income of $3 USD per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have started these businesses, so they are now requesting a loan to expand their businesses. D. is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables for sale. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia M. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Nelia joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Manis Kasih Cooperative (Group C)

texts.en:
“Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative” (Sweet Love) is a village banking organization located in Manistutu village, near the town of Melaya in north-west Bali. Manis Kasih was originally formed out of the initiative of mothers who, at the time, found it very difficult to obtain loans to develop their businesses. Local banks had numerous requirements that were quite burdensome to the women and thus made it difficult to secure loans. This group was formed to make loans more accessible to women in the region and, given its continued growth, became a legal entity in Bali in 2007.
At this time, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative has 126 members, all of whom are mothers of children of various ages. The group is located in a rural region of Bali, thus the majority of the women utilizing these loans work in agriculture as farmers, breeders or traders. Other women own small shops that sell daily goods such as rice, soap, etc. In this group, there are also a few women who harvest rice and one woman who makes cakes.
To meet the needs of its members and allow them to expand their businesses, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative is working with Mitra Usaha Kecil Koperasi (MUK) and Kiva to receive a loan fund that will be managed by group leadership in accordance with the rules the members have established. The leadership team pictured here will receive this loan and distribute it to a group of approximately 45 women who are all members of Manis Kasih. The loan money will allow the women to expand their respective businesses by buying new livestock, food or supplies for their animals, or by buying items to sell in their stores.
This subset of the Manis Kasih is headed by Ni Ketut G.. The group has requested a loan of 30,000,000 IDR. Ni Ketut G. manages a small shop in front of her home. Although her husband has a steady job in his village as an officer, Ni Ketut G. does not rely on her husband's fixed income. At the shop in front of her home, she sells all kinds of daily necessities such as rice, oil, writing equipment and various cakes and snacks. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase additional merchandise that she is lacking. This will help Ni Ketut G. earn extra income to supplement her husband's earnings.

Note to Kiva lenders
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please copy and paste this URL into a new browser window: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking

loans.use: To buy livestock to be bred, fattened and sold

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss. Sreymom V., aged 20, is single and lives with her widowed mother, sisters and brother in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sreymom has been a silk weaver for five years, and learned this skill from a neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Sreymom is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., aged 31, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are studying at a local primary school. Since 2007, S. has raised pigs at home, earning approximately $2 USD in revenue per day. Her husband is a skillful painter who is able to earn an income of $2.5 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses, so S. would like a loan to expand their businesses. She is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT. 
Her husband is pictured because S. was not available at the time of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S. (pictured here), and his wife, Mrs. Im Proeung, live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1993 and have 4 children: 3 sons (one of them married and living outside the family home). One is a construction worker and the other one is still young. Their daughter is a garment factory worker.

Sok has been a fisherman for more than 10 years. He fishes in the lake nearby his house, while his wife transports the caught fish to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Sok asked for a Kiva loan one time already. He now is asking for his second loan of US$ 1,000 to fill up the land around the foundation of his house.

loans.use: To fill up the land around the foundation of his house

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis V. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Nabantu-an 1, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and selling frozen products retail.

Lotis’s husband Ian is 38 years old and is gainfully employed. Their only child is 9 years old and currently goes to school. Lotis joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in running a general store and selling frozen food products. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000 from her business activities.

Lotis is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 23,000 was used to fund the operation of her general store and frozen products retailing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 18th loan, in the amount of Php 23,000, which she intends to use as working capital for her general store and frozen products retailing business. Lotis is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

texts.en:

Aofa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 tala or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Aofa joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

About CREDIT:

CREDIT MFI (Cambodia Rural Economic Development Initiative for Transformation Microfinance Institution) is an independent, faith-based Cambodian organization. It aims to empower economically-active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.
