texts.en: Bridget S. is married with 4 children.  Her children are excelling in school. Bridget has a stall where she sells lace, sarongs and shoes. Her customers are usually residents, friends and neighbors. She hopes for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She hopes to own a classic boutique in the future.  Bridget is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Bridget says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Laura Jonas

texts.pt:
Laura Jonas N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul deMoçambique tem 32 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de13,07e 02 anos de idade, os mais velhos vao a escola. Retomou na 6ª classe este ano depois de ter parado com os estudos apos o casamento. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, o marido é carpinteiro de profissao . Sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro para ajudar em dispesas familiares.
Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, vive e trabalha no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infância. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 7 anos, não possui nenhum empregado conta apenas com a ajuda do seu esposo e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende mais capulanas, que por vezes desloca se ate ao reino da Suazilandia. Neste negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de visinhos que também sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos( capulanas e lenços ) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt ambos para  a mesma actividade.
Tem como objectivo diversificar o produto para a satisfação da sua clientela assim como aumento da sua renda.No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  iniciar com as actividades de salao de cabelereiro.
texts.en:
Laura Jonas N. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are 13, 7, and 2 years old. The oldest go to school. She repeated the 6th grade after having left school to get married. She lives in her own home with her family, and her husband is a carpenter. She supports her parents by sending them money in order to help out with family costs. She has never left Maputo Province; she has lived and worked in Boane District since she was young. She has had her own business for over 7 years. She doesn't have any assistants, but rather counts on the help of her husband, who works about 10 hours each day. She sells capulanas (traditional colorful skirts) and sometimes even travels to Swaziland to do this. With this work, she earns about 6,000 MZN each month, which she uses for household costs. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of the institution. This is her third loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. She plans to use this loan to buy products (capulanas and lenços, or headwraps) in order to increase her supply and diversify her merchandise. The previous loans were for 7,000 MZN and 18,000 MZN, both for the same purpose. Her objective is to diversify the products she sells in order to satisfy her customers and increase her income. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans in order to open a hairdressing salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell capulanas (traditional colorful skirts)

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline U. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. Her youngest child is 11 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education.  Roseline loves jewelry and that is why she sells jewelry to earn a living. She has been in this business for a long time.  Roseline is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.  Roseline says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is 53 years old and married with 7 children. Her children are excelling in their jobs and education.  Roseline sells crates of eggs at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She wants to be a major distributor of eggs in her community of Sapele. Roseline hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.  She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Jeronica Enoque

texts.pt:
Jeronica Enoque S. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, devorciada mae de 2 filhos de 15 e 24 anos de idade a mais nova continua a estudar. Fez somente 5 classe não continuou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
 Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, quando casou se esteve a viver na cidade de Maputo. 12 anos depois separou se e veio residir em Boane. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 15 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, nao tem horario fixo, e trabalha através de encomendas. Vende televisores e DVDs e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da senhora Argentina amiga vendedora do mercado de Boane que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos para revender (Televisores, DVDs e outros) aumentando a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.200.00mt, 10.500.00mt, 14.000.00mt e20.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua residencia e melhorar ainda o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Jeronica Enoque S. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 44 years old, and is a divorced mother of 2 children who are 15 and 24 years old. The youngest continues to go to school. She only completed the 5th grade and did not continue due to her parents' lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. She has never left Maputo Province. When she married, she went to live in the city of Maputo. She she and her husband separated 12 years later, she went to live in Boane. She has had her own business for more than 15 years. She does not have any help at her job, does not have a fixed schedule, and works by filling orders. She sells televisions and DVD players and earns about 10,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household costs. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She has never had loans through other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through Mrs. Argentina, a friend of hers who sells good at the Boane market and who is also a client of the institution. This is her fifth loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. She plans to use it to goods to resell (televisions, DVD players, etc.) in order to increase her supply and diversify her merchandise. Her previous loans were for 7,200 MZN, 10,500 MZN, 14,000 MZN, and 20,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future she would like to ask for more loans in order to finish building her house and also to further improve her commercial business.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell domestic electronics

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les  4 femmes du groupe Yiriwa  sont toutes 4 mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Guegnéka de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes  font  l’achat et la vente de céréales, de condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes, des savons, des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  trois prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des colis de plusieurs variétés de condiments alimentaires telles les poivres, les oignons, les cubes maggies, les concentrées de tomates, les sels de cuisine, les sounbala, des habillements pour enfants des cartons de savons et produits cosmétiques.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui servira  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la familles et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
All four women from the Yiriwa group are married. On average they are 35 years old with 4 children, and live in traditional extended families in the Guegnéka neighborhood of Fana, in the Dioila prefecture of the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women buy and resell grain, culinary condiments, fruit and vegetables, soap, clothing and beauty products. Having correctly reimbursed three previous loans, the women from the Yiriwa group are requesting a fourth group loan which will used to buy: packages of a variety of culinary condiments such as pepper, onions, Maggi cubes, tomato paste, kitchen salt, sounbala (spicy seasoning), but also children’s clothing and cartons of soap and beauty products. They get their supplies mainly from local wholesalers and resell their products at the market, for cash or credit, to a customer base of both men and women. Each member of the group foresees monthly profits to reach 20,000 FCFA on average. Profits will be used to deal with family expenses and reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Ludovina Xavier

texts.pt:
Ludovina Xavier L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo Nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira mae de 2 filhos de 15 e 7 anos de idade todos vao a escola. Frequenta o 2º ano de faculdade na Universiadade pedagogica. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos e sustenta seus pais enviando lhes dinheiro para a despesas de casa.
 Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, actualmente vive no bairro Thanda Banto Distrito de Boane, é funcionária do Ministerio da Educaçao há mais de 17 anos. Foi formado pelo Centro de formaçao de professores de Namaacha e pelo Instituto de Magisterio Primario em Boane, trabalha como professora desde 1993 aufere um salario de 6.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua cunhada que tambem foi cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( azuleijos, blocos, varoes de ferro e outros ) para dar c ontinuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua residencia, iniciar com a construção do murro de vedação para poder ofercer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua familia.
texts.en:
Ludovina Xavier L. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 37 years old and a single mother of two children ages 15 and 7, both of whom attend school. She is in her second year at the University, studying education. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her parents, sending them money for household expenses. She has never moved outside the Maputo Province. She lives in the Thanda Banto District neighborhood in Boane. She has been an employee of the Ministry of Education for more than 17 years. She graduated from the Teachers College in Namaacha and from the Institute of Elementary Education in Boane. She has been working as a teacher since 1993 and earns 6.500.00 MT monthly, which she uses for household expenses and also saves a bit in her bank account. She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her sister in law who also was a client of Hluvuku. This is her third loan, for 20.000.00 MT which she will use to purchase construction materials (tiles, cinder blocks, metal rods, etc.) to continue building her home. The previous loans were for 12.000.00 MT and 15.000.00 MT, also for the same purpose. In the future she would like to request more loans to finish her home and to begin construction on an exterior wall to provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Enoh

texts.en: Enoh O. is married with 2 children. Her eldest child is 4 years old while the youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. Enoh is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells engine oil at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the daily needs of her family. Enoh hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Enoh says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift B. is 30 years old and married with 6 children. Her youngest child is 9 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Gift sells poultry to make a living in Sapele. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. Gift is a friendly woman and her friendliness attracts and retains customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell.

loans.name: Joao Tene Samuel

texts.pt:
Joao Tene Samuel M. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, casado pai de 5 filhos de 21, 12, 09,07 e 02 anos de idade, destes apenas 4 vao a escola. Fez somente 5 classe não continuou por falta de condições porque perdeu os seus pais muito jovem. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao  sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da Província de Inhambane para Maputo em 1978  com a sua familia a procura de melhores condições de vida. Vive no bairro 01 em Boane desde a sua chegada na provincia de Maputo. Trabalha como operador de máquinas ligeiras na empresa Caminhos-de-ferro de Moçambique há mais de 19 anos, actividade que aprendeu na mesma instituição. Aufere um salario mensal de 7.105.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( chapas de zinco, cimento, portas e varoes de ferro ) para dar c ontinuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar a sua residencia e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
João Tene Samuel M. was born in Massinga district in the province of Inhambane, in southern Mozambique. He is 45 years old, and the father of five children who are 21, 12, 9, 7 and 2 years old. Only four of them go to school. João only finished the fifth grade, and didn't continue because he lost his parents when he was very young. He lives with his family in his own house, and has no other dependents. He left Inhambane for Maputo in 1978 with his family in search of better living conditions. He has lived in the town of Boane since his arrival in the province of Maputo. He has worked as a light machine operator for the Mozambique Railroads Company for over 19 years, learning his trade at the same company. He earns a monthly salary of 7150 MZN., with which he pays his household expenses as well as saving some in his bank account. He has never held loans from other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the organization. This is his third loan, for 16000 MZN., with which he plans to buy construction material (galvanized roofing, cement, steel doors and rebar) in order to continue building his house. The earlier loans were for 7000 MZN. and 15000 MZN., and were both for the same purpose. He would like to apply for future loans in order to complete his residence and provide more comfort for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, other materials)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 62 years old and a widow with 9 children. She sells foodstuffs like rice and beans at retail prices to her customers in Sapele. Her customers are usually residents and friends. Victoria  hopes for a loan amount of NGN 90,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Victoria says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 03 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 1 classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras e pela negligencia dos progenitores. Vive na casa propria com seus filhos e sustenta um irmao que vivem com ele.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo com a sua mae depois da separação e foram fixar residência em Boane. Actualmente vive neste Distrito e tem um negocio proprio a mais de 17 anos, trabalha das 7h as 21horas, vende mais cerveja e refrescos nao possui nenhum empregado. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique ( sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do amigo Sr. Antonio Mundlovu que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos( cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria no seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt  todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  a ampliação do seu estabelecimento comercial e oferecer melhor comodidade aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Fernando C. was born in the city of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is 37 years old, and a single father of two children who are 12 and 3 years old. The eldest attends school. Fernando only completed the first grade, and didn't continue due to lack of resources and the negligence of his parents. He lives with his children in his own home, and also supports a brother who lives with him. He left Maputo with his mother after she left his father, and they relocated their residence to Boane. He currently lives in this district and has owned his own shop for over 17 years. He works from 7 am until 9 pm, and mainly sells beer and soft drinks. He has no employees. He earns around 1000 MZN a day, and uses the money for household expenses and saves some through a Xitique (a traditional savings system). He's never taken out a loan with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through his friend Mr. Antonio Mundlovu who is also a client of the organization. This is his fourth loan, and is in the amount of 17000 MZN. He plans to use the money to purchase products (beer, wine, soft drinks and others) to increase the quality of the merchandise in his establishment. The earlier loans were for 8000 MZN, 12000 MZN and 15000 MZN, and were all used for the same purpose. In the future, he hopes to apply for additional loans to increase the size of his commercial establishment and provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther U. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has been selling groceries for a long time. Esther loves her business because her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not sell on credit to her customers because she does not want to incur debt into her business. She hopes for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Esther  hopes to own a super market in the future. She is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Esther says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: We Go Able Group

texts.en: Pictured here are members of the We Go Able group from the small-town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. The leader of the group is Mohamed S. in the left of the photo. Born in a small-town call Lunsar in northern Sierra Leone, the 40-year-old has been a businessman for more than 25 years. He sells building materials – cement, zinc, etc. in Waterloo. Mohamed is married to a businesswoman and they have 19 children. Mohamed will use this loan to further expand his business; he will use the loan to buy building materials to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy house building materials to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is 31 years old and married without children. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. Faustina sells drinks and juice at retail prices to her customers.  She hopes to expand her business to include the sale of groceries in the future. Faustina hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Good Luck group from the small-town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. The leader of the group is Abibatu K. on the right of the photo. Born in a village call Mile 91 in northern Sierra Leone, the 28-year-old has been a businesswoman for 4 years now. She sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) in Waterloo. Abibatu is married to a businessman and they have 2 children. Abibatu will use this loan to further expand her business; she will use the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil and retail it in Waterloo. 

Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch.  This loan will be this group's first loan from SMT. With the help of this loan, this group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve on their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Aca Obede

texts.pt:
Aça Obede Dauana nasceu no Distrito de Boane,  Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, casada mae de 3 filhos de 09,04 e 01 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Tem a 10 classe feita e ainda continua a estudar, neste momento frequenta o 2º ano de formação de professores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mae que vive na localidade de Mahubo enviando dinheiro para as despesas de casa.
Nunca saiu de Boane, nasceu na localidade de Mahubo, mais tarde construiu uma residencia com a sua familia em Boane no bairo Fichi onde continua a residir actualmente. Ė funcionaria do Ministerio da Educação a mais de 9 anos, foi formada pelo Centro de Formação de professores de Namaacha e trabalha das 11.00h as 17.55h auferindo  um salario de 4.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que tambem sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra e outros ) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residencia. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt,15.000.00mt e 30.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar com a construção da casa e apostar cada vez mais no negocio que esta iniciando.
texts.en:
Aça Obede Dauana was born in the district of Boane, in Maputo province, southern Mozambique. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children 9, 4 and 1 year old. The oldest attends school. She completed 10th grade and is still studying- she is currently in the second year of teacher training. She lives with her family in her own home, and supports her mother who lives in the village of Mahubo sending her money for household expenses. She has never left Boane district, and was born in Mahubo. Later, she built a home with her family in the Fichi neighborhood of Boane where she continues to live. She has been an employee of the Ministry of Education for over nine years, and was trained at the Teacher Training Center in Namaacha. She works from 11 am until 5:55 pm and earns a monthly salary of 4500 MZN, which she uses for household expenses as well as saving some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the organization. This is her fourth loan, for 10,000 MZN, which she plans to use to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone and others) to continue building her residence. The previous loans were for 10,000, 15,000 and 30,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future she would like to take out additional loans to complete construction of her house and invest more in the business that she is starting.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand and others)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace I. is 57 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is self employed and he also supports the home. Her children are excelling in their various jobs and school. Grace sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She wants to expand her business in the future. Grace hopes for a loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.  She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou T. est 35 ans est mere de deux enfants, age 10 et 13. Elle habite a Ziguinchor, une ville dans le sud de Senegal qui attire beaucoup de tourist grace a son paysage agreable. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle est devenue une coiffeure et aujourd’hui elle partage une boutique avec 2 autre coiffeures. Avec le prêt de Kiva, elle souhaite renforcer son magasin, qui manque de produits essentiels. Avec les benefices elle peut soutenir ses enfants, un qui est a l’école, et l’autre qui prend des cours de danse.
texts.en:
Bintou T. is 35 years old and mother of two children, age 10 and 13. She lives in Ziguinchor, a town in the southern part of Senegal, which attracts a lot of tourists because of the beautiful countryside. Seven years ago she became a hairdresser and today shares a beauty salon with two other hairdressers. With the loan from Kiva, she wants to improve her salon, which is still lacking essential items. With the profits she will be able to support her children, one of whom is in school, and the other is taking dance lessons.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hairdressing products

loans.name: Class I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Class I group from the small-town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. The leader of the group is Edward K. on the left in the photo. Born in a village call Binkolo in northern Sierra Leone, the 34-year-old has been a businessman for 17 years . He sells second-hand clothes in Waterloo. Edward is married to a businesswoman and they have 3 children. Edward will use will use the loan to buy a bale of used clothes and to further expand his business; 

Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo. This will be their first loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Youssou D. est une homme de 37 ans, qui vie avec sa femme et deux petits enfants. Ils habitent a Ziguinchor, une ville dans le sud de Senegal, qui est connue pour son beau paysage. Youssou fabrique les sandales en cuir et vend au tourists dans la complex artiste à Ziguinchor. Il a commencé son apprentissage dans ce metier quand il était jeune car son pere etait dans la meme entreprise. Grace a son experience (plus que 20 ans!) le qualité de son travail est tres elevée. Avec le pret de Kiva Youssou va acheter plus de cuir pour fabriquer les sandales. Nous sommes au milieu de la saison touristique à Ziguinchor donc il veut etre preparé.
texts.en:
Youssou D. is 37 years old, and lives with his wife and two small children in Ziguinchor, a town in the southern part of Senegal, renowned for its pleasing vistas. Youssou makes leather sandals which he sells to tourists in the Arts and Crafts Center in Ziguinchor. He learned this trade when quite young, as his father was in the same business. Thanks to his experience (over 20 years) the quality of his work is very high. With the loan from Kiva, Youssou will buy more leather to make sandals. It is the middle of the tourist season in Ziguinchor, so he wants to be well prepared.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUy leather to make sandals

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy I. is 48 years old and married with 7 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old and all her children are doing well in their jobs and in school. Happy sells dried pepper at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to make her business more sustainable. In Nigeria, pepper is used in the preparation of mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods. Happy hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more dried pepper to sell.  She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.  Happy says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried pepper to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 54 years old, is married, and lives in Nyarugenge, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Marie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of drinks in her bar. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Marie is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more drinks so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

With these additional drinks for sale in her bar, Marie hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to take care of her family and use a portion of her profits to reinvest in her business.

Marie is really very thankful for any Kiva lender who will contribute to the loan so that she can increase her daily sales as well as increase the number of her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks for her pub

loans.name: Organized And Active Women Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Organizadas y Activas (MOA)” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del Barrio S. de la    ciudad de  Ñemby  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las venta de Ropas, de Bijouteries, Helados, Artesanias, etc.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la económía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.



      Hablaremos de la Señora Graciela Concepción M. Cáceres, es                casada, tiene 2 hijos una nena y un varón de profesión Policia y Docente. 
Ella vive en la casa de las calles Pte. Franco c/ Dr. Eusebio Ayala del Barrio S. (Centro) de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
La sra Graciela es una mujer muy activa y multifacética, hace 12 años que se desempeña como Policia en la ciudad de Ñemby, integro la comisión que durante años solicitaron las refacciones de la infraestructuras de la comisaria de la sitada localidad.
La Sra M. es Sub-Oficial Mayor de la Policial Nacional, hizo cursos sobre prevención de adicciones, Hoy dia se desempeña como encargada de el Programa de Prevención de Adicciones de la Comisaria 7º de Ñemby. 
Ademàs se desempeña como docente en varios colegios de su comunidad en la Catedra de Ética y ciudadania y otra clase adicional sobre prevención de adicciones como el Alcohol y las drogas.
Y para ello durante el 2008 y 2009 se puso en campaña para publicar un libro dirigido a niños y jóvenes de su querida ciudad de Ñemby a fin de implementar en los Centros Educativos de la zona. 
        Su esfuerzo tuvo sus frutos público varios ejemplares con la ayuda de la comisaria local y de algunos colegios, que lo pusieron en práctica como material de apoyo para la juventud estudiosa, y de esa manera aprenden jugando, pintando, un poco de autoestima, buenos modales, convivencia intrafamiliar y sobre todo a prevenir el consumo de drogas. 
Es un material muy didáctico que llego a ser muy elogiado por sus camaradas policias como por sus colegas docente.Tanto fue asi que el año pasado en el dia del  Agente de Policia,  recibió una medalla de oro, y una mención de honor por al merito de ser la primera mujer policia en públicar un libro titulado “Soy Libre” que trata sobre la prevención de adipciones.
   Su idea es relizar más publicaciones de su libro para otras instituciones educativas interesadas en el material.
         Graciela es una mujer que colabora ayuda a su comunidad, es muy solidadaria, formo parte de varias comisiones vecinales tales como pro-calle, pro-plaza, pro-comisaria de Ñemby, fueron años de tramites solicitando ayuda del gobierno  y gracias a ello este año se han comenzado las refacciones para el nuevo local policial de tan importante localidad.
texts.en:
The Organized and Active Women Committee was formed from the union of several neighbors in the Barrio S. zone of the city of Ñemby. All the members of the committee have developed independent occupations such as selling clothes, jewelry, ice cream, crafts etc. All the members of the committee are mothers who participate with the end goal of strengthening their household economy. They hope to develop their entrepreneurship in a sustainable way, with a vision of constant growth with the help of a permanent financial assistance. We spoke with Mrs. Graciela Concepción M. Cáceres. She is married with 2 children, a baby and a boy. She is a teacher and works with the police. She lives in a house in the central part of Barrio S. in the city of Villa Elisa. Mrs. Graciela is a very active and multi-talented lady. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a policewoman in the city of Ñemby and she made up the delegation that for years solicited the refurbishment of the infrastructure of the precinct. Mrs. M. is the Deputy Major of the National Police. She runs classes on the prevention of addictions. These days she is in charge of a program to prevent addictions in the 7th precinct of Ñemby. In addition, she acts as a teacher in the department of ethics and citizenship in various colleges in her community. She also teaches a class on the prevention of addictions such as alcohol and drugs. In 2008 and 2009, she worked to create a book aimed for the children and young people of her beloved city of Ñemby. Her efforts bore fruit and she published several samples with the help of local commissions and some colleges who used the material for their students. In this way they learned of gambling, self-esteem, role models, family living, and above all to how to prevent drug use. It is great teaching material and has been highly praised by her fellow police officers and by her fellow teachers. Last year, on the Day of the Police, she received a gold medal and a honorable mention for being the first woman police officer to publish a book. The book titled “I’m Free” is about the prevention of addictions. Her goal is to print more copied of her book for other educational institutions interested in the material. Graciela is a woman who helps her community. She is very good at unifying groups. She forms part of various neighborhood groups such as Pro-Calle, Pro-Plaza, Pro-comisaria de Ñemby and has done years of work to solicit the help of the government. Thanks to her efforts, this year they have begun the refurbishment of the new police station which is so important to this community.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books such as a Spanish - Guarani Dictionary

loans.name: Odille

texts.en:
Odille is 32 years old, is married, and takes care of two dependents. She lives in Gasabo where she owns a business selling women’s clothes and this is her eighth successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Odille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors. With this loan, she hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profits in the process.

This, in turn will allow Odille and her devoted husband to reinvest in some other sources of income as well as creating more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy addttional styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora N. is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. Dora has been in the used clothes business for 2 years. Used clothes have various nicknames in Nigeria. They are called by such names as  "bend down select", "okrika" and "help me select". The demand for used clothes is high in Dora's community. Dora he loves this business because she makes a lot of profit.  She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell.  In the future, Dora hopes to own a boutique where she will sell only used clothes. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 41 years old and is married with three children who are 5, 7 and 11 years old. Claudette and her family live in Rulindo, a region of Ruhengeli situated in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Here, Claudette operates a business selling charcoal and this is her third successful year in this business.

When Claudette started her business, her clients were few but now the number of them has increased to the extent that she is unable to satisfy them. To end this, Claudette is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

With this business expansion, Claudette hopes to earn more profits. With these profits, she will continue to take care of her family as well as saving for her future.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nilza Augusto

texts.pt:
Nilza Augusto S. nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de  Maputo, sul deMoçambique tem 23 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 04 e 01 anos de idade, destes ninguem vai a escola . fez somente 10ą classe parou com os estudos devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, o marido é trabalhador da empresa Electricidade de Moçambique . Para alem da sua familia nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu  da Matola para o Distrito de Boane com a sua familia no ano de 2005, a quando da transferencia do marido pela sua empresa. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 3 anos, este actividade desenvolve no quintal da sua casa, trabalha das 7horas ate as 17 horas todos os dias e não possui nenhum empregado. Neste negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua prima que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para  a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este emprestimo tambem, para poder aceder a outros creditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusao da sua obra e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Nilza Augusto was born in the city of Matola, in the Maputo Province, in the South of Mozambique. She is 23 years old, married and the mother of a 1-year old and a 4-year old. None of the children are in school. She only went to school until the 10th grade due to a teen pregnancy. She owns the house she lives in with her family. Her husband works for Mozambique Power Company. She doesn't support anyone other than her own family. In 2005, she left Matola for the Boane District with her family. Her husband was transferred there by his employer. She has had her own business in her backyard for over 3 years. She works from 7am to 5pm everyday and has no employees. Her business brings an income of around 3.000.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses and a traditional rotational savings system (Xitique). She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her cousin who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, is her third. She intends to building materials (screens, beams, cement and others) to continue building her house. The previous loans were for 6.000.00mt and15.000.00mt and were used for the same purpose. She makes a commitment to pay this loan on time, to be able to be granted further credit. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh started working as a private teacher in 2007 and has five years of experience in this occupation. She is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of one young child. She has prepared a speciA. room in her house for teaching and she takes students from her town. Today, Fatmeh is asking to borrow $900 to buy a computer to facilitate her job process and preparations for the students.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris O. is married with 3 children. Her youngest child is 3 years old. Her children are still young and they attend school. Her husband is a bricklayer and he also supports the home. Doris sells dried pepper to make a living in Sapele, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. Doris hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more dried pepper to sell. She hopes to expand her business to include the sale of other foodstuffs in the future. Doris thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried pepper to sell

loans.name: Ernesto Genez

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto es constructor de viviendas y quinchos, también realiza trabajos de jardinería, es oriundo de la compañía de Tañarandy de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones.

Don Ernesto es soltero, es independiente de sus padres y vive en casa propia con su familia.
El cliente siente gran satisfacción por operar con la institución y agradece la oportunidad.-
texts.en:
Ernesto builds homes and covered patios, and also works as a gardener. He is a native of the small town of Tañarandy, which is just outside the city of San Ignacio Misiones. Ernesto is single, independent of his parents, and lives in his own home with his family. He is very pleased to work with this institution, and appreciates the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various - to buy an electric mower

loans.name: Enoque Manuel

texts.pt:
Enoque Manuel M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul deMoçambique tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 17, 15, 13 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. fez somente 7ª classe naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta ainda seus pais enviando dinheiro e bens alimenticios.
 Nunca saiu de Boane, apenas saiu da casa dos pais para a casa propria depois de casar, ainda no mesmo Distrito. Ė proprietario de uma alfataria e alfaiate de profissaõ, trabalha com sua esposa que tambem desenvove a mesma actividade, faz em media 12 horas de tempo por dia. Por vezes tem feito trabalhos de electrecidade auto na empresa de camiões LALGY. Neste negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000mt por  més, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com amigos atraves de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos. conheceu  a Hluvuku através de seus colegas que também saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de corte e custura (tecidos, linha de cozer e outros) para produzir uniformes escolares e roupa diversa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para o seu negocio, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente o emprestimo para poder aceder a mais no futuro.
texts.en:
Enoque Manuel was born in the District of Chibuto, in the Gaza Province, in the South of Mozambique. He is 36 years old, married and the father of 4 children, 17, 15, 13 and 11-years old. The children are all in school. He only went to school until the 7th grade due to his parents' lack of financial resources. He owns the house he lives in with his family. He supports his parents by sending them money and food. He has never left Boane. He has only moved from his parents' home to his own, in the same District, after getting married. He owns a tailor shop and is a tailor by trade. He works with his wife who is also in the same trade. He normally works 12 hours a day. Sometimes he works doing electrical work in vehicles for the LALGY trucking company. His business brings and income of 10.000mt per month which goes towards house expenses and a traditional rotational savings system he participates in with his friends (Xitique). He has never had loans from other banks. He came to know about Hluvuku through his colleagues who are members. This is fourth loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt. He intends to purchase sewing supplies (fabric, thread and others) to sew school uniforms and various clothing items. The previous loans were for 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt and 15.000.00mt, all for the same activity. In the future, he would like to request more loans for his business. He makes a commitment to pay when due so that he will have access to more loans in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of fabric to sew school uniforms

loans.name: Petronilla Awuour

texts.en:
Petronilla Awuor O. is married to Johannes Makodia and they have three children. The first born, Collins, will be sitting for his final high school exams at the end of this year. Margaret is the second born and is also in high school, in form three.  The last born, Felistus, will be graduating from primary school at the end of this year.

Petronilla became interested in raising poultry from her mother, who used to do the same business when she was growing up. She has a vast experience of the same from her mother and is doing well rearing the chicken. She hopes to buy some egg-layers, which she will rear for a period of 3 months before they start laying in the fourth month. She is looking for a loan to enable her achieve this. She has taken a loan from Kadet Ltd before, which she successfully completed without any problems, thus giving her a good credit history.

Her clients mainly include the local shops and hotels, which she supplies with eggs and chicken. Her dream is to expand the farm and also introduce broilers to her business.

loans.use: To buy egg-laying chickens

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 14 years old. She is happy because her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. Mabel is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells electronics like microwave ovens  and electrical kettles in her shop. With over 19 years experience in sales, she has been able to attract and retain more customers to her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  Mabel says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Igor

texts.en: Igor Turanskiy is married with two children. He owns a small business selling various small home products - electrical, kitchen, cleaning, etc. He decided not to rent a booth at the market. Rather he goes out to neighboring small towns using his van and offers his inventory to people who live there. He has been in this business for 4 years and has gained many repeat clients. The inventory Igor offers is in high demand. His business is quite successful. Igor would like to receive a loan of 17,000 UAH to purchase more inventory and develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Julia Flores

texts.en: Señora Juliana Flores is a member of the "Villa Universitaria" committee in the city of San Ignacio Misiones, located on Route 1.  She is the mother of five young children who live with her. Juliana's husband is a bus driver, and travels frequently. Juliana is currently the Director of Finance for the committee.  She also bakes homemade bread and sweets to sell in the community and sells vegetables grown in her own garden.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Brisas 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Victoria is the coordinator of her group, Brisas (Breezes), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Victoria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing, by purchasing a dozen men's and women's pants to sell as well as a dozen polo shirts and blouses to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her home by improving the roof as well as saving money to proviD. for a day when she may become sick. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, polo shirts and blouses for resale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is happily married with two children. Her eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. 

Vero is a friendly woman. She loves her business so dearly that she sells daily from 7:00am to 7:00pm. She sells groceries and foodstuffs in her community in Sapele, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Matilde Insaurralde

texts.en: Matilde Insaurralde is a member of the "Mujeres Unidas" Committee in the city of San Ignacio Misiones, located on Route 1.  She is the mother of four young children who live with her.  Her husband and children work in construction.  Matilde owns two milking cows with which she produces and sells milk and cheese in addition to homemade eggs and seasonal fruit dishes.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Celeste is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Esperanza (Women in Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Celeste is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of used clothing sales by purchasing a large package of used clothing imported from places like the Salvation Army in the United States. She will use the profits to invest in her children first by purchasing everything that they need for school, including shoes, clothes, backpacks and notebooks. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to purchase a home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been selling groceries for three years. She loves her business because her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not sell on credit to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future. 

Josephine is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a tailor and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.  Josephine says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ilseyar

texts.en:
Ilseyar is married with two children. She sells gifts and souvenirs at the central Kahovka market. Her monthly income is about 4,000 UAH.

Ilseyar started this business nine years ago. At that time, her family was in big financial need. Ilseyar began to sell various items at the market and was successful in this. Her business developed well. It was and still is the main source of income in the family.

Ilseyar would like to receive 10,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Mirtha Madelaine

texts.en:
Mirtha is married and the mother of two children.  She and her husband own a mini-mart in the San Vincente neighborhood in the city of San Ignacio Misiones. The couple is very popular and well known in the neighborhood.

By obtaining the loan, they will be able to purchase additional merchandise and increase the variety of their inventory. This will increase the family's income, so the family is very thankful for this organization.

loans.use: To purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Miriam is the coordinator of her group, Mujers Bendecidas (Blessed Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Miriam is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon business by purchasing three hair straighteners, rolls, shampoo and conditioner. She will use the profits to invest in saving for a home in another part of the city which will be safer and therefore allow her children to grow up in a more stable environment. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair straightener, rolls, conditioner and shampoo

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Fish in Nigeria is an essential ingredient in the preparation of local soup like egusi (Melon soup). Agnes sells iced fish to make a living in Sapele. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more iced fish to sell. 

Agnes is 44 years old and married to a civil servant, and they have four children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase iced fish to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 25 years old, is married, and takes care of one child who is one year old. Noel lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Noel has many years of experience in business. He owns a small shop which sells various products such as: mirrors, watches, and so on as you can see from the photo. Noel has been an entrepreneur in this field since 2005.

With his experience, Noel is requesting a loan to reinvest in his business so that he can to gain more profits through selling more products to his customers. So far, the demands are increasing very fast, the reason why the support from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company is needed.

The profits Noel expects to gain will allow him to save enough money for his child and his family in general. He is a serious man in his business which is very organized. Shortly, through accessing this loan, and if his plans are successful, Noel will be able to continue his life as a self-employed man with a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Inocencio Alvarenga

texts.en: Inocencio is from Ayolas Misiones. He is a baker who specializes in sweets, such as sandwich cookies (alfajores), cakes and mini sweet pies that are packed and sold by the dozen in many stores in the city. Inocencio works with his wife in their house, which is located at Mil Viviendas Núcleo 2. The couple has two children. Inocencio is very satisfied with his work with the foundation (Fundación Paraguaya, Kiva's partner) as he has been able to develop and grow his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza en Ti (Hope in You), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, and is excited about the opportunity to grow her business with capital at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling clothing by purchasing a dozen pairs of panties, a dozen pairs of women's pants, a half dozen pairs of women's shoes and a half dozen blouses in the main market and then selling them at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her child, whom she wants to see in the university, as well as in her long-term dream of saving enough to purchase a home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Blouses, women's shoes, panties, women's pants

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nuevo Horizonte” se formó con la unión varias vecinas  de la ciudad de San Antonio. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
La Sra. Maria M. realiza trabajos de repostería sobre pedidos, para cumpleaños, quince años, bodas y otros acontecimientos, ella trabaja de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes actualmente ella hace sus trabajos o panaderías por que requiere de sus ingredientes en cantidad mayor y por ello agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado para cada una de ellas.
