texts.en:
The committee, “Maria Auxiliadora,” was formed jointly by some neighbors in the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood in the city of Ypane. All the members of the committee have different activities in sales.

The members have become very close and are capable of carrying out activities as a group, since the majority of the members are in sales and they are all colleagues.

All the members of the committee are mothers that perform their activities to strengthen the household finances and develop their sustainable businesses.

The activity that Mrs. Petrona E. does has helped her a lot since the income that she receives has helped her feed and clothe her family.

Below is a list of the activities of each member: 1 Petrona E. Selling Clothing 2 Patricia F. Selling Clothing 3 Maria F. Selling Clothing 4 Maria F. Baker 5 Lilia A. Selling makeup 6 Claudia D. Lottery Ticket Sales 7 Petrona N. Lottery Ticket Sales 8 Juana F. Selling drinks 9 Maria R. Snack bar 10 Elida C. Small grocery store 11 Nora A. Baker 12 Norma D. Selling clothing 13 Maria Z. Selling food 14 Edith G. Small grocery store 15 Leonidas P. Selling fruits 16 Mercedes V. Small grocery store

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, sweaters, sportswear

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender menestras en el mercado de la ciudad desde hace más de 12 años. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar este negocio porque los ingresos que su esposo percibía como obrero agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar la economía de su hogar. Todos los días Cristina vende menestras en grano y precocidas desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.

Cristina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más menestras para ampliar su negocio, ya que este se encuentra algo desabastecido debido a que tuvo que ser operada de su vesícula hace algunos meses y no podía atender su establecimiento.

Ella es una mujer activa y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old and is a mother to 4 children and lives with her husband in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold menestras (dried legumes) in the city market for over 12 years. She tells us that she had to start this business because her husband's earnings as a farmer was not enough to make ends meet in her home. Everyday Cristina sells menestras in grain and precooked from 8 in the morning until 2 o’clock.

Cristina applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for 1000 new soles, and she will invest it to buy more menestras to expand her business since its been in trouble ever since her vesicular operation some months back and she was not able to take care of her business.

Cristina is a very active and hardworking woman. Her biggest wish is to keep growing as an entrepreneur and to give her family a better quality of life. This is her second loan with our institution and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more menestras (dried legumes) to expand her business.

loans.name: Gradi Plus Group

texts.en:
Eugenie M. is a leader of a Community bank named “Gradi Plus” made up of 37 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Eugenie is 50 years old and the mother of seven children between the ages of 13 and 30. Two of her children attend school. Eugenie sells corn and manioc flour. She has been in business since 1983.  After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in January 2009. Eugenie has already received three loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. Currently, her business brings in a profit of $21 pêr week. With her next loan, she is planning to purchase five 10kg/sacks of corn to increase the inventory of her business. Eugenie’s dream is to do corn and manioc farming and be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchasing five sacks of corn

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hermes Nicolas

texts.es:
Hermes tiene 50 años, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus seis hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una empresa exportadora de espárragos. Pero los ingresos no le bastan para solventar sus gastos familiares, por este motivo pudo, con mucho esfuerzo, instalar una bodega en su casa hace algunos años, en ella ofrece a sus clientes abarrotes y bebidas.

Por otro lado también tiene una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual se genera algunos ingresos extras y ayuda a sostener su familia. 

Hermes se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su bodega y en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, ya que esta ha sufrido algunos desperfectos.

El es un padre trabajador y bastante responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen bastante estima. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo como empresario para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hermes is 50 years old, is married and lives with his wife and 2 of his 6 children in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the región of La Libertad, located 3 hours of the city of Chiclayo.

He works as a chauffeur to an asparagus exporting company. His income is not enough to meet his family’s expenses, and because of this, with much effort he set up a small grocery store in his home some years ago, where he sells groceries and drinks to his customers.

Additionally, he has a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport goods and passengers) and he gets extra income from it and uses it to sustain his family.

Hermes has asked for this loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for 1000 new soles that he will use to expand his small grocery store and for the maintenance of his mototaxi since it is in need of some repairs.

He is a hardworking and responsible father. His neighbors and people he knows all hold him in high esteem. His dream is to keep growing as an entrepreneur to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic household goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Totosa Plus” is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Anne L.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Anne L. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at the market located northeast of Kinshasa. She became a microentrepreneur in 1994. Anne has already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy pagnes. Currently she earns a profit of $50 a week. She will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself. Anne is 48 years old, widowed and the mother of six children aged 11 to 29. One of them attends school.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing (pagnes) to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una abnegada madre de 36 años, vive en compañía de su pareja Manuel, de 35 años, y con sus dos hijas: Adriana de 5 y Araiza de tan solo 3 meses de nacida. 

Ella está muy feliz porque a pesar de haber tenido recientemente a su bebé puede dedicarle tiempo a su trabajo, ya que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 9 años y esto le ha permitido disponer libremente de sus horarios.

Algunas veces, Dina lleva a su pequeña y se siente muy contenta de estar con ella y a la vez generar dinero para su hogar.

Para el futuro, Dina quiere instalar un bazar, negocio que espera le sea mucho más rentable, ya que le gusta mucho ayudar en la economía familiar y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad con todos sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más cosméticos para vender en esta época de verano, ya que los perfumes, desodorantes y cremas para el cuidado de la piel son muy solicitados.
texts.en:
Dina is a selfless mother who is 36 years old. She lives with her partner Manuel, who is 35, and her two daughters: Adriana, 5 and Araiza, only 3 months. She is very happy because despite having had her baby very recently she can dedicate time to her work. She has been selling beauty products for 9 years and this has allowed her to set her own schedule. Sometimes, she takes her little one and she feels very happy to be with her and at the same time make money for her household. For the future, Dina wants to set up a store. This will be more profitable. She likes helping in the family finances and supporting her husband with the household expenses. This is the fifth loan with MFP and she has always shown a lot of responsibility with all of her payments, the same as the other members of the group. With the money she is asking for now, she will buy more cosmetics to sell this summer, since perfumes, deodarants and skincare creams are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre y una hermana en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se desempeña como mototaxista, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años, el nos comenta que alquilaba mototaxis (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y que con las ganancias de esta actividad solventaba sus gastos personales y ayudaba al sostenimiento de su hogar.

Hace ocho meses pudo adquirir una mototaxi nueva y actualmente trabaja desde las cuatro de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche. Su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad.

Marcos es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, los que lo consideran un chico responsable y tranquilo. En la fotografía aparece apoyando a su padre en la refacción del techo de su vivienda, ya que su vehículo se encuentra actualmente en el taller.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 21, is single and lives with his father and a sister. They live in the Licapa sector of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He works as a taxi driver in a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and people). He has been doing this for five years. He says that he rented mototaxis, and he used his earnings from this activity to pay personal expenses and to help support his household. Eight months ago he was able to get a new mototaxi. He currently works from four in the morning until nine at night. His vehicle has started to have problems from excessive use. That is why he has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN. He plans to use the loan for the repair and maintenance of his mototaxi. Marcos is a young man who is well known and highly regarded by his neighbors. They consider him to be responsible and calm. In the photograph he is helping his father repair the roof of his house because his vehicle is currently in the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his vehicle

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa, vive al lado de su esposo y sus dos queridos hijos: Ángel y Milagros de 16 y 7 años respectivamente.
Su experiencia en el comercio la animó a tener un negocio propio, es así que desde hace 10 años implementó una librería, a la que le dedica la mayor parte del tiempo, pues abre desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 7 u 8 de la noche. 
A Edith le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y la hace sentir independiente, ya que no tiene que cumplir un horario y mucho menos obedecer a un jefe, esto la hace sentir realizada y muy productiva. Por otra parte, se esmera mucho en la atención, pues cliente que pisa su establecimiento es tratado muy cordialmente, es así como se ha hecho de buena fama en su barrio. 
Por tal motivo, para el futuro espera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio, surtirlo y convertir su librería en la más importante del barrio.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado ante su grupo por ser muy responsable y puntual con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cuadernos, lápices, colores, bolígrafos, etc., ya que se acerca la época escolar y piensa aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith, age 39, is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and their two beloved children. Ángel is 16, and Milagros is 7. Her experience in commerce motivated her to have her own business. So it was that ten years ago she set up a bookstore. She spends the greater part of her time on the business. She opens very early in the morning until approximately seven or eight at night. Edith likes her work a lot. It is peaceful, and it makes her feels independent. She does not have to follow a schedule or obey a boss. This makes her feel fulfilled and very productive. She takes great care in the attention to her customers. A customer who enters her establishment is treated very cordially. That is how she has gotten a good reputation in the neighborhood. That is why in the future she plans to keep making her business grow, stock it, and convert her bookstore into the most important one in the neighborhood. This is her fourth loan with MFP. In her group she has always been characterized as being very responsible and punctual with her payments. She will use the money she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of notebooks, pens, colored pencils, and pens, etc. The school season is approaching, and she plans to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Elba, 43, is a borrower who lives in L. Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz y Progreso (Light and Progress), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Elba is a single mother who lives with her three children in L. Alcarrizos, a small suburb of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Elba runs a successful beauty salon. With this loan, she plans to purchase a new hair dryer and more hair products for her customers.

This is Elba’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. Elba came to Esperanza not just for her loans, but because she likes the ideas and principles behind the work of the MFI. With continued profits, Elba hopes to purchase her own home someday. She also hopes to send her children to the best schools to get a great education. With your loan, she will be well on her way to accomplishing these goals.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Elba and the Luz y Progreso group!

loans.use: Hair dryer and haircare products

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Mirsa, es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace mas de ocho años logro poner un pequeño negocio de ventas de cosméticos, en donde vende una variedad de productos , así como eskimo, frescos y gaseosa. Tiene 31 años de edad, casada, procreo dos hijos los cuales es un par de gemelos de 7 años, ya cursan su primaria, su esposo trabaja como conductor de transporte pesado, y junto trabajan para poder ayudarse y poder apoyar a sus hijos. Inicio este pequeño negocio con ayuda económica que su mama dio, luego con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado ha ido creciendo en venta como en la captación de clientes. Con este préstamo comprara: perfumenes, cremas para cuerpo, cutis, vanidades, pinturas de labios, maquillajes, talcos, body, deseorantes, tintes de cabellos, así como sus clientes le hacen encargos ya que trabaja con catálogos y con productos de la  Avon. También   comprara  más eskimo, gaseosas, repostería para aumentar las ventas y poder a futuro comprar otra vitrina en donde pueda seguir ofertando sus productos. Todo esto ha sido posible con la ayuda de la institución por sus plazos de pagos y ayuda al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Mirsa is a hard-working woman. Over eight years ago she was able to set up a small business selling cosmetics. She sells a variety of products like ice cream, smoothie like fruit drinks, and soft drinks. She is 31, married, and has two children. The children are seven year old twins who are in primary school. Her husband works as a driver of heavy transport. They work together to be able help each other and to be able to support their children. She started this small business with the economic help that her mother gave her. Then, she got a loan with Afodenic. Sales have been growing, and she has gotten more customers. With this loan she will buy perfume, body and face cream, beauty products, lipstick, make-up, powder, deodorant, and hair coloring. Her customers place orders because she works with catalogs and with Avon products. She will also buy more ice cream, soft drinks, and pastry. She will do this to increase sales and be able to buy another display case in the future where she can continue offering her products. All of this has been possible with the help of the institution through their payment installments and help to small business people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, body and face cream, beauty products, lipstick, make-up, powder, deodorant, and hair coloring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a machine to help with her goldsmith business

loans.name: Elisa Davalos

texts.en:
Elisa is 62 years old and married to Juan F., who is 65 years old.  The couple has four kids who are married.  Elisa owns a food stall, which she inherited from her mother in 1990.  She now has a significant client base, thanks to the good service she provides.  Elisa's husband helps her run the business.

At the moment, Elisa is trying to expand her business to offer more products to her clients. This is why she requested the loan.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell in her food stand

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group la Nueva Esperanza (The New Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the poor, rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried foods such as fried chicken and empanadas. She will use the loan capital to invest in flour, cooking oil, meats and cheese. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children and to repair the roof on her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour, meats, cheese and oil

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis V. is 45 years old and married to Agueda Martinez, who is 48 years old.  They have 11 children, five daughters and six sons, who help support the family.  Luis has been working at the same business since 1990, providing local businesses with screws and other construction materials.  Along with his parents, Luis saved all of his money so that he would have capital and would be able to work independently and earn a better living.  Luis will use this loan to purchase milking cows, which will give him another source of income.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, comparte su vida con su pareja y con el menor de sus hijos, puesto que los mayores ya tienen su propia familia y son independientes.
Su negocio es el alquiler de lavadoras, por lo que permanece durante todo el día en su casa para atender a quienes le solicitan este servicio. Hoy cuenta con 5 modernas lavadoras, y con las ganancias adquiridas empezará a incursionar en la crianza y venta de cuyes de raza. 
Ella tiene buenas expectativas con estos dos negocios, los cuales la ayudarán a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.  Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará los cuyes y los materiales necesarios para construir las jaulas donde albergará a estos animalitos.
texts.en:
María, age 46, is a very happy and enthusiastic woman. She shares her life with her partner and the youngest of her children,. Her eldest children already have their own families and are independent.

María’s business is the rental of washing machines. She stays in her house in order to attend to those who ask her for this service. Today, she has 5 modern washing machines, and with the earnings from these she will begin to embark on the raising and sale of guinea pigs (used for food in Peru). She has high expectations for these two businesses, which will help her family to prosper.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she had always shown herself to be very responsible in paying her installments. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy guinea pigs and the materials necessary to build the cages where she will house these little animals.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a new business

loans.name: Milner

texts.en:
Milner P. is 30 years old, and he has been married to Leticia Gauto for eleven years. They have an 8-year-old son, and Leticia is eight months pregnant with their second child.

Milner has been working in transportation for ten years. At first he worked with his father, but, after his father's death, Milner took over the business as a transporter and stockpiler of cotton during the harvest. Additionally, Milner grows sugar cane, and, between these two jobs, he is able to support his family, which includes his mother-in-law who lives with the family.

Milner is requesting the loan in order to purchase a garage and to repair his truck, both of which will enable him to work during the upcoming soy harvest.

loans.use: To purchase a garage and to repair a truck

loans.name: La Unidad 4 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group, L. Unidad (The Unity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a poor, rural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Dominga is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado (small corner-store) by supplying it with more merchandise of the basic necessities such as rice, beans, cooking oil and matches.

Dominga will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies. Her longterm dream is own her own home and she hopes that by utilizing savings through Esperanza she will attain that. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cooking oil and matches for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Santa Librada, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
Así como la señora Ramona B. quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella viaja hasta el mercado 4 de la ciudad de Asunción, para comprar su mercaderías y revenderlo en su barrio de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa. La venta lo realiza visitando a clientes de diferentes zona y actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes quienes pagan en forma semanal o mensual por la mercaderías que ella les ofrece y vende.
Se citan las actividades que ellas realizan:

texts.en:
The “Working Mothers” Committee was formed by uniting various neighbors in the Santa Librada barrio of the city of Villa Elisa. All committee members carry out activities independently, as are their sales. The members make up a very united group, capable of acting together. Since the majority are dedicated to sales, they are actually colleagues. All committee members are mothers who are dedicated to their activities for the purpose of strengthening the household economy and developing their enterprises in a sustainable manner. One example is Mrs. Ramona B. who sells colothes. She travels to Market 4 in the city of Asunción to buy merchandise and resell it in her barrio in the City of Villa Elisa. To do this, she visits customers in different zones and, actually, she can count on many customers who pay weekly or monthly for her merchandise. Here are their activities: 1 Ramona B. Clothing sales 2 Daniela A. Sells meals 3 Evelyn M. Provisions store 4 Arninda B. Sells fruit 5 Olga A. Lottery sales 6 Aida S. Sells drinks 7 Leonora V. Café 8 Blanca Nuñez Provisions store 9 Francisca L. Pastrycook 10 Rosa G. Sells clothes 11 Andresa M. Sells meals 12 Nancy A. Provisions store 13 Lidia M. Sells fruit 14 Blanca R. Provisions store 15 Alejandra V. Sells fruit 16 Ana María C. Lottery sales 17 Sonia C. Sells drinks 18 Valentina D. Café

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING T-SHIRTS, DRESSES, BLOUSES, PANTS, HOSE, AND SHORTS TO SELL

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una carismática mujer de 37 años, su esposo Martín, de 41 años, es estibador y juntos sacan adelante a sus 3 hijos: Jonatan de 16, Marcia de 15 y Samir de 4 años.
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ella es muy dinámica y a pesar de tener hijos pequeños a los cuales debe cuidar, se da tiempo para su negocio, el cual le da muchas ventajas como el tener libertad en cuanto a realizarlo, pues lo hace desde la comodidad de su hogar donde tiene una vitrina. Sus amigas y vecinas al saber de las novedades que María ofrece siempre la visitan, logrando así muy buenas ventas. 
A pesar de lo cansado que es ir a cobrar, ella le pone muchas ganas y entusiasmo al realizarlo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga será muy bien invertido en la compra de más mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas. 
Para el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio e implementar una tienda bazar donde ofrezca todo tipo de adornos, cosméticos y demás novedades que al público le pueda interesar.

Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrado ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos cosméticos como shampoo, perfumes, talco, etc.
texts.en:
Maria is a charismatic 37 year-old woman. Her husband, Martín, is 41 and is a longshoreman. Together they are working to improve the lives of their 3 children: Jonatan, 16; Marcia, 15; and Samir, 4. For 9 years, Maria has sold beauty products. She is very dynamic, and in spite of having small children to care for, she gives time to her business. Her business has many advantages, such as having the freedom to schedule her own work hours and being able to sell from the comfort of her home where she has a glass display case. Her friends and neighbors always visit Maria to see the new products that she offers, and in this way she manages to make very good sales. Although it is tiring when she has to go collect the payments, she puts great desire and enthusiasm into it, since she knows that the money she obtains will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise with which she can increase her sales. For the future she wants to enlarge her business and have a general store where she can offer all types of accessories, cosmetics and other novelties that would interest the public. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she has proved to be very responsible with her payments. With the money she requests now she will buy a greater quantity of cosmetic products such as shampoo, perfumes, powders, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy cosmetics)

loans.name: Jaime Alonso

texts.es:
Jaime Alonso R. Gravito, tiene 46 años vive en el barrio Recreo de la ciudad de Barranquilla, su negocio es la elaboración de picadas y pastelería  en general.
Inicialmente trabajó como entrenador de futbol, pero quedo desempleado y con la necesidad de generar ingresos, montó una panadería con sus ahorros  e hizo un curso en le Sena para aprender este oficio; como no le fue bien en este negocio porque quedó iliquido, acudió la asesoria del Sena e  incursionó en el ramo de la pastelería, actividad a la que se dedica hace 5 años, de ella vive y permanece actualizándose en diversas líneas de productos. Al principio tuvo mucha incertidumbre porque su familia no pensaba que progresaría, pero recibió mucho apoyo y esto ayudó a mejorar su nivel de vida en familia. En la actualidad  tiene un amplio mercado individual y provee a casas de eventos y fiestas. 

Simultáneo a su negocio, realiza asesorias u orientaciones técnicas en la elaboración de estos productos a pequeñas unidades empresariales o personas que así lo requieran. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo  para extenderse y comercializar sus productos  a nivel de empresas, con este propósito solicita un crédito por $1.000.000 para comprar en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos. Su sueño es tener un punto de venta estilo gourmet, pero tiene un gran desafío y es construir un capital de trabajo  para  expandirse. Su mayor satisfacción es haber sido escogido para participar en el programa Desarrollo productivo DIP, por la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jaime Alonso R. Gravito is 46 years old and lives in the Recreo neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. His business is the production of snacks and pastries. He started his career as a soccer coach, but he lost his job and needed to earn some income, so he started a bakery (just selling bread) with his savings and took a course at the Sena School to learn this trade. This business was not going well – he has some problems with liquidity – so he sought advice from the Sena School and signed up for a class on pastries. He has been selling pastries for 5 years, and this business now allows him to earn a living; he continues to expand his diverse product line. At first he was very nervous, because his family doubted the success of the business, but he received a lot of support anyway. With this business, he has been able to improve his family's quality of life. He currently has a large, independent shop and he also caters at reception halls. While running this business, he also offers consulting services and technical courses on pastry-making to small businesses or entrepreneurs who would like to learn these skills. His greatest challenge is that he does not have enough working capital to expand his operations and commercialize his products within the corporate sector. With this goal, he is seeking a loan of $1,000,000 (Columbian) in order to buy a larger inventory of ingredients and raw materials. His dream is to have a gourmet-style restaurant, but still faces this great challenge of insufficient working capital to expand. He is very happy to have been chosen to participate in the Desarrollo Productivo (DIP) program because of the quality of its loan products.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and ingredients for his pastry-making business

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años y vive con su esposo Sergio, de 52 años, y con 2 de sus 3 hijos; Sergio y María de 9 y 18 años respectivamente.
Nos cuenta que cuando llegó a habitar su casa, esta era muy humilde, pues era de materiales rústicos como esteras y carrizos, poco a poco la fue mejorando y levantando, gracias al duro esfuerzo de ella y su esposo. Ahora posee una tienda de abarrotes y también un pequeño taller de estampados de ropa, que es a lo que le dedica mucho más tiempo, pues es un trabajo que requiere de mucha dedicación. 
Lo que Mirta hace es recibir polos de talleres textiles, los estampa o borda diferentes figuras, haciéndolos más atractivos para que se puedan vender más rápido. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, puesto que le da la oportunidad de usar su creatividad. 
Para el futuro le gustaría que su taller sea más grande y tener a varios empleados trabajando para, pero sin descuidar su pequeña bodega, la cual también le resulta muy productiva.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y le ha ido muy bien con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales, al igual que ella. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará materiales como pinturas de diferentes colores y algunas herramientas para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mirta is a very hard working woman, who is 50 years old and lives with her husband Sergio, who is 53 years old, who she has two of 3 children with; Sergio and María are 9 and 18 years respectively. She tells us that when she arrived to live at her house, it was very modest, and well, it was of rustic materials like a thatch roof. Little by little, she improved and raised it, thanks the strength of her and her husband. Now she owns a grocery store and also a small stand to pattern clothing, where she spends a lot of time working, as it's a job that requires a lot of dedication. What Mirta has to do is to receive textile fabrics, and stamps them with patterns and different border figures, making them more attractive so they can be sold more rapidly. She likes her job very much, as while as the opportunity to use her creativity. For the future, she would like to stand to become bigger and to have several employees working there, but without worrying about her grocery story, which is also very productive. This is her fifth credit with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she has done very well paying her loans. To date, all of her partners are very punctual, the same as her. With the money that she is asking for now, she will buy materials like paint in different colors and also some tools to facilitate her job.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto A. is 28 years old and married to Ramona Fernandez, who is also 28 years old. They have two marvelous children.

Roberto began this type of work in 1997 as an employee in a rubber company. After a number of years he had gained enough experience that he decided to start his own business. He now has a solid client base throughout the city.

Robert will use the loan to purchase more used tents to repair and later sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more used tents to repair and sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 37 años, conformó una familia feliz con Ana, su esposa, y sus 2 hijos; Jean Carlos de 13 y Rosmery de 8 años.
Desde hace 8 años empezó a brindar el servicio de taxi y le va muy bien, pues todos los días trabaja desde tempranas horas por las calles de la ciudad de Lima. Él menciona que acepta todas las dificultades que trae consigo su trabajo por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, a los cuales quiere ver profesionales en un futuro. Su esposa Ana es su principal apoyo y entre los dos laboran cada día por el progreso de su hogar, pues saben que ahora que están jóvenes deben poner todo de su parte para construirse un futuro mejor. 
En adelante quiere comprar otro carro para alquilarlo y obtener ingresos adicionales, y así, poco a poco, ir edificando un buen porvenir para su familia.

Roberto ya tiene experiencia con los créditos en MFP, este es su cuarto préstamo y en su grupo no tiene problemas, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará refaccionar su auto, el cual ya es propio.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old, and has a happy family that includes Ana, his wife, and their 2 children: Jean Carlos, 13; and Rosmery, 8. Eight years ago he started a business providing taxi services, and it is doing very well. Each day from very early in the morning he works in the streets of the city of Lima. He mentions that he accepts all of the difficulties that come with his job for the welfare of his small children, whom he would like to see become professionals in the future. His wife Ana is his main support and between the two of them they work every day to improve their economic well-being. They know that since they are young now they must do everything in their power to build a better future. In the future, he wants to buy another car that he could rent out to obtain increased earnings and gradually build a better future for his family. Roberto has experience with loans from MFP; this is his 4th loan and his group does not have any problems, since all of his fellow members are very punctual with their payments. With the money that he requests now he will refurbish his auto, which he owns.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his auto

loans.name: Zeida

texts.es:
Zeida es una trabajadora mujer de 34 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas: Yamile de 3 y Tayra de 2 añitos, en la casa de su madre.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales (masa de maíz cocida al vapor, envuelta en hojas de la mazorca), actividad que le toma casi todo el día, pues solo en la preparación se tarda como 3 horas, pues es muy minuciosa con cada ingrediente, ya que las buenas ventas dependen del rico acabado de este cotizado entremés. A Zeida le gusta la cocina y su trabajo le da la posibilidad de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, además se siente muy independiente con ello. Por suerte, para ella no tiene problemas con las ventas y además es muy conocida por la zona en la que vive debido a su rica sazón. 
Adicionalmente vende ropa, la reparte a domicilio según los pedidos que le realizan sus vecinas y amistades; con ambas actividades espera progresar y vender más en el futuro.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad con todos los pagos de sus cuotas y el trabajo con sus compañeras siempre ha sido de apoyo y colaboración. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para elaborar sus tamales y también ropa para vender a pedido.
texts.en:
Zeida is a hardworking woman who is 34 years old. She lives with her partner and her two daughters, Yamile, 3 and Tayra, 2, in her mother's house. She makes and sells tamales (steamed corn meal wrapped in corn husks). This activity takes her almost all day. The preparation alone takes almost 3 hours. She is very careful with each ingredient, since good sales depend on a good finished product of this appetizer. Zeida likes to cook and her job offers her family the chance to have a better quality of life. She also feels very independent with it. Luckily, she has no problems with sales and she is also very well known in the area where she lives because of her delicious seasoning. She also sells clothes. She delivers them to homes according to what has been ordered by her neighbors and friends. With both activities she hopes to progress and sell more in the future. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always demonstrated responsibility with all of her payments and the work of the other members has always been supportive and cooperative. With the money that she is asking for now she will buy a larger quantity of products to make her tamales and also to sell clothes by order.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her tamales

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es:
Ana Matilde H. E., tiene 38 años vive en el popular barrio San Isidro de la Ciudad de Barranquilla donde se dedica a la fabricación de bollos, alimento que conforman  las  delicias de la cocina criolla en toda la Costa Atlántica ( masa de maíz cocido en forma cilíndrica y envuelto en hojas secas de mazorca) Para ella y su cónyuge, la fabricación de este producto es parte de una tradición familiar, muy importante que les ha permitido pagar el estudio de muchos miembros de su familia, entre los cuales hay varios profesionales. Ellos al mismo tiempo que  venden bollos, también venden frutas, carnes, queso, y hasta el agua del maíz en la que  preparan los bollos, la convierten en una deliciosa Chicha; sus principales clientes son vecinos del sector, restaurantes, clubes y casas de eventos sociales. En esta actividad trabaja con ella su esposo y de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado incluyen empleadas  para el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.

En la actualidad solicita un crédito  por valor de $1.600.000 el cual utilizará en la compra de materias primas para alcanzar otros mercados  y para hacer mejoras locativas en las instalaciones donde funciona su negocio Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo, todos sus créditos han sido muy funcionales porque con ellos ha reemplazdo pasivos costosos y han incrementado su capital de trabajo. 
Su meta inmediata es lograr producir en mayor cantidad, hasta cubrir una buena parte de su mercado y tener ingresos que les permita vivir tranquilos y disfrutar en familia de algún dia de vacaciones.
texts.en:
Ana Matilde H. E. is 38 years old and lives in the popular neighborhood San Isidro, in the city of Barranquilla. She makes buns (rolls)—a food from the Creole delicacies from the Atlantic coast. They are made with corn meal boiled in a cylindrical form and wrapped in dried Mazora leaves. For her and her partner, making these products is part of a very important family tradition that has allowed them to pay for school for many family members, some of whom have become professionals. In addition to selling bums, they also sell fruits, meats, cheese, and even the corn water they make the buns in. They turn it into a delicious chichi. Most of their customers are neighbors from the area, restaurants, clubs, and social events in people’s homes. Ana Matilde and her husband work the business, but also hire employees to help out according to market demand. Today they are asking for a loan of $1.600.000 they will use to buy prime materials to get to other markets and to make better repairs to the installations they have in their business. This is the fifth loan with Fundación Santo Domingo. All of her loans have been very helpful because they have reimbursed passive costs and increased their working capital. Her immediate goal is to be able to produce greater quantities, reaching a good part of the market and having an income that allows them to live tranquilly and enjoy some family vacations.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prime materials and make better repairs.

loans.name: Yudis Patricia

texts.es:
Yudis Patricia Jiménez es una joven de 28 años, que vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad  de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de 2 y 6 años; vende frutas, verduras y todo lo relacionado con la dulcería en su casa; se inició en el negocio en acuerdo con su cónyuge, quien desde hace 10 años vende frutas y verduras en el mercado público de Barranquilla; los dos convinieron en la necesidad de generar un nuevo ingreso al hogar y en que, mediante un negocio en casa podían lograrlo; por eso Yudis sin abandonar las responsabilidades domésticas, especialmente  la crianza de sus hijos, desde hace 4 años comercializa los mismos productos que vende su esposo; ella lo hace en el barrio donde residen, teniendo en cuenta que hay muchas tiendas y amas de casa que le compran por la frescura de sus productos. En la actualidad Yudis necesita un crédito  por valor de $ 1.000.000 para ampliar su surtido de frutas y verduras. Este es su segundo crédito con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el anterior lo aplicó en la diversificación de sus productos, agregándole dulcería y mecatos, que le ha dado la oportunidad de un nuevo ingreso.

La meta familiar es tener una casa propia y respecto al negocio  mejorar su exhibición de productos, Su mayor desafío es la infraestructura física de acceso a su negocio,  pues aunque tiene una ubicación excelente, existen dificultades porque sus calles se encuentran sin pavimentar, con este propósito los vecinos de sector desarrollan bingos y otras actividades para lograr  mejor acceso en sus habitad.
texts.en:
Yudis Patricia Jiménez is a young woman of 28 who lives with her spouse and two young children, ages 2 and 6, in the 7 de Abril district of the city of Barranquilla. She sells fruits, vegetables, and everything that you would find at a candy shop from her home. She conceived of her business together with her husband, who for 10 years has been selling fruits and vegetables in the public market of Barranquilla. The two agreed on the necessity to generate a new source of income for their household, and realized that by running a business from within their home they could create this additional income. Toward this end, Yudis, without abandoning her domestic responsibilities, especially the raising of her children, has for 4 years now been selling the same products as her husband. She carries out her sales in the neighborhood in which she lives, knowing that there are many stores and house wives willing to buy her fruits and vegetables on account of their freshness. Currently, Yudis needs a loan of $ 1.000.000 to expand her supply of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She applied her previous loan toward diversifying her products, adding sweets to her array of goods, which increased her sales income. Her family's goal is to own a house of their own. With respect to her business, her goal is to improve the display of her products and her customers' ability to access her. Her biggest obstacle is the physical infrastructure of her neighborhood; although her location is excellent, the streets in her neighborhood are not paved, creating difficulty for potential customers to access her business. With this challenge in mind, her community has begun holding games of bingo and other such activities to raise funds to put toward improving access to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para ampliar el surtido de las frutas y verduras que comercializa

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La Sr. Pascuala vive en la localidad de Santa Rita, municipio de El Torno, eta casada y tiene 3 hijos uno que se encuentran en edad escolar y los otros dos en la universidad, su actividad es la venta de comida, vende almuerzos y platos extras su esposo se dedica a la actividad del transporte como chofer profesional, ya que sus hijos se encuentran en la universidad esto ocasiona muchos gastos para ella y su esposo los cuales le resulta difícil para que uno solamente trabaje por tal motivo los dos ayudan en la economía del hogar y así sacar a su familia adelante. uno de sus deseos de la Sra Pascuala es ver a sus hios profesionales y comprar su casa propia.

El destino del credito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y a si poder comprar una cocina mas grande para la elaboracion de sus exquisitos platos.

La Sra. Pascuala es una persona responsable, trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Pascuala lives in Santa Rita, El Torno municipality. She is married and has three children, one who is still of school age and two who are in university. She sells prepared meals, lunches and a-la-carte dishes. Her husband works as a professional driver. Her children being in university generates many expenses for her and her husband that would not be met if only one of them worked. For this reason, they must both work to contribute to household expenses in order to move their family forward. One of Pascuala's wishes is to see her children become professionals and to buy her own home. She will use the funds to buy a larger stove to prepare her delicious meals. Pascuala is a responsible, hard-working woman who is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger stove.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana G. is 53 years old and is the single mother of four children, who are now grown up.

Juana began making clothes in 1981 with her aunts, saving all of her income so that she could purchase a sewing machine and begin to work on her own. Now, she has four sewing machines, and her daughters work with her from her home.

Juana will use the loan to purchase fabric, thread and other materials to make dresses which she will both rent and sell.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and thread and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cement, rock, and sand

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
Muy comprometida con el mejoramiento de su vivienda y el bienestar de su familia, la señora Rosa R. se dedica a laborar arduamente como ama de casa y en conjunto con su esposo ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus dos hijos que dependen de ellos.
Ella ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda iniciando por medio del mejoramiento del área de la cocina y para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita realizar la compra de los materiales de construcción para crear dicha área de cocina y también crear un pantris.
Ella espera fielmente que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y de esta manera llevar a cabo dicha obra para beneficio de sus hijos que tanto ama ya que tendrán una vivienda con mejores condiciones en su localidad en León.
texts.en:
Very determined to improve her home and her family's well-being, Rosa R. works hard as a homemaker. Together with her husband, she has been able to improve the living conditions of their two dependent children. Rosa has decided to improve the condition of her home, beginning with the kitchen area. For this reason she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy construction materials, to improve this area and create a pantry. With good faith, she hopes that her loan will be funded so that she can realize this project. It will benefit her children, whom she loves very much, because they will have a better home in the town where they live, in the state of León, Nicaragua .

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Jardines está conformado por tres personas muy trabajadoras que se dedican a la comercialización de frutas y verduras. El señor Luis Antonio M. es el coordinador y fundador de dicho grupo. Para el este es su treceavo ciclo en Adim  con lo cual según comento ha mejorado su pequeño puesto de tomates del mercado Ernesto Fernández en.

Sus compañeras de grupo son  Juana Mercedes N. quien vende frutas como granadillas y melón y  Gilma Martínez que comercializa tomates. Ellos invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
The group Jardines is made up of three very hard-working people whose businesses are the sale of fruit and vegetables. Mr. Luis Antonio M. is the group's coordinator and founder. This is his thirteenth loan cycle with Adim, and he has used his previous loans to improve his small tomato stand in the Ernesto Fernández market. The other members of the group are Juana Mercedes N., who sells fruits like passion fruit and melon, and Gilma Martínez, who also sells tomatoes. They will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise to offer their clients better service.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eustaquio vive en el municipio de El Torno, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  su actividad es la de mototaxista, su esposa se dedica a vender refrigerio en  mercado central esta actividad le ayuda para colaborar a su esposo y asi poder mantener a sus 4 hijos,  tienen su domicilio en el barrio Naciones Unidas, es casa propia que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.

El Sr. Eustaquio es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del credito hara un mantenimiento a su motocicleta ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite trabajar de forma normal, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eustaquio lives in the town of El Torno. He is married and has four school-age children. He is a moto-taxi driver and his wife sells refreshments in the central market; together they support their four children. They own a home in the Naciones Unidas neighborhood which they were able to buy though much hard work. Mr. Eustaquio is a responsible and hardworking person. With the loan he will maintain his motorcycle which has recently begun to have some problems that prevent him from working as he normally would. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust and support given through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Roger Pérez se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de productos descartables como vasos, platos, cubiertos, pajillas, entre otros. Dichos productos son comercializados a diario por el señor Roger desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y siempre está buscando la manera de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Actualmente, él está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los productos como vasos, platos, cubiertos, entre otros todos estos descartables y espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para así invertir en el negocio y obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Roger Pérez works hard in León department selling disposable products like: drinking glasses, cutlery, drinking straws, among others. He sells these products daily from very early in the morning, always seeking ways to bring sustenance to his home. He is asking for funding to buy disposable products like drinking glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. and hopes to be blessed with the granting of the loan so that he can invest in his business and earn income to support his household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy disposable products.

loans.name: Luz Amanda

texts.es:
Luz Amanda C. S. tiene 46 años y vive con sus dos hijos de 19 y 6 años en el barrio Américas Central, que queda hacia el sur occidente de Bogotá, cerca del Estadio Metropolitano de Techo, lugar donde juega La Equidad, un equipo de fútbol bogotano. La señora Luz maneja una tienda de víveres y abarrotes que se llama Distrilac El Paisa, haciendo referencia a los paisas, los habitantes de Antioquia, la región que circunda a Medellín.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y quiere invertir esta suma en la compra de gaseosas y productos desechables, como vasos y platos para venderlos en su tienda. Inició su negocio con la venta de gaseosa al por mayor que distribuía a tiendas pequeñas y supermercados. Pero por las recomendaciones de sus vecinos en el sector, quienes le comentaban que por la ubicación de su casa, sería buena idea complementar su actividad con la comercialización de víveres y abarrotes, Luz abrió su tienda hace un año con mucho éxito y con muy buena acogida, en parte gracias a la proximidad del estadio que le incrementa las ventas. Su tienda es la fuente principal de ingresos y  espera que su negocio crezca más para poder comprar la casa donde actualmente funciona. Ella se siente muy feliz porque su hijo ingresó a la universidad al obtener una Beca de estudios debido a sus buenas calificaciones.
texts.en:
Luz Amanda C. S. is 46 years old and lives with her two children, aged 19 and 6 respectively, in the Américas Central neighborhood, which is located to the south-west of Bogotá, near the Metropolitano de Techo stadium, home to the La Equidad team, which is a soccer team from Bogotá. Luz runs a general store called the Distrilac El Paisa. This name refers to the Paisas, habitants of Antioquia, the region around Medellín. This is Luz's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she wants to use it to buy soda and other groceries like plastic cups and plates to sell in her store. She started her business selling soda wholesale, which she distributed to small shops and grocery stores. Her neighbors and peers, however, recommended that thanks to the location of her home, it would be a good idea to set up a general store in addition to her other business. Luz opened her store a year ago with great success and a positive reception, thanks in part to her close location to the stadium, which has allowed her to further expand her sales. Her store is now her largest source of revenue and she hopes this business grows even more, so she can buy the house she lives and works in. She is also very happy right now because her son just started college on a full merit scholarship.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda and other groceries like plastic cups and plates to sell in her store

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
Desde hace 18 años, en el departamento de León, la señora Marcia M. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa ofrecida a sus clientes que con mucha satisfacción le visitan en su tramo donde diariamente apertura desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana.
La señora Marcia está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la ropa de todo tipo para proseguir ofreciéndola ya que actualmente le urge adquirir la mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan y por esta razón espera ser beneficiada con el crédito para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia M. has sold clothing for the past 18 years in León department. Her customers very satisfactorily visit her space daily from very early in the morning when she opens up for business. Marcia is asking for funding to buy all kinds of clothing to offer because it's urgent to buy stock items so that she can meet her customers's needs. She hopes to be favored with the loan for the improvement of her family's and her own living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Águilas lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que han ido progresando poco a poco una de ellas es Mariela Cecilia O. M.  quien tiene una carnicería desde hace tres años. Las otras integrantes son  Flora María A. Domínguez quien comercializa nacatamales platillo típico a base de cerdo, maíz, arroz, chiltoma, etc. y Yadira del Carmen Z. vende cosméticos de las marcas Avon y Zermat.

Ellas invertirán el crédito para la compra de mercadería para sus respectivos negocios los cuales desean ver crecer y para ello trabajaran arduamente.
texts.en:
The group Las Águilas is made up of three strong and hard-working women who have been slowly but surely developing their businesses and improving their lives. One is Mariela Cecilia O. M. who has owned and managed a butcher shop for thee years. The other members are Flora María A. Domínguez, who sells nacatamales , a traditional local dish made of pork, corn, rice, red pepper, etc., and Yadira del Carmen Z., who sells Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics. They will use this loan to purchase merchandise for each of their businesses, which they hope will grow. They will work diligently to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nuevo Amanecer” se formó con la unión vA. vecinas del barrio Centro, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres muy sacrificadas que cada día luchan por el bienestar de su familia. 
Un experiencia de la señora Elizabeth quien es costurera, ella trabaja haciendo ropas de distintos modelos de acuerdo a lo que le pide el cliente ya sea vestidos, trajes entre otros. Las confecciones de la Sra. Elizabeth son de muy buena calidad por los que sus clientes se encuentran muy satisfechos, esta actividad los viene realizando hace algún tiempo y le ayuda mucho para los gastos de la casa.
En detalle los trabajo que las demás relizan.

texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) Committee was formed by uniting various neighbors in the Centro (Central) barrio of the city of Villa Elisa. All members of the committee develop independent activities, most especially sales. The members formed a very united group capable of carrying out activities together. Since the majority of the members are dedicated to sales, they are already colleagues. All members are sacrificing women who each day struggle for the wellbeing of their family. One example is Mrs. Elizabeth who is a seamstress. She works making clothes of distinct models according to what the customer requests, whether it's dresses or suits, among other choices. Elizabeth's creations are of very high quality and her customers seem very satisfied. She has been doing this for some time and it helps her greatly with the household expenses. In detail, here are the occupations of the remaining members: 1 Teresa V. Martinez Selling clothes 2 Maria A. Selling clothes 3 Marina E. Selling clothes 4 Adriana G. Pastry cook 5 Dominga P. Selling cosmetics 6 Clara S. Lottery sales 7 Benita R. Lottery sales 8 Justa O. Drink sales 9 Josefina G. Café 10 Teodora E. Provisions store 11 Maria Lidia A. Pastry cook 12 Johana Segura Clothing sales 13 Avelina Lopez Selling meals 14 Luz V. Provisions store 15 Victoria E. Selling fruit 16 Elizabeth A. Seanstress 17 Maria T. N. Physical therapist 18 Mercedes Z. Selling meals 19 Lilian L. Selling clothes 20 Silvia C. Physical therapist

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING T-SHIRTS, PANTS, SHIRTS, DRESSES, AND ALL TYPES OF SCHOOL UNIFORMS (CLASSES START IN FEBRUARY)

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Muy deliciosos son catalogados los alimentos que con mucho ahínco prepara la señora Marcela T. en el departamento de León donde son vendidos a diario logrando alcanzar gran variedad de clientes.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, ella comprará tomate, cebolla, carne, salsas, chiltoma, entro otros. Con el crédito logrará continuar en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos y así obtendrá los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
The food prepared very eagerly by señora Marecla T., in the Department of León, is classified as "very delicious." She sells her food in León every day, which allows her to reach a large mix of customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to make her food; among the food she will purchase will be tomato, onion, meat, sauces and sweet pepper. With the loan, she will be able to continue her business making and selling food, and therefore she will have the income necessary to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make food

loans.name: Tula Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tula lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes han buscado la forma de ganarse el sustento. La señora Soraya Margarita Castillo F. vende nacatamales platillo típico nicaragüense a base de maíz, carne de cerdo, arroz, cebolla, chiltoma, chile, papa etc. Este producto no falta en la mesa de los nicaragüenses en el desayuno del fin de semana.

Las otras integrantes son María Felipa V. A.  quien vende café y leche, María Luisa Gaitán B. comercializa nacatamales y Jeysi del Socorro  tiene un taller de costura. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Tula" consists of four hardworking women who have been searching for ways to make a living since they were very young. Soraya sells nacatamales, a typical Nicaraguan dish made of corn, pork, rice, onion, pepper, chile, potato, etc. This dish is never missing from the weekend breakfast table of Nicaraguans.

The other members are María Felipa, who sells coffee and milk, María Luisa, who also sells nacatamales, and Jeysi who has a sewing workshop. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make local dishes

loans.name: Mojon Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mojon está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras una de ellas es la señora María Auxiliadora Pavón quien invertirá el crédito específicamente en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, jocotes y mangos que son las frutas que están en flota.
Los otros integrantes son Delfina del Carmen Téllez P. quien también vende frutas y verduras y Rosibel Vivas O.  vende leña.
texts.en:
The Mojon group consists of three hard-working women who sell fruit and vegetables. One of them is María Auxiliadora Pavón who will specifically use the loan for the purchase of tamarind, jocote and mango crops which are the fruits that are in season. The other members are Delfina del Carmen Téllez P. who also sells fruit and vegetables and Rosibel Vivas O. selling firewood.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit crops

loans.name: Arnaldo Pintos

texts.en:
Arnaldo is 25 years old, single and works in the local bus station as a salesman. Since he was a young boy he accompanied his father, now 50 years old, while he worked.

Arnaldo sells hats, sun glasses, wallets, perfume, watches and other accessories. He rents a small locker where he stores his merchandise, and from there he provides merchandise to other vendors.

Arnaldo is seeking the loan from Fundación Paraguaya to purchase a stall where he will be able to sell his goods wholesale and increase his earnings.

loans.use: To purchase a stall where he can sell his goods wholesale

loans.name: Lilian Elizabeth Benegas

texts.en:
Lilian, age 43, sells fruits and vegetables from her cart in the local neighborhoods of Villarrica. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and aspires to higher profit levels, as she has already established a client base. Liliana's husband, a bricklayer, helps her with the household expenses. 

Lilian began working at a booth in the market, and later purchased her own cart and began selling her produce around town. This loan will allow for the purchase of sufficient fruits and vegetables to satisfy her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
El Sr. Crispin, propietario de un vehiculo marca toyota con el cual trabaja en la línea del cuarto anillo (Taxi trufi)  a patir de las 05:30 de la mañana hasta las 20:30  todos los días, quedo huérfano de padre desde los 9 años de edad, vive en la casa de su madre, es el tercero de cuatro   hermanos, los dos mayores emigraron a España a trabajar solo quedan el y su hermana menor que permanecen junto a su madre, estudio hasta el segundo año de la carrera de derecho, actualmente alquila la línea de taxi trufi donde trabaja, la movilidad la compro con la ayuda de sus hermanos para poder sostener a su familia (madre-hermana). Actualmente esta ayudando a terminar la construcción de la casa de su madre, esta soltero pero con un gran sentido de responsabilidad.

El destino del credito una parte es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad y otra para la compra de una heladera, El Sr. Crispin esta muy agradecido com Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Crispin owns a Toyota vehicle with which he provides transportation services along the Anillo Cuarto route (Taxi trufi: collective taxi vans) from 5:30am until 8:30pm every day. His father died when he was 9 years old; he lives in his mother's house, and is the third of four siblings. The two oldest emigrated to Spain to work so only he and his younger sister remain at their mother's side. He studied up to second year of law school. Currently, he leases the taxi trufi route that he works. He bought his vehicle with help from his brothers so that he can support his family (mother and sister). He is currently helping to complete constrution on his mother's house. He is single but with a great sense of responsibility. He will use part of the funds for vehicle maintenance and the other part to buy a freezer. Crispin is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for placing their trust in him with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Sara Maria Santacruz

texts.en:
Sara is a 23-year-old, single woman. To earn a living, she works as a seamstress. She specializes in high-fashion clothing, such as shirts, blouses, and sportswear. Sara's sister, who a 32-year-old teacher, helped her open her workshop. The two sisters began working together 7 years ago, but Sara now works alone.

The workshop is equipped with two industrial sewing machines and hemming machines. Equipped with these machines, she makes various articles of clothing. Sara also fills wholesale orders for retail shops in the Villarrica area. She is now seeking a loan to purchase additional fabric because she has orders from the Don Bosco school and needs to supply her clients with their clothing.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing additional fabric

loans.name: Blanca Nuriz

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Nuriz H. vive en la comunidad del Trinfo en el departamento de Choluteca, tiene 30 años de edad.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños, vende camisas, camisetas, calsontas, calsetines, faldas, blusas, ropa interior etc.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar ropa para la epoca de verano, en el Triunfo la temperatura es muy alta, hace mucho calor, las personas prefieren andar con ropa comoda para este tipo de temperaturas.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio cada dia va creciendo poco a poco, esto le esta dando buenas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su familia.
Blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Nuriz H. lives in the Triunfo community in the Choluteca department. She is 30 years old. Blanca sells new clothes for women, men and children - she sells shirts, vests, knee and ankle socks, dresses, blouses, underwear etc. Right now she needs a loan to buy clothes for the summer season. In Triunfo the temperature is very high, it is really hot and people prefer to wear clothes suitable for the type of temperature. She says she feels very happy since her business is growing little by little every day, it is making her a good profit, which she needs to look after her family. Blanca needs the loan to get ahead in her business and to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for women, men and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipé surguió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación . Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  fabricación y venta de masas dulces, venta de milanesas, venta de ropas, venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa , almacén , venta de bebidas   etc.
Cada una realiza una actividad diferente, así como la señora Nidia Cáceres quien elabora alimentos para vender, ella ofrece comidas o minutas preparadas para desayuno o almuerzo, tiene muchos clientes, quienes frecuentan constantemente de salón de la señora Nidia.
texts.en:
This group from the Chaipé suburb came about through one of the members' contact with the foundation . All the women take part in business activities such as: making and selling sweet pastries, selling breaded meat, selling clothes, selling foodstuffs, a provisions store, a grocery store, selling drinks etc. Each one has a different business, such as Nidia Cáceres who makes food to sell. She offers meals and refreshments prepared for breakfast or lunch. Nidia has a lot of customers who constantly frecuent her premises.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food like: meat, seasonings, pastries

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos, la señora Teodora Cardenas es propietaria de una pulpería que ella misma ha logrado levantar a raíz de sus múltiples esfuerzos obteniendo por medio de este negocio los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los productos de pulpería entre los que se encuentran los comestibles y los productos personales para ser ofertados en su pulpería y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida y por ende la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora Cardenas owns a market in the Cinco Pinos neighborhood. She manged to open this business through continued efforts. Thanks to this market she has income to maintain her home. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of food and other supplies to sell in her market and, in this way, continue improving the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her market

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una noble mujer de 31 años, comparte su vida con su esposo, quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro. Tienen tres hijos; Astrid de 14, Yesenia de 8 y Hattius de 2 añitos de edad, además espera con ansias a Yamilet que nacerá en este mes.

Esta pareja, gracias a su esfuerzo lograron adquirir su casa propia y ahora juntos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la atención de su tienda y poco a poco espera prosperar para darles una buena educación a sus hijos. A Esperanza le gusta mucho su trabajo y en la actualidad le beneficia mucho, ya que en su estado le permite seguir trabajando.
Felizmente tiene buenas ventas, debido a su gran carisma y personalidad, pues es muy conocida en su vecindario por ser conversadora y alguien en quien confiar, es por ello que algunas vecinas mientras realizan sus compras siempre se detienen un momento para conversar con ella.

Este es el doceavo préstamo de Esperanza con MFP y su experiencia ha hecho que ahora no tenga problemas con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará más productos para bastecer su tienda y hacerla más atractiva a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a noble woman of 31 years of age. She shares her life with her husband, who offers transportation services in his three-wheeled van. They have three children: Astrid, who is 14, Yesenia, who is 8, and 2 year-old Hattius. They are also looking forward to the birth of Yamilet later this month.

This pair, thanks to their efforts, have been able to purchase their own home and are working together for the well-being of their family. For 5 years, Esperanza has been running her store and little by little she hopes to prosper and be able to offer a good education to her children. Esperanza likes her work very much and it is currently serving her well as long as she is able to keep working.

Happily, she has good sales - thanks to her great charisma and personality. She is very well know in her neighborhood for being chatty and someone to trust, which is why some neighbors always stop a moment to chat with her while they are doing their shopping.

This is the twelfth loan that Esperanza has had from MFP and her experience means that she will not have problems making her repayments. With the money that she borrows this time, she will buy more products to stock her store and make it more attractive to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock

loans.name: Dolores Inés

texts.es:
La señora Dolores P. tiene 45 años, vive en la comunidad Punta Corral con su esposo albañil de oficio y gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación demostró que se  puede salir adelante sin dejar su país,  muestra de ello es haber construido su casa propia, tienen cuatro hijos que oscilan entre los 24 y 18 años de edad de ellos los tres primeros ya trabajan pero sólo para sus gastos personales.
