Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal  Mujer y Fortaleza  hace varios ciclos pero se retiro y ahora regresa con más ganas de seguir trabajando junto a su banco comunal  que se formó en la parroquia Turi al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sector conocido como el balcón de la ciudad  y es un sitio  muy turístico por la belleza natural del campo, la gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente donde la mayor parte de su población  se dedica a la agricultura y también a otras  actividades que les permiten salir adelante junto a sus familias.

Dolores es costurera y confecciona polleras siendo esta una de las vestimentas tradicionales de la mujer de ésta región y  fue una vecina la que le enseño este arte en el cual  lleva cuatro años trabajando,  además  se dedica al cuidado y cría de una vaca lechera y su producción de leche es solo para el consumo familiar,  con el credito solicito va a pagar la primera cuota para la compra de una máquina de coser para ir incrementando y mejorando  poco a poco  su negocio, su gran sueño es ponerse un taller propio con su hija de 18 años que también le gusta la costura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores P. is 45 years old, lives in the Punta Corral neighborhood with her husband. He is a builder by trade and thanks to his hard work and dedication they have proven that they can get ahead without leaving their country. This is shown in the fact that they built their own home and have four children between the ages of 24 and 18, the oldest three already working to cover their own expenses. Dolores is a member of the community bank, Mujer y Fortaleza (Women and Strength). As of various loan cycles ago she had retired from the group and is now returning with more desire than ever to continue working with the community bank, which was formed in the Turi parish at the southeastern side of the city of Cuenca. This section is known as the balcony of the city and is a very popular tourist area due to its natural beauty, food and the friendliness of its people. The majority of the population works in agriculture, and other activities that allow them to get their families ahead. Dolores is a seamstress and makes skirts, that are the traditional mode of dress for women of this region. A neighbor taught her this trade and she has been doing it for four years. She also takes care and raises a milk cow, the milk yield is only for the use of the family. With the proceeds of the requested loan she will pay the first installment toward the purchase of a sewing machine and little by little improve her business. Her biggest dream is to open her own shop with her 18 year old daughter, who also likes to sew.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the first installment for the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina (56) es una mujer con mucha experiencia en su trabajo. Vive con Félix, su pareja, quien es obrero en una empresa D. papel, y con su hija Erica D. 26 años, en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros D. su familia.

DesD. hace dos años y teniendo la necesidad D. realizar una labor que no sea D. mucho esfuerzo, optó por vender productos D. belleza. Por otra parte, su hija también se dedica a ello y ambas se apoyan para lograr buenas ventas, debido al carisma y buena conversación D. Florentina, pues tiene una manera muy peculiar D. ofrecer su mercadería. Ella ha probado y aprendido D. los beneficios D. sus productos, por lo cual siempre recomienda alguno gracias a la experiencia propia. 
Para el futuro, quiere tener un bazar donD. pueda mostrar y vender sus productos D. una manera más cómoda.

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y sigue siendo tan puntual con los pagos como lo fue con sus primeros créditos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Florentina is 56 years old and has a lot of work experience. She lives in her own home with Félix, her partner, who works at a paper company, and her 26-year-old daughter Erica. Florentina has been selling beauty products for the past two years after she chose the traD. out of the necessity to find work that was not too strenuous. Her daughter also makes a living in cosmetics, and both support each other to achieve good sales. Florentina credits her charisma and conversation skills, and she also has a very unique way of offering her merchandise. She has tried and learned the benefits of her products, so she always has something to recommend thanks to her own experience. For the future, she wants to have a bazaar where she can display and sells her products more comfortably. This is her twelfth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she continues to be as punctual with her payments as she was when she started. With the money she is currently requesting, she plans to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith (33) y Rolando (28), son dos responsables padres que trabajan arduamente a favor D. sus dos hijos: PameL. (5) y Matías (5). Todos ellos viven en L. casa que le cedieron los padres D. Judith.

DesD. algunos años atrás, Rolando viene brindando el servicio D. taxi y elL. para apoyar con los gastos del hogar vio L. oportunidad D. trabajar desD. su casa con L. venta D. cosméticos. DesD. entonces ambos trabajan por salir adelante, cada uno en su negocio, pero con un solo fin, brindarles a sus pequeños una buena calidad D. vida.
A elL. le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite pasar tiempo con sus hijos, ayudándolos en su tareas, (sus pequeños ya asisten al nido) y también trabajar mientras realiza las labores del hogar. 
Para el futuro Judith ve a su familia con una mejor vivienda y mejores oportunidades, es por ello que se toma su trabajo muy en serio. 

Este es su onceavo préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho ser parte D. su grupo, pues todas sus compañeras también son muy puntuales con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería en productos comestibles para equipar mejor su tienda y sí ganar más clientes.
texts.en:
Judith (33) and Rolando (28) are two responsible parents who work arduously for their two children: PameL. (5) and Matías (5). They all live in the house given to them by Judith's parents. For some years, Rolando has been providing taxi services. To help with the household expenses, Judith saw the opportunity to work from her home selling cosmetics. Since then, both have been working to get ahead, each with their own business but with the same goal to proviD. their children a good quality of life. Judith likes her work a lot since it allows her to spend time with her children, to help them with their homework (they both attend school) and to work while she does housework. In her future, Judith sees her family with a better home and better opportunities. This is why she takes her work seriously. This is Judith's eleventh loan with MFP and she enjoys being a part of this group because all of her partners are also very punctual with their payments. With the money she is requesting Judith will buy more groceries to better stock her store and win more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio G. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Perla Balmori y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnación.

El señor Rogelio se dedica a realizar servicio de moto taxi desde hace varios años, ademas es propietario de una despensa que esta en su domicilio y es atendida por su esposa.

Ellos son muy trabajadores y gracias a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresas, ademas han construido en su domicilio habitaciones para alquilar el cual también hoy en día les genera un ingreso.

 Gracias a estas actividades ellos pueden mantener su hogar, llevar una vida digna y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.  

El destino del crédito es para refaccionar el local de su negocio y comprar algunas mercaderias.
texts.en:
Rogelio G. ia 42 years old and is married to Perla Balmori. They live in a house they own, in the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Encarnación, Paraguay. Rogelio has worked driving a moto-taxi for many years and he also owns a small grocery store. The store is located in his home and is run by his wife. Both Rogelio and Perla are hard working people, and thanks to their work they have been able to get ahead and grow in their micro-enterprises. They have also built rooms in their house that they can rent out, which currently provides them with income. Thanks to all of their work, they have been able to maintain their home, live with dignity, and make it through any unexpected problems that could arise. This loan will be used to renovate their grocery store and buy some merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of store (painting, stucco work)  and purchase of merchandise (flour, noodles, herbs, drinks, bread products and other items)

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
Zoila V. de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo vende artículos para el hogar con el tiene 2 hijos.

Zoila y su esposo empezaron recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil vendiendo artículos para el hogar, poco a poco su economía se estabilizo y pusieron una pequeña tienda. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 con la ayuda de su hija, vendiendo arroz, azúcar, detergentes, y artículos para el hogar. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, detergente para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su propio Minimarket.
texts.en:
Zoila V. is 47 years old and she lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Guayquil, located on the Perimetral road. Her house is made of cement and she has all of the basic services [water, electricity, etc.]. Her husband sells household items. She has two children with him. Zoila and her husband began by working as street vendors in Guayaquil, selling household items. Eventually their economic situation stabilized and they opened a small store. She now works from 7:00AM until 10:00PM, with her daughter’s help. She sells rice, sugar, detergents, and household items. One of the difficulties she has to deal with is crime in her neighborhood. With the loan she wants to buy rice, cooking oils, and detergent for her business. In the future she wants to have her own mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, and detergent

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 30 años vive al lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos; Javier de 9 y Edson de 5 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 meses se dedica al alquiler de su motocarro, puesto que el tener hijos pequeños a los cuales cuidar no tiene el tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a una labor de tiempo completo. Por tal motivo, gracias a los ahorros que ella y su esposo guardaron durante algún tiempo compraron un motocarro. Y ahora puede alquilar este vehículo para generar a su familia ganancias extras. Sin embargo, el alquiler de su motocarro es una gran responsabilidad, ya que algunos chóferes no cuidan el vehículo, es por ello que María debe estar muy pendiente de la administración del mismo. 

Este es el doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella es una cliente muy bien considerada, debido a la puntualidad en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su motocarro para brindar un mejor servicio, ya que en la actualidad presenta algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, Javier (age 9) and Edson (age 5). They live in their own home.

For the past six months, she has been renting out her motorcycle taxi because having young children does not give her enough time to devote to a full-time job. Thanks to the savings she and her husband set aside, they were able to buy a motorcycle taxi. Now they rent out this vehicle so that they can generate extra income for their family. However, renting out their motorcycle taxi carries great responsibility because some of the drivers do not take care of the vehicle. For this reason, María must carefully manage how the vehicle is being handled.

This is her twelfth loan from MFP. María is a highly-regarded client because she makes all of her payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will pay for repairs to her motorcycle taxi so that it can provide better service. At the moment, the vehicle has some damage.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Juan Ubaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan, tiene la actividad económica de servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, vive en casa con sus padres ya que es soltero, actualmente el colabora al  sustento de su familia, el tambien se encuentra estudiando y desea salir profesional para asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
El cliente trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2007 en banca de emprendimiento y encontrandose en su segundo credito bajo este programa individual, demostrando buen historial crediticio ya que es una persona responsable y trabajadora.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo con la compra de llantas para poder desarrollar mejor su trabajo.

El Sr. Juan esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan provides urban passenger transportation services. He is single and lives with his parents. He contributes to family expenses. He is also studying and wants to become a professional so that his quality of life will be better. He has collaborated with our institution since 2007 as part of a communal bank; this is his second loan as an individual. He has had good credit history and is a responsible, hard-working person. The funds will be used primarily to service his vehicle with the purchase of new tires so that he can do his work more efficiently. Juan is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa (53) es una mujer muy creativa y gracias a su ingenio sale adelante al lado de su familia. Actualmente vive con su pareja, José (45) y su hija Diana (21) en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida, diversos refrescos y jugos, y todo lo que sus clientes le suelan demandar; es por ello que trata de abarcar todas estas actividades sin limitarse. 
Rosa es muy activa y siempre busca mejorar, en consecuencia ha pensado instalar un restaurante y una tienda bazar en su propia casa, para estar más cómoda con las horas de atención. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por ello que seguirá trabajando, su hija y su pareja también tienen sus propios trabajos y como no tiene hijos pequeños, puede dedicar más tiempo a su negocio.

Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual con los pagos, pues su experiencia le ha enseñado a que en cualquier aspecto de su vida debe cumplir con lo que se compromete. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ingredientes para la preparación de las comidas que prepara.
texts.en:
Rosa (53) is a creative woman whose ingenuity has helped her do well along with her family. She currently lives with her partner, Jose (45) and her daughter Diana (21), in her own home. She works in food preparation, and prepares different beverages and juices as well, and anything else requested by her customers. She tries to include all these activities, with no limit. Rosa is very active, always trying to improve, and thus she is planning to set up a restaurant and food stall in her own home, to more easily handle customers during business hours. She enjoys her work and will continue in the same line. Her daughter and partner have jobs of their own, and since Rosa has no small children, she can devote more time to her business. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is punctual with her payments, since experience has shown her that she should keep her commitments in all areas of life. She will use the money she is requesting to buy ingredients to prepare the meals she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, de 31 años, comparte su vida con Percy, su esposo, y sus hijos: Elvis (16), Nelly (8), Angy (6) y el bebé que espera. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia.

Ella y su esposo (en la foto) vienen trabajando en la elaboración de prendas de vestir según la temporada, fabrican polos, pantalones cortos, etc. porque este verano les promete una gran venta por la gran demanda que existe de estas prendas. Siendo su familia muy unida todos ayudan con lo que pueden en el momento de trabajar, ya sea empaquetando, embolsando, distribuyendo, etc., de esta manera todos han salido adelante y van haciendo crecer su negocio. Además, siempre se actualizan comprando maquinaria y material novedoso para la elaboración de sus prendas y así hacerlas más vistosas y llamativas para sus clientes. 
En un futuro, Sonia quiere consolidar su taller, haciéndolo más grande y contratando personal para producir en mayores cantidades.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y le agrada trabajar con créditos porque piensa que son de gran ayuda para la mejora de su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tela, hilos, cierres y demás materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 31 years old, shares her life with Percy (her husband), and her children: Elvis (16), Nelly (8), Angy (6), and the baby she is expecting. They live in their own house. Sonia and her husband (in the photo) make clothing according to the season. They make polo shirts, pants, shorts, etc. This summer promises good sales because of the demand that exists for their clothing. The family is very united and everyone helps out with what they can, whether that is packaging, or bagging, or distribution, etc. In this way the family is getting ahead and they are making their business grow. Additionally, they keep themselves current by buying machinery and new materials for making their clothes more stylish and attention-getting for their clients. In the future, Sonia would like to consolidate her workshop, making it larger and hiring people so she can produce in greater quantities. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva Field Partner]. She likes working with loans because she thinks they are a great help in improving her business. The money that she is now requesting will be invested in buying fabrics, threads, zippers, and other materials for making her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other items for making clothing

loans.name: Madre Teresa De Calcuta Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Madre Teresa D. Calcuta, se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad D. Ayaccocha, la cual pertenece al distrito D. Acoria en el departamento D. Huancavelica.

Aurea es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Aurea se dedica al tejido y a la venta D. artesanías. Aurea necesita un préstamo, el cual usaría como capital para invertir en su negocio, adquiriendo D. esta manera lanas D. varios colores, grosores, palos D. tejer, etc. Aurea, tiene como sueño el lograr que sus tejidos se vendan a los grandes almacenes y mas adelante poder exportar al extranjero. 

J. es casada y tiene 08 hijos. J. tiene como negocio una pequeña bodega la cual esta creciendo gracias a sus prestamos. J. necesita un préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su bodega, tiene como sueño el tener un minimarket, donD. pueda vender diversos productos.

Georgina es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Georgina se dedica a la venta D. comidas como pollo frito, pescado frito y derivados. Georgina necesita un préstamo con el cual comprará insumos para su negocio, ella tiene como meta el hacer crecer su negocio hasta que llegue a ser un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Madre Teresa D. Calcuta communal bank is located in the community of Ayaccocha, which belongs to the district of Acoria, in the department of Huancavelica. Aurea is married and she has 4 children. Aurea works in knitting and sells craft items. She needs a loan, which she will use as capital to invest in her business. She will buy wool of various colors and thicknesses and knitting needles, etc. Aurea’s dream is for her knitted items to sell in the biggest stores and eventually to be able to export them. J. is married and she has 8 children. J. has a small grocery store that is growing, thanks to her loans. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her store. Her dream is to have a mini market, where she could sell a variety of products. Georgina is married and has 4 children. She sells foods such as fried chicken, fried fish, and related food items. Georgina needs a loan, which she will use to buy ingredients for her business. Her goal is to make her business grow until it becomes a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and knitting needles

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es muy entusiasta y trabajador, tiene 48 años y siempre está buscando la manera de ser una mejor persona y bueno en su trabajo. Se separó de su esposa, pero siempre recibe la visita de sus hijos: Víctor de 22 años y Leydi de 17, ellos son su motivo para salir adelante. 

Él tiene un taller donde confecciona zapatillas, le gusta mucho su trabajo y lo realiza con gran alegría, pues los 20 años que tiene de experiencia le han dado por resultado buenas ganancias y calidad en sus zapatillas.
Wilfredo cuenta con una máquina propia, la cual le da la ventaja de trabajar a las horas que vea por necesario, muchas veces se ha quedado hasta altas horas de la noche para poder entregar el pedido, ya que la responsabilidad es lo fundamental para él. 
En un futuro, espera comprar mayor cantidad de máquinas y así agrandar su taller y su producción.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien a la hora de realizar sus pagos, gracias a su compromiso y puntualidad. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cuero y otros materiales para elaborar sus zapatillas. Él espera muy pronto alcanzar las metas que se trazó, pues quiere que sus hijos estén muy orgullosos de él.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is very enthusiastic and hardworking. He is 48 years old, and is always looking for a way to be a better person and to be good at his job. He separated from his wife, but he is always being visited by his children: Victor, 22; and Leydi, 17. They are his motivation to succeed. He has a workshop where he makes sneakers. He enjoys the work very much, and carries it out cheerfully. As a result of his 20 years of experience, he has good earnings and makes quality shoes. Wilfredo has his own machine, which gives him flexibility in scheduling his work hours. Many times he has remained until the very late hours of the night in order to fulfill an order, since responsibility is fundamental for him. In the future, he hopes to buy a greater quantity of machines and in this way expand his workshop and his production. This is his second loan with MFP and up until now he has done very well making his payments on time, thanks to his commitment and punctuality. With the money that he requests now he will buy leather and other materials to make his sneakers. He hopes that very soon he will accomplish the goals that he laid out, since he wants his children to be proud of him.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make sneakers

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 20, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron que toda labor es gratificante si se le pone esfuerzo y dedicación. Es así que hace 8 meses decidió ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, vendiendo productos de belleza, ya que es un trabajo que puede realizar con tranquilidad y en las horas que disponga de tiempo, pues también ayuda a su madre en las labores del hogar porque su padre trabaja durante todo el día como chofer. 

Xiomara fue poco a poco aprendiendo los secretos del comercio y actualmente lo desarrolla con mucho entusiasmo, puesto que le gusta mucho aconsejar a sus amigas del barrio y otras vecinas que solicitan de sus productos para mejorar su imagen. 

Su deseo a futuro es seguir mejorando en su negocio hasta tener su propio bazar donde sus productos sean mejor exhibidos y obtenga mejores ingresos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a cumplir muy responsablemente con todos pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para tenerlos en stock y cuando le realicen los pedidos pueda cumplir con la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 20 years old. Since she was very young, her parents have taught her that all work is satisfying if one puts effort and dedication into it. Accordingly, 8 months ago, she decided to help her parents with the household expenses by selling cosmetics. This is work that she can easily undertake during the time available to her; she also helps her mother with the household chores, because her father works all day as a driver. Little by little, Xiomara has learned the secrets of selling, and she currently does it with great enthusiasm, since she truly enjoys advising her friends in the area and other neighbors who are interested in her products in order to improve their image. Her desire for the future is to continue making progress with her business until she can open her own bazaar, where her products will be more effectively displayed and she can earn a better income. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making all her payments in a very responsible manner. With the funds she is currently requesting, she will buy more products in order to have them in stock, so that when orders are placed, she can fulfill her customers' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Frank Antony

texts.es:
Frank tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de cerveza en su vivienda desde hace seis meses, este negocio le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. El nos comenta que pudo instalar su negocio gracias a los ahorros que había podido guardar con el sueldo que ganaba como trabajador agrícola.

Su negocio goza de mucha acogida, especialmente los fines de semana, Frank desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerveza pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven conocido y estimado por los vecinos de la zona, ellos lo consideran un joven trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual pueda tener un ingreso más estable.
texts.en:
Frank is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Paiján district of Ascope province in the La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been selling beer from his home for 6 months. This business provides the income he needs to cover his personal expenses and help support his family. He tells us that he was able to start up this business thanks to savings that he had been able to put aside from his the salary that he earned as a farm worker. His business enjoys a strong response from the public, especially on the weekends. Frank would like to increase his business with the purchase of more beer, but he lacks sufficient capital to do this. For this reason he has seen the necessity of requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles that will help him to achieve this objective. He is a well-known youth who is well-regarded by the neighbors in his area. They consider him to be a responsible and hardworking young man. His main desire is to buy himself a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used in the transportation of people and cargo), with which he could have a more stable income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beer to increase his business

loans.name: Paula Carmela

texts.es:
Paula tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de seis años de edad en el sector Macabi del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene instalada en su vivienda una librería en la ofrece servicio de fotocopias, tipeos y búsqueda de trabajos en internet. Ella nos comenta que empezó vendiendo papel bond animada por algunas madres de familia del lugar, ya que su casa queda cerca al colegio de la zona. Poco a poco fue ampliando el negocio y ahora este goza de mucha acogida, sobretodo durante la temporada escolar, que va desde el mes de Marzo hasta Diciembre.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de útiles escolares, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre luchadora, trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un próspero futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Paula is 41 years old and is a single mother who lives with her 6 year-old son in the Macabi area of Paiján district, in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. In her house she has set up an office supply store where she offers photocopying, typing, and internet search services. She tells us that she started out selling printer paper, encouraged by some mothers in the area, since her house is located close to a school in the neighborhood. Gradually she expanded her business, and now her business is widely accepted by the community, especially during the school season, which goes from March until December. Paula wishes to increase her business by purchasing school supplies, but she does not have sufficient capital to do this. For this reason she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles. She is a mother who is a fighter, and is enterprising and hardworking. Her main wish is to furnish her young son with a quality education that will guarantee him a prosperous future. She has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies to increase her business during the school season

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisca H. L., de 46 años de edad casada, tiene 5 hijo, a uno de ellos le paga los gastos de educación, Doña Francisca lucha para tener dinero, ella vende en la plaza municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque, la conocen porque compra y vende quintales de café en grano, ella es la única que tiene este tipo de negocio, por lo tanto ella solicita el crédito para seguir comprando, y asi obtener mayores ganancias, al mismo tiempo Doña Francisca en sus tiempos libres hace güipiles. Su sueño es poder continuar con la compra y venta de cafe en grano, abarcando mas lugares.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca H. L. is 46 years old and married. She has 5 children, and she is paying educational expenses for one of them. Doña Francisca, as she is called, works hard to earn money, selling her products in the city plaza of San Martín Jilotepeque. She is well-known for buying and selling quintals (large sacks) of coffee beans, since she is the only one who has this type of business. She is requesting this loan to buy greater quantities and thus obtain higher profits. In her free time, Doña Francisca also makes güipiles (traditional blouses). Her dream is to be able to continue buying and selling coffee beans and to reach more places with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying and selling coffee beans

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: Don Luis tiene la edad de 44 años, es un hombre trabajador, esforzado, casado, con cuatro hijos, su esposa trabaja en un banco desempeñándose como gerente lo cual se han esforzado por hacer las mejoras a su casa, como apoyar a sus hijos. El negocio del señor Luis es servicio de taxi desde hace varios años, en donde día a día recorre la capital de Managua para vender el servicio a sus clientes. En ocasiones esta malo el trabajo debido a que la gasolina esta cara y los usuarios no quieren pagar lo que se le pide,  pero hay día buenos aunque cansado pero le queda ganancias lo que le es una sastifaccion. Sus planes es poder  hacer mejora a su vivienda como repellar las paredes, pintar y hacer el baño de concreto ya que lo tiene forrado de platico y le es un poco incomodo y de poca privacidad e higiénico lo cual es una necesidad hacer esta mejora para su familia. Ya que gracias a estos préstamos ha podido salir adelante con las necesidades del taxi como ahora en la construcción del baño el cual comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar hacer la obra compra de piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piso entre otros que se necesite para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old and is a hard-working man who is married with four children. His wife is a manager at a bank, and they both have worked hard to improve their home. Luis has had a taxi business for a number of years where from day to day he travels throughout the capital city of Managua offering his service to customers. On occasion the work is tough, when gasoline is expensive and customers don't want to pay that prices he quotes them, but there are good days when although he is tired he is very satisfied with his profits. His goal is to be able to make improvements to his home, such as replace the walls, paint and add a concrete bathroom since the one they currently have is lined with plastic and is a little uncomfortable while lacking privacy and hygiene, so he sees the improvements as a necessity for his family. Thanks to these loans Luis has been able to make headway as a taxi driver as well as make home improvements, like building the bathroom, for which he'll purchase the construction materials to start the work, including stones, sand, cement, iron, flooring, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stones, sand, cement, iron and flooring to make a bathroom that will give his family more privacy and hygiene.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 63 años de edad, es separada y tiene cinco hijos, todos ya independizados, vive en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega desde hace cinco años, allí ofrece a sus clientes bebidas y golosinas. Anteriormente vendía verduras en el mercado de la ciudad, pero tuvo que dejar su actividad porque sus hijos viajaron a trabajar a otros lugares. Desde entonces se ha valido de este negocio para solventar sus gastos personales y salir adelante.

Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de bebidas para ampliar su negocio durante esta temporada de verano.

Carmen es una mujer alegre y luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir manteniendose activa y trabajar para salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 63 years old, separated from her husband and has five children, all of whom are grown up and independent. She lives in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, region of La Libertad, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has run a small bodega out of her home for the past five years, offering drinks and snacks. Previously she sold vegetables at the city market, but she had to give up the activity because her children were going to work elsewhere. Since then she has used this business to solve her personal expenses and make headway. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more drinks so she can expand her business for summertime. Carmen is a hard-working and happy woman, and her biggest goal is to keep being active and working to make headway. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Eracelli Del Pilar

texts.es:
Eracelli tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito D. Paiján, provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace ocho años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega donD. ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. Ella nos comenta que inició su negocio cuando su esposo trajo a su casa caña D. azúcar para ofrecerla en venta, poco a poco le gustó la dimámica del negocio y fue ampliándolo.

El negocio goza D. mucha acogida entre sus clientes, ya que les ahorra movilizarse diariamente al mercado D. la ciudad. Eracelli desea implementar su negocio con la instalación D. un locutorio (centro D. llamadas telefónicas), por eso se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Eracelli es una mujer bastante responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus menores hijos una educación D. calidad que les permita asegurarse un futuro prometedor. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución ya ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Eracelli is 37 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province. This community is in the region of La Libertad, which is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Eight years ago, she established a store in her home where she offers her customers all types of products such as basic necessities, groceries, and beverages. Eracelli says she started her business when her husband brought home sugar cane to sell. Over time, she enjoyed the dynamics of running a business and decided to expand it.

Her customers frequently visit her business because it saves them from having to travel every day into the city to do their shopping. Eracelli wants to establish a call center in her store, so she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 soles.

She is a responsible, hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire to proviD. her young children with a quality education that helps them secure a promising future. Eracelli previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa, so she has already demonstrated that she is a responsible and punctual client when it comes to making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a call center inside of her store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo R. T., es casado, tiene 32 años de edad y tres hijos. Los dos mayores van a la escuela, el mas pequeño tiene dos años de edad.
Su esposa le ayuda con la venta de suéteres, su negocio es una fábrica de suéteres y al mismo tiempo, compra y vende suéteres. Don Ricardo vende su mercadería en el mercado de Tecpán a diferentes clientes los días de mercado.
El préstamo lo solicita para comprar materia prima y una máquina de cocer. Su sueño es incrementar sus ventas y tener un negocio más grande para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo R. T. is 32 years old, married, and has three children. His two older children attend school while his youngest child is only two years old.

His wife helps to sell sweaters that he manufactures, but he also buys sweaters to sell. Don Ricardo sells his merchandise at the market in Tecpán to different customers on the days the market is open. This loan will be used to buy raw materials and a sewing machine. His dream is to increase his sales and enlarge his business so that he can improve life for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment and materials

loans.name: Dania Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Dania H. R. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal es asistente del área de recursos humanos, está embarazada de su primer bebe va hacer madre soltera, es el segundo crédito que tiene con nosotros y si le han ayudado ya que con el crédito anterior hizo su cuarto independiente en la casa de sus padres con este crédito lo solicito para compra de medicamento.
texts.en:
Dania H. R. works in the Human Resources department of the Mayor's office. She is expecting her first child and will be a single mother. This is the second loan she's had with us; she used the previous loan to build a bedroom in her parents's house so she could be independent. This funding will be used to buy medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar Danilo T. C. trabaja como conductor de una unidad de trasporte interurbano aquí en el municipio de Condega.

El solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de un terreno para la construcción futura de una casa de habitación ya que actualmente esta residiendo en la casa de su madre.

El empezó como conducto de esta unidad de transporte hace 5 años, con el objetivo de tener un ingreso mensual que le ayudase a sostener sus gastos familiares mensuales, el empezó esta labor cuando termino sus estudios escolares de secundaria. El trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado  desde las 7 de la maña hasta las 3de la tarde.

Este cliente espera que con la compra de este terreno en un futuro empiece a construir su propia casa de habitación y ser totalmente independiente.

Danilo T. un joven casado con una hija que aun no tiene edad escolar, viven en la casa con su mama y dos hermanas que son obraras.

Este es el primer crédito que Danilo T. solicita en Ceprodel y espera llevar a cabo al compra de dicho terreno ya que su principal proyecto es la construcción de si vivienda y espera lograrlo y de esta manera lograr darlo un techo digno a su esposa e hija y por ende mejorarles su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo T. C. works as an inter-urban transportation provider here in Condega. He is asking Ceprodel for funding to buy a lot to build his house because he currently lives in his mother's house. He started working in transportation 5 years ago, his goal being to have an independent source of monthly income that he could use to help support his family. He started to work when he finished high school. He works from Monday through Saturday, from 7am until 3pm. This client hopes that the purchase of the lot will allow him to become totally independent in the future when he builds his own house. Danilo T. is married and has a daughter who is still too young to go to school; they live in his mother's house with his mother and two sisters, who are laborers. This is Danilo T.'s first loan with Ceprodel and he hopes to buy the lot because his main goal is to build his home to provide proper living quarters for his wife and daughter thus improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Rebeca Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Rebeca P. trabaja en el seguro social tengo 6 años de trabajar para esta institución tengo 3 hijos los tres en edad escolar el crédito lo solicito para terminar un cuarto que le estoy construyendo a unos de mis hijos y si me han ayudado mucho los créditos con ceprodel he podido terminar de construir mi casa ya tengo cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel me han financiado 4 créditos los cual me siento agradecida porque podido cumplir uno de mis sueños tener mi casa.
texts.en:
Rebeca P. works for Social Security. She has worked there for 6 years and she has 3, school-age children. The funds will be used to finish building a bedroom for one of her children. Ceprodel's loans have been very useful for they have allowed her to finish building her house. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for four years and has had 4 loans. She is grateful to have met one of her goals: to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es:
La señora Leandra es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 8 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de fibra de animales.

Leandra nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  fibra de alpaca, vicuña, ovino, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las facilidades de préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Leandra has been a member of the Communal Bank “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) for the past eight years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Deparment of Puno. Leandra is 44 years old, married, and has five children. She has a fifth grade education and makes a living by buying and selling animal wool.

Leandra says the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy the wool of alpacas, vicuñas, sheep, and other animals. Her dream is to increase her business and earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings accounts and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal wool

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, es separada y vive con el último de sus cinco hijos de doce años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ha trabajado como obrera agrícola desde muy joven. Las labores que suele realizar son la recolección de ají escabeche, de espárrago y de maíz. Gracias a estas actividades ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora la mayoría de ellos ya son indepedientes. Actualmente trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en la recolección de cebolla en una chacra cercana.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material para techar su casa, ya que las continuas lluvias propias del mes de verano están haciendo estragos en su  vivienda cuyo techo está construído de material rústico.

Ella es una madre de familia luchadora y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor. En la fotografía aparece mostrando el techo que desea cambiar.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with her twelve year old son who is the youngest of her five children. They reside in the District of Paiján, Province of Ascope. This community is in the region of La Libertad, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been a farm worker since she was a young woman. Her tasks include harvesting peppers, asparagus, and corn. Thanks to her work, her children have been able to get ahead and most of them already live on their own. María currently works from 6am until 5pm harvesting onions at a local farm.

She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that she can purchase roofing materials for her home. The continuous summer rains are wreaking havoc on her house, which is made of basic materials.

María is a determined and hardworking mother who desires to provide her son with a quality education that will help him secure a promising future. The photograph shows the roof that needs to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace her roof

loans.name: Yarbely Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Yarbely L. L. es trabajadora de la universidad unan- Carazo, es el segundo crédito con nosotros excelente cliente el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, piedrín, cemento y pago de la mano de obra, y si le han ayudado mucho los financiamiento por que así a podido tener su casa.
texts.en:
Yarbely L. L. is employed by UNAN University-Carazo campus. This is her second credit with us; she is an excellent client. She is asking for financing to buy building materials and supplies like: stone, gravel, cement and to pay labor costs. Past loans have been of great benefit to her because they have permitted her having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: Doña Luisa G., tiene 44 años, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, ella vive en Sumpango Sac. una comunidad bastante grande, que queda cerca de la capital. Doña Luisa vende comida desde hace 20 años en una fábrica de textiles que queda cerca del municipio, ella desea adquirir un crédito, para comprar más producto alimenticio para su negocio, asi mismo también comprar un refrigerador para vender helados y pasteles frios y así poder incluirlos en los platillos que vende día a día, ella esta segura que esto incrementara su negocio y obtendra mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Luisa G. is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the large community of Sumpango Sacatepéquez, which is near the capital. Doña Luisa has been selling food for the past 20 years at a textile factory near town.

She wants to acquire a loan in order to buy more food for her business. Luisa also wants to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell ice cream and frozen cakes in addition to the dishes that she prepares each day. She is confident that this will increase her business and help her to earn more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator & ingredients for making lunches

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia M. V. es trabajadora activa de la universidad unan-Carazo es profesora de esta universidad, es casada esta recién alumbrada tiene 20 días de que dio a luz a un precioso bebe, el crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, piedrín, cemento y hierro para la construcción de un cuarto para su bebe. Y si los créditos le han impactado mucho le han ayudado a remodelar su casa y comprar algunos electrodomésticos necesarios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia M. V. is a professor at UNAN-Carazo (University of Nicaragua--Carazo campus). She is married and recently gave birth to a beautiful baby. This new mother is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like stone, gravel, cement and iron in order to build a room for her baby. These loans have been a great help to her. They have helped her remodel her house and buy some necessary home appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, stone, gravel and cement

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es: El Sr. Isaías G. es trabajor de la universidad unan Carazo se desempeña como vigilante tiene 20 años de trabajar para esta institución es el segundo crédito con nosotros  es casado padre de 3 hijos uno en edad escolar el crédito lo solicita para compra de un terreno y así poder empezar a hacer su casa y si le han ayudado los créditos que le hemos financiado ya que en el crédito anterior su esposa iba a dar  a luz a su tercer bb y el dinero los utilizo para esos gastos.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaías G. has been employed by UNAN (National Autonomous University of Nicaragua) for 20 years as a security guard. This will be the second loan he has received from CEPRODEL. Isaías is married and the father of three children, of whom one is attending school. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase land so that he can start building a home. His previous loan was a great help since it was used when his wife gave birth to their third child. The money was used to pay for the related expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín T. S., tiene 34 años de edad, nació en Baja Verapaz, pero ahora vive en la ciudad de Guatemala, es soltero y no tiene hijos, asiste a una iglesia cristiana.
Joaquín se dedica a cortar pelo desde hace 7 años, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 5 años, don Joaquín es una persona humilde y trabajadora. El sueño de don Joaquín es tener herramientas nuevas y poder tener un empleado porque el cree que sus clientes aumentan cada mes, y esto le permitira tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Joaquín T. S. is 34 years old, single, has no children, and attends a Christian church. He was born in Baja Verapaz, but now lives in Guatemala City.

Joaquín has been cutting hair for seven years and has owned his business for the past five years. He is a humble and hardworking person. His dream is to acquire new equipment and hire an employee because he believes his clientele is growing every month. He hopes this will result in more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new & modern equipment

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Berta E. tiene una mini-pulperia en su casa de habitación  vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevo, gaseosa, pan y tomate la tiene en su casa por que asi tiene tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos ya que tiene 3 niñas mujeres menor de edad, las tres en edad escolar, es casada su esposo trabaja para una institución financiera de vigilante, y si los crédito que ha tenido con nosotros le han ayudado mucho ya que se ha ayudado en terminar de hacer su casa y mantener su ventesita, el dinero los solicita para compra de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha E. has a mini-market in her house where she sells rice, beans, sugar, eggs, sodas, bread, and tomatoes. This allows her to stay at home so that she can take care of her three daughters who are in school and financially dependent on her. Her husband works as a security guard at a financial institution.

Her previous loans have been a great help to Bertha in finishing her house and maintaining her small store. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase grain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella  estudio superior completo, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Sabina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne de alpaca, cordero, res, porcino, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar su capital y agrandar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de préstamo, las reuniones, y la alegría que se comparte con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina has been a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank for two years. She lives in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. Sabina is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She completed her college education and earns a living by buying and selling meat.

Sabina says the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy alpaca meat, lamb, beef, pork, etc. Her dreams are to increase her capital and expand her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the simplicity of her loans, the meetings, and the joy of sharing with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various kinds of meat

loans.name: Kenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Kenia R. C. es comerciante tiene venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos ambulante vende en una comarca  se llama San Cristóbal y San José de la Montaña, el crédito lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de ropa nueva y cosméticos, ya es el decimo crédito con nosotros  excelente cliente. Y si le han ayudado mucho los crédito que ha tenido ya que ha incrementado su clientela y a podido construir su casa, es casada tiene 2 hijos todos en edad escolar
texts.en:
Sra. Kenia R. C. is a traveling merchant who sells new clothing and cosmetics in the regions of San Cristóbal and San José de la Montaña. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy new clothing and cosmetics. This will be her tenth loan and she has demonstrated that she is an excellent client. Her loans have helped her greatly with increasing her customer base and building her house. Kenia is married and has two children who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal EL BUEN SAMARITANO está conformado por 13 socios. Los socios están iniciando su tercer ciclo en la Asociación Arariwa. Los socios se consideran trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, los socios viven en la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad D. Urubamba se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos D. la Ciudad del Cusco. Los socios tienen diferentes negocios como la venta D. condimentos, venta D. comestibles, venta D. verduras, venta D. jugos D. fruta y venta D. animales menores, otros socios brindan servicios D. bar, carpintería metálica, peluquería y costurería. Los socios que tienen negocios D. venta D. verduras están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los precios D. las verduras han subido. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que el caudal del rió Vilcanota aumentara y se desbordara afectando los cultivos y dejando perdidas considerables. 
    
Prudencia es socia del banco comunal el Buen Samaritano, tiene 56 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos que ya no depenD. D. ella. Prudencia es natural D. la ciudad D. Anta D. la comunidad D. Chinchaypucllo y desD. hace 20 años que vive en la ciudad D. Urubamba. Prudencia se dedica a la venta D. verduras como arbejas, zanahoria y cebolla. Ya son dos años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Prudencia requiere el préstamo para comprar 30 a 20 sacos D. verduras.

Carolina es una joven madre que tiene 25 años D. edad, es casada, tiene dos hijas Zadith y Juliana. La socia Carolina se dedica a la costura donD. arregla pantalones,  faldas, camisas, etc. Ella desD. el año 2007 tiene su propio puesto D. negocio en el mercado modelo D. Urubamba donD. trabaja. El crédito que la socia Carolina solicita es para revestir su domicilio.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Buen Samaritano” (The Good Samaritan) consists of thirteen members who are starting their third loan cycle with Asociación Arariwa. They are hardworking individuals who look for every opportunity to get ahead and strive to proviD. their children a better future. The members live in the city of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco. It is a city that is characterized by its beautiful landscapes, its agriculture, and its livestock. Urubamba is located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members have different businesses selling condiments, groceries, vegetables, fruit juices, and small animals. Others proviD. services such as bartending, metalwork, hair styling, and sewing. The members who have businesses selling vegetables are concerned that their sales will decline because vegetable prices are getting higher. Heavy rains for three consecutive days over Cusco have caused the Vilcanota River to overflow, impacting crops and causing severe losses.

Prudencia is a member of the Communal Bank “El Buen Samaritano”. She is 56 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two grown children. Prudencia is a native of the community of Chinchaypucllo in the city of Anta, but she has been living in Urubamba for the last twenty years. She sells vegetables such as peas, carrots, and onions. Her business has been in existence for two years and she has done very well because of her commitment to her work. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy 20-30 sacks of vegetables.

Carolina is a young mother who is 25 years of age, married, and has two daughters, Zadith and Juliana. She is a seamstress who mends pants, skirts, shirts, and other articles of clothing. Since 2007 she has owned a place of business at the standard market in Urubamba where she works. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her house.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in their businesses & homes

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar G. A. es comerciante tiene una línea de ropa nueva su clientela es de carretera vieja León, el dinero los solicita para capital de trabajo compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa interior excelente cliente. Y si los créditos le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido conservar su negocio y hacer algunas mejora en su casa. Es casado es padre de 2 niños en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar G. A. is a merchant who has a line of new clothing that he sells to customers who live along the Vieja León Highway. The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and undergarments. He is an excellent client and his loans have helped him stay in business and make improvements to his home. Oscar is married and the father of two school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and undergarments

loans.name: Luby

texts.es: La Sra. Luby Ríos C. es comerciante vende ropa nueva ambulante en san pablo, san Cristóbal y san José de la montaña, el dinero los solicita una parte para invertirlo en el negocio y otra para compra materiales para remodelar su casa ya es el decimo crédito con Ceprodel y si le han impacto mucho ya que su negocio a crecido y su casa la mejorado, es casada tiene 3 niños en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Luby she sells new clothing on foot in San Pablo, San Cristóbal, and San José de la Montaña. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business. She will also use part of the money to make improvements to her home. This will be her 10th loan through Ceprodel and this has helped her improve her business and her home. She is married and has three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es soltero, tiene 31 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el  caserío Casa Blanca del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pavos desde hace seis años. El cría los pavos en los exteriores de su casa para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona donde vive. También los vende a sus vecinos. Este negocio le provee los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su hogar.

José desea mejorar la calidad de los pavos que ofrece en venta, por ello se ha propuesto comprar alimento balanceado para aves, con el cual sus pavos tendría una mejor acogida en el mercado. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es un joven responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir creciendo como empresario para apoyar a sus padres y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Casa Blanca in the District of Mórrope, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been selling turkeys for the past six years. He raises the birds outside of his home and sells them to traders who pass through the area. In addition, he sells turkeys to his neighbors. This business has provided the income necessary to cover his personal expenses and maintain his household.

José hopes to improve the quality of the turkeys that he sells. He proposes to buy nutritional feed for his turkeys to make them more attractive when sold at the market. For this reason, he is applying for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 soles so that he can achieve his goal.

He is a responsible young man who is very devoted to his family and his work. His neighbors and acquaintances have much respect for him. José’s greatest wish to continue growing his business so that he can support his parents and provide them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional feed for his turkeys

loans.name: Diego Alcalas

texts.es: El señor Diego tiene el negocio de venta de zapato en el mercado, el crédito lo utilizara para la inversión al negocio y a si poder incrementar su inventario y tener una mayor ganancia para darle a su familia lo que necesitan el señor Diego antes de tener el negocio era trabajador de otra tienda, y empezó su negocio con un crédito pequeño y a si poco a poco lo ha ido incrementando el es padre de dos niños y por ellos es todo el sacrificio que hace en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Diego sells shoes in the marketplace. He will use the money from this loan to invest in his business and increase his inventory. He wants to increase his income in order to better provide for his family who depend on him. Prior to starting this business, he used to work in a different store. He started his business with a small loan and he grew it little by little. He is the father of two children, for whom he sacrifices and works.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
María Laura tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y vive junto a su esposo en el sector Angolo II, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 14 años, ella nos comenta que esta es una de las actividades más comunes en la zona y que es de mucha ayuda para solventar los gastos familiares de los hogares debido a que la mayoría de hombres se dedican al trabajo agrícola y este no les ofrece suficientes ingresos.

María Laura es consciente de que debe seguir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar. Por ello hace un año instaló también una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Estos negocios son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un créidto de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

María Laura es una mujer responsable, activa y muy emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les asegure un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Laura is 30 years old, is married, and has 5 children in her care. She lives together with her husband in sector Angolo II, Mórrope district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. María Laura has worked raising animals for 14 years. She tells us that this is one of the most common activities of the zone, and is a great help in meeting the household costs, owing to the fact that the majority of men work in agriculture and this doesn't offer sufficient earnings. María Laura is conscious that she must continue to move forward and support her husband in maintaining their home. Because of this, one year ago she also installed a small grocery store in her home. These businesses are a great help to the family's economy. María Laura wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals, but doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action. For this reason for the first time she saw a need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuveos soles, which will permit her to achieve her objective. María Laura is a responsible woman, active and very hard-working. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education which will assure them of a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to increase business

loans.name: Mercidiths Dominguez Group

texts.en:
Merciditha D., age 53, is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Merciditha is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is collectively responsible for paying back the loans of her fellow group member if the other party is delinquent or defaults.

Merciditha is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Merciditha operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Merciditha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She aspired to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Most recently, Merciditha has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Merciditha is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be put to the same business purpose. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Merciditha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Vicenta Ferminia

texts.es: La señora Vicenta Fermina T. T. cuenta con 20 años, casada, viven con su familia materna, en la actualidad ella tiene el oficio de Costurera “Costurar delantales Típicos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar más materia prima, ya que los encargos que se le hace  requiere de más materia prima para poder cubrir la demanda de su producto, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda ella podrá mejorar su producción, como también mejorará sus ingresos y así  podrá mejorar la  condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Vicenta Fermina T. T. is 20, married, lives with her mom's side of the family, she currently works as a seamstress making "typical aprons". She approached the ASDIR association for a small loan to be able to buy more materials, because the orders that are made require more material to be able to meet the demand of her product, with this small loan she will be able to increase production, as well as have better income and be able to improve her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to make aprons

loans.name: Felicisima Apale Group

texts.en:
Felicisima A. is a 49-year-old married woman with 5 school-age children from the village of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Felicisima is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member in the event that the other borrower is delinquent or defaults on the loan. The official name of this borrowing group is the Felicisima A. Group.

To make a living, Felicisima owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. Specifically, she sells fresh fish to her local community members. Felicisima has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities. In 2005, Felicisima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to improve her standard of living and her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Felicisima has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Felicisima is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 4,500 PHP ($350), which will be used to acquire an additional fishing boat. This loan would be the ninth loan taken out by Felicisima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen microfinance model.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing a fishing boat

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio T. is a 46-year-old widower with 1 school-age child from the village of Calube. To earn a living, Rogelio works in the retail sector. Specifically, he runs a general store, where he sells a variety of different products to his local community members. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 1999, Rogelio joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, he was able to improve his standard of living and his ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has already successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rogelio is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP ($1,100), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the eighteenth loan taken out by Rogelio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen microfinance model.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.en:
Emeterio W. is a 58-year-old widower with 2 adult-age children from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Emeterio owns and operates a service business. Specifically, he runs a motor-transport business. Emeterio has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2006, Emeterio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, he was able to improve his standard of living and his ability to engage in business activities. Emeterio has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emeterio is requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 16,100 PHP ($375), which will be used to repair his existing vehicle. Notably, this loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Emeterio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised of mostly farmers, fishermen/women and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve his business by making repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Joesel

texts.en:
Joesel P., age 27, is from the village of Panay Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Joesel is married and has a small child. To make a living, Joesel raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joesel has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Joesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Most recently, Joesel has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joesel is requesting a new loan amount of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Joesel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
