Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his rice-cultivation efforts

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida D. is from the city of Dona Consuelo, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old. Aida is married and has four school-aged children. To earn a living, Aida owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Aida has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her current vehicle so that it can provide better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit-offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair current vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Jenesil's Group

texts.en:
Jenesil A. is from Bocator Village, Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Jenesil is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jenesil is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jenesil owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jenesil has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jenesil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenesil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jenesil is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jenesil from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta M. is from the village of Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur Provice. She is 43 years old. Crisanta is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella D. C. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur Province. She is 40 years old. Stella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Stella owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, noodles, salt, eggs, soy sauce, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Stella has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Stella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard Anthony

texts.es:
Richard L. A. de 22 años de edad vive en casa de su madre quien lo apoya en todo ella a veces trabaja en los fundos ellos viven en Caserío Los Pollitos – Cachiche - Ica 
El es moto taxista desde hace 4 años antes alquilaba una mototaxi diariamente trabajándola desde las 6.30 am hasta las 7.00pm pero actualmente se ha logrado financiar una mototaxi propia y eso le genera un ingreso mayor con el cual puede ayudar a su madre
EL solicita el financiamiento ya que con el terremoto se cayo su casa y actualmente el estado esta dando bonos a los damnificados pero tienen que realizar un deposito en una entidad financiera como una inicial por eso él desea que el sueño de su madre de tener su casa de material noble se lleve a cabo. 
Es una persona bien responsables que goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Richard L. A., age 22, lives in his mother’s house. She supports him in everything, and she sometimes works on the farms. They live in the Los Pollitos neighborhood in Cachiche-Ica. He is a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver. Four years ago he rented a mototaxi, and he worked with it daily from 6:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Now he has been able to finance his own mototaxi. This generates greater income, which he can use to help his mother. He is asking for a loan because his house fell with the earthquake. The state is currently giving vouchers for the damages, but they need to make a deposit in a financial institution as a down payment. He wants to make his mother’s dream of having a house from sturdy material come true. He is a very responsible person who enjoys good references from his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fixed assets

loans.name: Mario Carlos

texts.es:
La Sr. Mario Carlos García Peña tiene 40 años de edad vive con su tia en y en casa de sus abuelos en el pueblo joven Sr de Luren – Ica el sr. tiene un hijo mayor de edad al cual apoya en todas necesidades, el le apoya en sus estudios ya que él es bien responsable con sus obligaciones y desea que su hijo sea cada dia mejor.
El cuenta con un carro propio el cual lo trabaja diariamente y cuenta con una mototaxi que la da a trabajar todo esto ha sido obtenido gracias a su esfuerzo.
El sr. desea que le apoyemos con un nuevo financiamiento para poder arreglar una de sus herramientas de trabajo como es la mototaxi ya que por motivos de mantenimiento no la puede dar a trabajar continuamente entonces desea seguir obteniendo ese segundo ingreso que le permite apoyar a su hijo.
El Sr. tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y su sueño es que mas adelante desea comprarse dos carros mas para seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Mario Carlos García Peña is 40 years old. He lives with his aunt in his grandparents’ house in Pueblo Joven Sr. de Luren in Ica. He has a grown son who he helps with all of the necessities. He helps his son with his education because he is very responsible with his obligations, and he wants his son to improve everyday. He has his own car, which he uses to work everyday. He also has a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) which he puts to work. This has all been obtained thanks to his effort. He wants us to help him with a new loan to be able to fix one of his work tools, the mototaxi. He cannot put it to work continually due to maintenance issues. He wants to keep getting this second income that allows him to help his son. He has good references from his neighbors. His dream is to later buy two more cars in order to keep growing as a small businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fixed assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for self-publishing, advertising costs and website creation

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai M. and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Mak, have been married since 1992 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and the other one is still young. Besides his children, he also has an old mother living with him. They are living in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mai M. is a construction worker, while his wife has been selling fish for more than 17 years. She buys the fish from Chbar Ampov market for resale at Takhmao market. Because his children commute to school far away, they used to take the motor remoque (a motorcycle with a trailer on the back) and motor taxi very often. Taking a remoque to school was expensive for the family, hence Mai is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.name: Juan Grabiel

texts.es:
El sr. Juan R. Q. de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos también tienen una nieta la cual ellos cuidan diariamente ellos viven en el Caserio de Pinillas - Ocucaje.
El sr. Trabaja desde hace 10 años en el transporte anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa actualmente trabaja en un carro alquilado siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una muy responsable.
El sr. Trabaja diariamente desde las 6.30am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años
El goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien trabajadora.
El desea el financiamiento para poder poner en regla sus documentos como lo es su brevete y otros documentos que le son necesario para su trabajo diario.
El sueño de los sres es poder lograr que el ultimo de sus hijos sea profesional por eso estan constantemente trabajando.
texts.en:
Juan R. Q. is 39, and he lives in his own house with his wife and their children. He also has a granddaughter that they take care of everyday. They live in the village of Pinillas – Ocucaje. He has been working in transportation for ten years. He previously worked for a business. He currently works in a rented car. He has always been characterized as being very responsible. He works every day from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 pm for a collective, and he has been driving along the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past five years. He enjoys good references from his neighbors who say that he is a very hard-worker. He wants the loan to be able to put his documents, like his driver’s license and other documents that are necessary for his daily work, in order. His dream is to be able to have the last of his children become a professional. That is why he is constantly working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fixed assets

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Colector del distrito D. San José, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.                                                                                             
Se dedica a la ganadería desD. hace más D. siete años, cría vacas para comercializar la leche que estas producen, actualmente tiene tres vacas en producción, las cuales le producen un promedio D. 26 litros diarios, los que venD. a una empresa acopiadora a un precio D. 0.90 céntimos el litro.

Adicionalmente cría ovejas y cuyes para venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente recorren la zona. Ella nos comenta que estos negocios le ayudan a solventar los gastos familiares, ya que lo que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no es suficiente para sostenerlos.

Maximina se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la refacción del techo D. su vivienda, ya que las lluvias D. esta temporada veraniega ha causado estragos en el.

Ella es una madre trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una adecuada educación. En la fotografía Maximina nos muestra una D. las ovejas que cría, ya que sus vacas se encontraban pastando en un terreno alejado del lugar.
texts.en:
Maximina is 44 and married. She lives with her husband and their four children in the Colector sector in the San José district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chilayo. She has been working with livestock for over six years. She raises cows in order to sell the milk that they produce. She currently has three cows that produce milk. They produce an average of 23 liters daily. She sells them to a wholesale business for the price of 0.90 céntimos per liter. She also raises sheep and guinea pigs to sell to the merchants who visit the area. She tells us that these businesses help her pay the family expenses. What her husband receives as a farm worker is not enough to support them. Maximina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to use it to repair the roof of her house. The summer rains have wreaked havoc on it. She is a hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to get her children ahead and give them an adequate education. In the photograph Maximina is showing us one of the sheep she is raising because the cows are grazing in a remote field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna V., 25, is single and a farmer. He lives with his parents in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. Besides farming, he also rents his rice threshing machine to the villagers for extra income. Vanna was not available for this picture so his parents are pictured instead.

Vanna is requesting his first loan of US$1,000 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm. He also will use part of the loan to buy a new rice threshing machine to replace the old one.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mr. Suy D. is 53 years old and lives in Pech Changva Village, Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pin Aom, are farmers. Although they try to work hard on the farm they still earn less income than they need to support the family. Thus, Mr. Suy D. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase ten pigs and some pig feed for pig breeding. With this loan, their income will increase and the family will benefit too. The couple has four children. One of them is a farmer who supports the parents' farm, another is a pig breeder, while the other two are students at the local school. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase ten pigs and a supply of pig feed.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov L., age 31, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Hoem (pictured together), age 29, have been married since 2001 and have three children: two daughters and one son. All of them are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pov has been driving a motor taxi for seven years, while his wife has been selling clothes for six months. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to motor "remoque" taxi, because it could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. A remoque is a motorbike with a trailer attached to the back.

Therefore, Pov is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a trailer and buy clothes for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and buy clothes for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor L. is 51 years old. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is an iron welder while the other one is a student in the local school. They all live in Thlok Doung Tum Village, Takeo Province.

Mrs. Nhor L. is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Although they work hard at her business, she still does not earn enough income to support her family well. In order to increase her income, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes the family's situation will improve.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Marlid

texts.es:
La Sra. C. Saldaña Marlid de 22 años de edad, vive en el Asentamiento Oscar Sánchez Dulanto  - Cercado de Ica ella vive con su esposo quien es mototaxista y tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad ellos viven en casa de su madre de ella quien es obrera de campo.
Los sres han construido una parte de la casa que le han dado ya que con el terremoto se quedaron sin casa y nuevamente se están superando.
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y aguas minerales en el cruce de Puente Blanco y Divino Maestro- Ica (Panamericana Sur) en la temporada de verano desde hace 4 años y en invierno trabaja en el campo como obrera es una persona bien responsable.
Los conyuges desean que le apoyemos para que la sra pueda invertir mas en el negocio y al mismo tiempo mejorar su vivienda ya que su anhelo es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
C. Saldaña Marlid is 22, and she lives in Asentamiento Oscar Sánchez Dulanto near Ica. She lives with her husband, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver. They have a three year old son, and they live in her mother’s house. She is a field worker. They have built part of the house they were given. They were given the house because they were left without a house due to the earthquake. They are getting ahead once again. She sells soft drinks and mineral water at the Puente Blanco and Divino Maestro-Ica (South Pan-American) crossing. She has been selling in the summertime for four years. In the winter she works in the field. She is a very responsible person. The couple wants us to help them so that she is able to invest more in the business and improve their house at the same time. Her goal is to give her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Elena Tag-Ulo Group

texts.en:
Elena T. is from the village of Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Elena is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elena is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elena raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 36 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. Elena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure
